Brunatne piwo o średniej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postacie pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat intensywny, wędzony dla mnie przypominający oscypka. W smaku także pierwsze skrzypce gra intensywna wędzonka plus słodycz. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie klasyka gatunku i chyba nic więcej nie trzeba dodawać.

Wow, so much to say about this beer.

As soon as you open it you can smell smoked wood. Almost like a smoked cheese or bacon aroma.

Pours a dark brown colour. Next to no head.

Taste is smooth with no aftertaste. The smoke flavour really come through. Not too heavy.

Good amount of carbonation. Silky smooth on the tongue.

Overall I was very impressed. I had check the rating on this beer prior to purchasing, and i wasnt disappointed. I will make a point of purchasing this one again.

MB

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 Brown color with amber highlight and a nice tan head. Smoky bacon aroma, lightly toasted malts beneath. Taste is lightly smoky, more of the sweetish malts, nice balance with a herbal feeling. Texture is silky and the beer feels lighter than expected. A classic, which has become one of my beloved favourites over time. Bartlebier calls it a "masterpiece in character and simplicity", and I absolutely agree. Score went up from 3.6-3.7 (projected from my feeling when I first tried it, I did not rate back then) to 4.1 (second time, first time rating) and 4.4 (8-5-9-5-17) (most other times I?ve had it) so far. Can?t wait to have this from the wood at Schlenkerla, hopefully soon!
Wooden barrel in Munich at 500 years of Reinheitsgebot Fest. Less carbonation and even more harmony than the bottled version. Yup. This is a 5. Nothing more to say.

EDIT: A few more times from the wood at the source. I stand by my 5.
From elcervecero. In Paulaner glass. Playing Bit Adventure. Smells and tastes like tobacco. Couldnt finish. Like drinking and smoking at same time. Taste improves with nose covered
Liquid campfire! I love this kind of beer. It sure is smokey, and lovely. Smoke on the nose and some caramel, taste: smoke.
En rigtig øl! Smag af røget ål, og en smag af det samme, det er en enten kan lide eller ej-øl.

Uniquely exotic and more sophisticated than its critics give it credit for, this most renowned rauchbier in the world provides a distinctive and enjoyable Marzen experience featuring the classic Bamberg smokiness that defines this style. From an imported bottle, this beer pours a rich caramel brown color with a generous khaki-white foamy head, looks more like a solid marzen than most marzens I have seen, impressive appearance. The aroma gives off a strong and blunt "smoked ham" flavor that may be understandably off-putting to some, but this overt and overwhelming smokiness does not carry over into the flavor, which to be sure has a strong smoky element but without the meaty ham notes. Indeed, the flavor reveals an excellent interplay of smoky and classic caramel malty notes, along with some subtle cocoa in the finish. Truly, other than in the aroma, the smokiness is not overpowering and allows the classic marzen flavors to show through. A delightful culinary experience overall.

From bottle at Tolkiens House in Zagreb with TO 07.10.15. Clear copper. Diminishing pale brown head. Fantastic aroma and taste of smoked sausages and tar that you would find in the keel of old wooden boats. Crisp mouthfeel making it easy to drink.
Cerveja produzida a partir de malte defumado, com aroma marcado de fumaça. Cerveja de corpo moderado e paladar arredondado. Cerveja bastante escura.

Bottle from the SAQ. Poured into a pint glass, light brown with a thin beige head. As expected, smoke dominated the aroma, with sweet maltiness and even a bit of fruit showing up afterward. Smoke remained on the finish. Fantastic pairing with the applewood-smoked ribs I had it with!

Had the Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Weizen a few weeks ago, so decided to try this one. The lady in Glug was at pains to stress that this is a full-on smokebeer Poured into an English pint. Dark ruby red, with a thin off-white skim. Aroma of smoked meat, or more accurately smoky bacon crisps. I love the way the smokiness dominates but doesnt overwhelm, and allows some background fruitiness through, while the palate manages to suggest creaminess. Would be delicious with something gamey involving paprika.

500 ml bottle from Beervana, thanks to my lovely wife, Natalia. Pours a clear mahogany color with crimson hues and a big, beautiful creamy, lingering light-tan head which leaves a gorgeous lacing. Fantastic, superb smokey aroma with some dense bready and woody maltiness. Huge notes of smoked ham, bacon, tar, bbq sauce, roast beef, oak wood and peaty Islay single-malt whisky. Nice hints of Lapsang Souchong tea and Pumpernickel rye bread. Taste is not as heavy-driven as the aroma but its a powerhouse on its own. Bitter, and smokey, almost roasty, with very low sweetness and a soft tart touch. Smoke dominates by far, with woody maltiness and very faint hops. Massive smokey aftertaste. Similar to what you get after a BBQ with good beef pieces. Medium body, it lacks maybe a more heavy, creamy texture. It has just the right amount of carbonation. Good. Great even. An excellent German Smoked Märzen but I think the Weizen has more balance and is more drinkable.

Bottled - Smoky, burnt, woody aromas, no hop notes. Dark brown colour, beautiful, long life beige head. Medium malty sweetness with some noble hop taste. Smoked ham and bacon taste is very heavy, maybe too much. Not an easy drinkable one, but its really exciting. Medium body, medium carbonation, smoky finish with a hint of oak. Very tasty, but its a bit too smoky.

(In Bavaria from 2012 notes).
Note at the outset that, as a whole, rauch beers are not my favorites and that they too often seem to me to have too much smoke flavor. This particular version is certainly above average and great looking, but does border on too much smoke flavor. In this case, my objection is more the masking of the other flavors rather than the sheer quantity of smokiness. 

The clear brown body has a lasting tan head that leaves exceptional lacing. As suggested above, the aroma is very smokey; ominously so IMO. Fortunately, there is proportionately less smoke in the flavor and some malt and light spice shows. Still, the primary impression is more similar to smoked meat than to a typical lager. 

M: medium body; Medium+ carbonation. 

O: nice, Bamberg style brew.
From the bottle, pours pitch black with beige head. Nose of rich smoke, kinda imba. Taste is heavy smoke, caramell and Toast. Smoky finish... Overrated...
Bottiglia da 0,5. Color marrone scuro, Ha sentori di caffe tostato e soprattutto un evidente sapore di plastica bruciata.

Aroma is smoke, bacon, sweet, possibly wheat. Appearance is dark golden, white head. Taste is a mess, clove and banana mixed with smoke and bacon. Mouthfeel is thin and light, unpleasant. Overall, not great.
Bottle. Pours dark chestnut with low tanned head. Aroma is metwurst, tar, and brown sugar. Taste is malty, smokey, tobacco and bacon.
Bottle. Coca-cola color with white head. Aroma - Malts, campfire, caramel. Taste - Tobacco, caramel, dark fruit.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear, reddish brown, beige medium size lacing head. Smoky aroma, sausage, bacon, dark sugar. Medium carbonated, light, smooth slightly watery mouth feel. The taste has smoky notes, but less than in the aroma. Bacon, sausage, raw cane sugar, soy sauce, cardamom.

Dark reddish color with beige head. Very smoky aroma, like a campfire. Smoked ham, bacon and dark fruits. Smoke is not so dominant on taste but smooth and easy to drink. Finishes with smokey taste.Great and well balanced beer
From a half litre bottle. Pours a brown-black with light carbonation. Nose of smoked lunchmeat. Smoky taste, finish of curing spices. My first beer of this style. Definitely unique.

Bottle 0.5l. Dark amber with big beige head. Very nice smoked aroma with notes of bacon, some minerals and lots of smokiness. Very smoked flavor, sweetish with notes of bacon and sausage, some spiciness and roastiness, sourish with lingering dry smoked finish. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied. Such a great smokiness.

Billowy foam, dark with a reddish hue. Full-medium body. Creamy, sticky texture with fairly lively carbonation. Long dry finish. The aroma is smokey of course, kind of like bacon. Its also sweet, a little woody, and toast-like. No hops. Flavor is a little sweet, some bitterness, slightly acidic, but balanced. The smoke isnt overpowering, its a very balanced beer that reminds me of walking through the woods and smelling the smoke from a cabins fire.

Bottle at home. Thx Dolle! Pours Dark amber with a off-white head. Aroma of smoke, malts, bit sweet, light fresh wood. Taste is malts, with a fresh wood, light smoked meat, smokey. Very enjoyable and fresh!

Bottle.
Dark drown hints of red., brown small head.
Aroma of smoke, salty ham, syrup.
Taste sweet smoke, some bitterness.
A bit flat finish, but balanced.
Klares dunkelrot mit reichlich Schaum. Rauchmalz, etwas Speck mit einer dezent bitteren Note, sehr süffig.

My first smoked beer
-Big amount of smoked meat is tasted first
-Typical Märzen flavors then follow like dark fruits (plums,Feigs,dates),big malts
-Nice,hoppy finish
-carbonation couldve been a little more

Pretty awesome shit,esp. for lunch/dinner
-Beer gets more awesome with every sip

500 ml bottle. Very smoked smell of course, but not nice in my opinion. Dark coffe beer with a white head. Smoked taste and palate all over! Personaly i prefered the other one I tried from this company, this is just too much for me.

Pours dark brown with beige pretty head. In aroma smoky, campfire style, sweet, fruity, bready. In taste smoky, malty sweet with fruits notes andlow to mdium herbal bitterness. Medium body, drinkable and tasty.
Tastes of bacon smoke, and woody. Soft palate huge smoke finish. Drinkable despite the overwhelming nature.
Zwart bier met stevig schuim. Smaak is romig, rookachtig en licht bitter met aparte, niet te definieren maar prettige bijsmaak. Gedronken van het vat in restaurant te Forchheim.

Nase: kräftiger geräucherter Schinken, Malz; Geschmack: süßer Rauch und Malz, runde Hopfenbitterung ~ ~

Aroma: smoked ham, malt; Taste: smoke and malty sweet, suitable bitterness

Bottle. Slightly hazy amber brown with a big beige head. Lovely smoky aroma, with toasted grains and caramel notes. Taste of sweet malt, smoked bacon, caramel, some bitterness, a bit too sweet. Relatively low body, still very good beer, great food pairings.

Bottled sample at Beers 2015. Served slightly too warm. Body is brownish-orange. Strong smoked aroma and flavor. Mouth feel is creamy and full. carbonation is soft. Tastes pleasantly slightly sweet. Flavors of smoked fish (not fishy!), malt. Nice and very interesting. The smokiness is not overwhelming at all.

When it comes to smoked beers or rauchbiers as theyre called in Germany, Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Märzen is probably the king of them. Ive been drinking good beer for many years but for whatever reason I never got around to this one until now. Im sorry I did because this isnt just some novelty brew, its a legitimate, well-rounded and well-crafted beer.

I poured a 500ml bottle into a nonic pint glass. There was no freshness date and it cost $4.99 ($0.30 per ounce).

Appearance: Seemingly dark brown but actually a pretty shade of mahogany. Pours to a two-finger, beige, foamy head which laces and retains well.

Smell: A meaty smoke scene; similar to that of a campfire. A hint of sweetness as well.

Taste: Theres a lot going on in this palette, which is surprising for two reasons. First of all, this is a Märzen, which is the same as an Oktoberfest lager and that style isnt known for being complex or full of flavor. Secondly, its a rauchbier and the smoke tends to override the rest of the palette. This is more than simply a smokey lager, though. Theres a nice taste of dark malts throughout the first half. Lightly confectionery-tasting and a bit nutty. Through the middle I detect a surprisingly strong chocolate presence, which becomes stronger on the finish. The smoke is noticeable right away, but it really emerges on the finish. It adds a light bitterness and a bit of astringency. It actually seems to hold all these flavors together and transition between them very well. Im impressed by how it all works together.

Drinkability: Im sure plenty of newbies might have trouble getting used to the taste of this beer, but seasoned drinkers will not. The mouthfeel isnt quite as crisp as I was expecting; it drinks more like a strong ale with a full body and slightly tepid mouthfeel. The flavors dont linger, however, which is nice. At 5.2% ABV its got enough body so that a single pint is quite satisfying.

RATING: 8/10

Sundae evening brew. Deep brown pour. Nose of hickory smoked bacon which I had for breakfast today as well. Tastes of bacon smoke, malt, cola, licorice, hi t of chocolate, and woody. Soft palate huge smoke finish. Drinkable despite the overwhelming nature.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 WYGLĄD: Barwa bursztynowa, zmętnione. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości. 
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Oczywiście spora wędzoność. W tle słody i trochę ziół.
SMAK: Słodowość. Posmak wędzono-ziołowy. Goryczka niska, krótka.

500 ml bottle BB 07/2015 from a trade with Werckmeister, thanks!
Dark copper body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, beige head.
Aroma of smokey wood, bacon, oak, caramel, dark berries, some toast.
Taste follows this, with some more subtle hops.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes smokey, wooden, a bit sweet malty, a bit roasty.

Very nice. The smoke and oak notes are really enoyable, just how I like a smoked beer. A bit too light bodied for my taste though, on the other hand pretty easy to drink. Overall a very characterful beer.

Aroma has smoke. Smoke and vanilla. The smoky flavor is slightly woody in its character. Flavor is nice and smooth with a nice mouthfeel. Flavor has a smoky caramely character. Slight bacon, very moreish. Very nicely balanced. Not too much smoke. Id buy this again!
Bra val för den som vill dricka en skinka. hyfsad med fransk korv. Sb internetbeställning

The aroma is pronounced smoky and somewhat reminiscent of good smoked sausage or smoked eel. Maybe not so nice when you associate it with beer. The foam is nice and persistent and as a whole exudes the high quality. It tastes quite short of something malt sweetness, but the smoke soon takes over with and light hoppy aftertaste is also in the end, but a smoky sensation left in the mouth. It tastes really quite fine. I think that more than one Schlenkerla being too sickly to enjoy.

Wowww! S P E T T A C O L A R E! Ho sempre bevuto la versione botiglia di questa birra ma adesso la mia recensione va x la spina. Scura con schiuma beige. Al naso note di fumo intense. In bocca corpo medio leggero molto ben bilanciata e beverina. Una birra di stagione leggera e dal sapore molto speciale affumicato "scamorza liquida". Molto consigliata agli amanti del genere Rauch

Bottle from Blackrock cellar. Pours dark brown with red hues with off white wispy head, nice legs. Lots of smoked ham, oak, earth. Sweet caramel malts with smoky ham, tobacco, oak, dark fruit flavour. Plenty going on and a nice smoked beer.

Tap. Pours clear mahogany with creamy beige head. Aroma has loads of meaty smoke, dry oak, bacon, sweet bready malts, some toast and slight salmiak. Sweet toasty malts, bread, then turns really smoky, dry oak, bacon, fat meaty body and slight toasty crisp finish. Long lasting smoke. Just a classic!
My favourite smoke beer, strong smoke bbq flavor you can almost smell the grill.
Aroma of sweetish malts, lots of smoked ham, caramel. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a light bittersweet finish. Like most of the others from this brewery, a very good Smoked beer.
Aroma is campfire and hotdogs. Taste is char, smoke, light creamy caramel malts.

Pours a dark cola-like brown with a huge, fluffy head. Nose is heady and strong like a cooler full of smoked meats. Taste is malty sweet and the smokiness comes through the nose and you'd swear you just had a bite of a smoked brisket sandwich. I didn't think I'd like this. I didn't care for their Urbock, but this is very nice and would pair marvelously with barbecue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Deep amber bronze pour, thin tan head. Nose is smoked meat. Bittersweet. Middle is smoke, dark malt, dried currants, earth. Finish is medium bodied, smooth smoky malt.
Bottle, 50 cl, from Fränky, Fürth. Without doubt smokey features, hints of a smoked sausage. From start, when opening the bottle. Balanced, though.
UPDATED: JUL 1, 2015 Pours amber brown with a lacing light brown head. Meady and smoked aroma. Bacon flavoured and quite smoked.
Rauch beer with marked smoked peaty expression. Pours dark brown with fine head. Balanced sweetness and bitterness. Leather, smoke, chocolate and coffee.
UPDATED: SEP 27, 2016 My personally favourite beer, excellent smoked aroma and taste very much like bacon.
Darkest brown-black color with some foam. The smell is intensely smokey bacon heavy. The taste is a tiny bit watery, well carbonated and smokey malty as well.
Bue en bouteille de 50cl. Bière extrêmement étonnante. Au nez, elle sent la saucisse de morteau. Au palais, on a l'impression de lâcher des lardons.
Brązowe prawie, piana drobna ecru, lacing. Doskonały aromat wędzony. Czyste słodowe w smaku. Wytrawny finisz z krótką goryczką. Wysycenie wysokie.

Toda una experiencia. Color negro, casi opaca. Espuma no abundante. Aroma fuerte a leña. En boca resulta,..pero ese sabor predominante a humo que casi oculta casi todo lo demás... Quizás si uno se acostumbra... no dudo que sea una buena cerveza. Pero ... cuestión de gustos. Prometo insistir

Bottle. Pours a clear deep brown with a fluffy off white head. Aroma is complex, obviously smoky, like smoked meat, BBQ charcoal, some caramel and burnt toast. Taste of roasted malts, smoked meat, wood, burnt toast, charcoal and caramel. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A smoky, roasted bitterness in the finish. The first and the best I tried of this style. Great smoky taste balanced with some caramel sweetness. A wow beer everyone should try, a unique BBQ beer.
Bottle. My first smoke beer. Surprised the heck out of me. My changing palate has gotten away from Marzen beer, but this was enjoyable.
Lovely dark bronze smoked beer. Good hazy body. Tasty malty, herbs and somke.
0,5l fles in bar brouw, zwart met een crème kraag. Geur duidelijk rook met ook zoete tonen zoals toffee en caramel. Smaak is zoet met hopjes in tweede instantie de rook.

STEVE BRUNG THIS BEERS TO SHARE AND ITS COOL BECUASE THEYRE SMOKED HOPS WICH MAKES LESS BITTER BUT HAS SAME IBU. SMELLS SMOOTHE AND LITE LIKE FRUITS AND SPICE WITH SMOOTHE HOPS. TASTES LIKE SAM ADAMS FLAYVER BUT LESS BITTER. THIS IS GOOD WONE TO DRINK AT THE POOL ON A HOT DAY. I WISH THEYRE CANNING IT.

Bottle: Deep, Amber to toffee hue with only a light head and no lace. Smokey, malt, chocolate. A peaty like profile. The ablate is dry, low to moderate bitterness and not sour. Slightly phenolic. Moderate flavor intensity dominated by smoke and roasted flavors. There is a fullness to this beer. Plenary of mouthfeel.

Butelka 0,5 l. Piwo pieknego rubinowo brazowego koloru. Pianka stabilna drobna kolor.Smak mmm wedzonka, bekon troch? sliwki suszonej. Minimalna goryczka potem chmielowe akcenty.Przednie marcowe dymione ze stolicy wedzonek. Wiadomo z Bamberga ;-)
Appear Dark Brown with a small White head. Smokey aroma, light bitter taste, light bitter aftertaste average carbonation,

Pours dark reddish brown, tan rocky head.
Aroma is intense: smoky (bacon) and liquorice.
Savoury, soft and bitter, with a spicy note in the end.
Bottle at The Carnival Tasting, Ulfborg, Denmark 2015-02-28. Hazy amber beer with an offwhite head. Smoked fruity malty aroma. Smokey grassy, bready flavour. A really nice one.

Nearly black, thick, persistent off-white froth, smells like smoked ham, malty.
Medium carbonation, smoky, slightly sweet. Very pleasant.
caramel, bread, smoke, woody, black, hazy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Sabores maltosos y ahumados. Baja en olores. Color oscuro. Cuerpo bajo. Espuma poco persistente.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 Looks lovely in the glass nice oily tongue feel tastes and smells of smoked sausage and charred wood unusual but not entirely for me.

Pours a dark brown with some ruby shining through it. There is a a medium off white head that had good retention and left a lot of lacing. The aroma is smokey, meaty, and bacon. The taste is is very similar to the aroma. I believe it is a little less smokey/meaty compared to the urbock giving it a little more drink ability.

500 ml bottle @ Hair of the Dog Toronto. Pours a dark reddish/brown with a minimal off-white head. Powerful smoke and cured-meat aromas. Umami and campfire smoke dominate the palate. Surprisingly thin body for such huge flavours. Medium to heavy carbonation and a fairly assertive medium smoky finish. Decent beer but not terribly complex. I enjoyed it but probably didn't need the whole 500 ml. Based on the look on my wife's face after trying it it was apparent she wouldn't be helping much!

---Rated via Beer Buddy

When poured into the glass it produces a dense rocky tan head. The beer itself is red-brown coloured. The flavour is rich in smoke, bacon and some hops.
Aromas of smoke, bacon, malt and a little bit of realy dark chocolate, some earthy hops and smoke in the aftertaste. Good carbonation, enough to keep it refreshing. 
Probably THE icon of franconian smoked beer. I can recommend it.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2015 Tap @ fermentoren Aarhus. Pours dark brown amber with a beige head. Aroma of meat, smoked sausages, weak bacon, leather, caramel malts and of course smoke! the taste has lots of umami and meat notes. also some smoked malts, caramel, leather and some dry grainy notes. One of the better smoked beer but I guess this is just not my style...
Dark brown with tan head. Smoke, sausage, caramel and floral. Slick, ash and meaty finish with nice noble hop bite. Overall: Chill incarnated. Very balanced and not as smokey as some say.

Bottle: Taster: 
Creamy head. Ruby brown beer.
Aroma of smoke, bacon, coal, beautiful smokey!
Flavour is malty with bacon, leather, smoke, branch fires...
Aftertaste is smokey, bacon, malty...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Great stuff!Earlier Rating: 11/7/2012 Total Score: 3.5Bottle:
Medium sized light tan colored head, changes quick into a closed lacing on top of a clear dark amber caramel colored beer.
Smell smokey oatmeal, light smokey grains, light smokey hay, light earthy, malty and leather.
Taste smokey grains, some caramel, malts, light bitter, nutty, ligh leather, light hoppy and herby, some more smoke comes through towards the aftertaste. Theres also a bit more of a grainy touch to this Rauchbier.
Aftertaste is malty, smokey, caramel and light bitter with an earthy nutty touch.
Low carbo, soft almost creamy mouthfeel, medium body and a light creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Great smoked smell, dark brown appearance, not quite as smooth and good as their urbock which is amazing..little more tang and crispness on this one...still good but not great..wish finish was maltier and smoother

Strong beautifully & intensely concentrated smoked beer of summer sausage, ham and bacon. Beautiful colour with and acidity which ckpes with all of it. Nose and taste are married well. Greater yhsn yhe summ of its parts. An absolute classic.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2015 Bottle. Is this the mother of all smoked beers? Appearance: dark ruby colour with beige decent foam. Aroma: smoke, bacon, a bit of chocolate, wood. Taste: mainly smoked bacon, also yeast, caramel, sweet toasted malts. Medium carbonation. Absolutely delicious!
Lane na Warszawskim Festiwalu Piwa, ciemna barwa, bogata i dość trwała piana. Wędzone. Pełne. Nisko wysycone. Dość pijakne.

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours dark reddish brown with a medium sized, off white head. Aroma has lots of smoke, leather, meat, bacon, sausage and peat. Taste has a nice sweetness to balance out the smoke, that is less prominent here. Not very dry, but mellow and nice, despite being pretty smoky in the aroma. Avg carb and light, smooth body.

0,50 bottle purchased at the Beertija pub in Rijeka/Fiume and consumed in Opatija/Abbazia - Croatia on a hotel terrace over the sea at night. Pours chestnut honey bright, infinite brownish head lasting. Nose: smoked provola or better mozzarella cheese, hint of bacon, lavender, background of fresh herbal hops. Mouth: medium-soft carbonation, grassy, roasted grains, easy going beer I must say. Dry finish with distinctive bitterness. The regular Rauch is far better tough this rocks too!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beige, frothy head. Fairly persistent. Coppery. Clear. A bit of perlage. Intense and persistent at nose. Smoked at nose. Not very carbonated. Smoke, chocolate, Thin body
Aroma of sweetish malts, lots of smoked ham, caramel. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a light bittersweet finish. Like most of the others from this brewery, a very good Smoked beer.

Purchased from New England Wine & Spirit earlier today. $4.99 ($4.94 + $0.05 container deposit) for the 500 mL bottle. 
  To long-stemmed red wine glass, it pours a violet-tinted chestnut brown with which an off-white fluffy head 1 finger in length stood.
Aromas of barbecue smoke, German noble hops, DME, toasted sesame seeds, and cotton. 
 Tastes much the same with the addition of cracked black pepper, clean European yeast, mulch, and sweat.  More cracked black pepper, beech wood, and charred chicken skin experienced by swallow.
 Wish there was more of a bite to this brew, but this is true to style and was the perfect day-beer with such beautiful weather.

Schöne braunrote Farbe, Schaum ebbt schnell ab, leichter Film bleibt zurück. In der Nase eindeutig Schinken. Im Trunk setzt sich der fort, allerdings nicht zu penetrant, das Malz kommt mit seiner süffigen Süße noch durch und klingt im Abgang noch nach. Perfekt zur Brotzeit.

Dark beer with a small white head, high carbonation.
Taste is very smoky, wood, bacon, caramel and some watery bitter.
Aftertaste is smoky.
Somethings you just shouldnt do. One of them is definately to smoke beer! I just cant drink it... stopped after one sip.

Birra color rosso scuro, limpida, con una schiuma non molto persistente.
Al naso come in bocca si riescono a percepire i malti che rendono la bevuta equilibrata e piacevole, ma è ovviamente l'affumicatura a farla da padrona: ricorda uno speck molto affumicato o una provola.
Corpo medio leggero, va giù che è un piacere.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 La mia prima rauch. affumicatura del malto dà a questa birra un fortissimo aroma e sapore di prosciutto affumicato o pancetta, è particolarissimo ma si beve alla grande! Il colore tende alla tonaca di frate con schiuma beige compatta e persistente. il malto domina con la sua nota dolce e affumicata, solo un leggero finale amarognolo. Molto beverina con un corpo watery.
This is a great example of smoked beer. I dont like smoked beer, even if the label is great.
Bottle @ Michael Svarrer. Aroma of smoke, bacon. Clear brown with off-white head, long lasting. Smoke taste, light+ sweetness. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, smokey finish.

Beautiful ruby color, transparent with a weak head and nice bubbliness.
Smell is smoke, caramel, toffeed apple. Sausage, smoked ham.
Taste is watery bitter with a delicious smoky sweetness. Like having grilled boar with caramelised apple :-) The balance is perfect.

Nice amber pour with a creamy tan head...excellent retention and lacing. Aroma has nice bold smoke...campfire with a bit of bbq. Flavor follows suit...assertively smoky but not overboard...some earthy hoppiness and a light minerally note. Mouthfeel is medium/full and the finish is dry and smoky/earthy hoppy. Awesome.

Kolor: Mocnej herbaty. Piwo jest klarowne.
Piana: Drobnopęcherzykowa, obfita, trwała. Pięknie oblepia szkło.
Aromat: Wędzonka bukowa, zapach grilla, kiełbasy, boczku. Aromat jest przyjemny i dość intensywny. Minimalna nutka żelazista. Na teście skórnym wyłazi ewidentne żelazo.
Smak: Niska goryczka. Mocna wędzonka z domieszką krwi. Żelazo jest niestety wyraźnie wyczuwalne, ale w kombinacji z mocną wędzonką nie przeszkadza. Piwo jest pół-słodkie. Niska goryczka moim zdaniem nie kontruje tej słodyczy w wystarczającym stopniu.
Wysycenie: Średnie - w porządku.
Opakowanie: Ładna etykieta w niemieckim stylu. Minus za brak dokładnych informacji o zasypie, chmieleniu i drożdżach.

Bardzo dobry rauchbier. Jestem trochę zaskoczony obecnością żelaza w piwie. Mimo to jest to jedno z najlepszych piw dymionych jakie miałem okazję pić. Podniósłbym trochę goryczkę dla skontrowania wyraźnej słodyczy, ale to nie zarzut, a jedynie osobiste preferencje. Szczerze polecam.

Wooden keg at Schlenkerla in Bamberg. 

"Smoked beer ... come on, this is going to be terrible."

Yet there I was, so I ordered one with a plate of Limburger cheese. The wooden keg in the corner provided a nice glass with a great volume of foam. Very clear beer coming from a wooden keg I was somewhat surprised. Smell is smoky, but not overly so. Surprisingly drinkable and went perfectly with the cheese, which was served with a sweet vinegar sauce and onions. It was so good I had another for dessert.

Ive had this in bottle before and wasnt a fan, but on tap in Bamberg .... really a great beer.

Keg at Beergeek. In bottles previously. This beer is quite remarkable. I like it in small measures but a whole bottle tends to be too much for me. It pours a clear Amber colour with a beige head. The aroma is striking. Heavy Bamberg smoke which reminds me immediately of Frazzles brand bacon crisps. The flavour is so dominated by the smoke. Its very nice in smaller doses.
Bottle. Brown body tan head. Aroma is smoke some roasted malts. Taste is also roasted malts with some smoke and some dark caramel. Aftertaste is roasted malts with some bitterness. Nice one.
Smoke and tar in aroma. Very pleasant. Clear dark Brown colour. Nice head. Light bitterness, creamy mouthfeel. Lots of taste and a creamy feel combining for a great beer.

Used to drink in this ancient Bamberg gasthaus back in the 1960s with the beer poured right out of the oak casks. Never really a favorite of mine, I had to retry it after enjoying and rating the nearby Fort Hill brewerys rauchbier. The Schlenkerla is a far deeper brew, more robust and full bodied than its American cousin, but of course, theyve had centuries to refine it. Definitely a different style of beer.
Coś wspaniałego. Intensywny smak wędzonki nie wpływa na pijalność - wchodzi lekko i przyjemnie. Co więcej - ani trochę się nie nudzi.

Barwa ciemno brunatna, piana obfita i trwała. W aromacie konkretna wędzonka, do tego karmel - bardzo intensywny i przyjemny aromat. W smaku podobnie z lekką goryczka, średnią słodyczą. Średnie wysycenie, spodziewałem się troszkę cięższego piwa - a tu niespodzianka bo bardzo pijalne i lekkie jak na ten styl, bardzo udane, dla fanów wędzonki must drink.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 Amber brown beer with medium head. Prosciutto aroma with smoked salmon taste. Balanced salty and sweet flavors . First smoked bier!Very enjoyable but could not drink more than one in a row.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2015 16.9oz bottle, shared with friend, poured into tulip glass

Aroma: Smoke, caramel malt

Appearance: Brown, dark amber color, nice head, off white

Taste: sweet, malty, but nice balance

Palate: soft, medium to full body

Overall: Another nice smoked beer. Very drinkable. Nice Marzen. Somewhat malty, but not overdone. Overall, very nice beer and one that Id love to drink near a campfire and makes me think of a campfire setting even when sitting at a dinner table. The malts were nice and complex with a nice warm body which makes me believe its more than 5%. Really, really enjoyable with a nice strong smoke aroma and very clean taste.
Un clasicazo. A falta de comida que llevarse a la boca, una buena sesión de barbacoa.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2016 Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood.Pours brown with fluffy tan head. Aroma of smoked malts, smoked bacon,some burnt maltiness. Taste smoked also, burnt malts, light to medium bitterness. Medium body, oily. Smoke bitterness finish. Interesting beer.

Draft pour at Special Brews. Pours a dark cola brown color with a bubbly head. Very smokey meat like aroma. I?m very much alright with the heavy smokey beers, but this one is potentially over the top. Anything about the flavor is completely overpowered by the smoke. Swallowed a charred campfire log smoke. Though I can?t complain, this beer advertises to be this way. Definitely a sipper as a result. This falls under the "gotta try them all eventually" category.

Bottle @ Gambrinus, Tartu.
Smoked aroma, some roasted malt notes. Drinking it is like eating a sausage. Good.

Amber brown beer with light brown head. Aroma of smoke, tar, thats it. Luckilty it doesnt taste that much but still tar and smoke dominate. Also pretty malty, some roasted malts. Soft. Sausage or bacon. Ok but still smoke beer which is not my favourite style.
Интерес& копчёно& послевк& аромат копчёно& Ощущени& что закусыв& копчены& колбаск& Пиво и закуска в одном флаконе.

Dark brown, clear beer with a heavy smoky aroma. Its taste is malty with a light hoppy bitterness. The smoke dominates the aroma. Light brown and long lasting head. Light bitter flavor with a long smoky finish. Texture and mouthful is OK and not too watery.
Bacon puro, uma das únicas cervejas do mundo que não consegui beber!!! Vale a experiência.

Pours a very dark ruby color, almost brown, topped with a decent tan colored head. Aroma is very smokey, bacon-like quality, also slightly woody. Taste has some sweetness in it, but mostly its smokey. The fans of smoked beers will love it, for others it will be drinkable enough.

De color marrón rojizo medio con destellos de color naranja brillante y espuma de cabeza compacta, firme y duradera. De aroma a salchicha ahumada y tocino un poco de moho y ligero aroma a frutas. Su sabor nos brinda un excelente equilibrio de malta dulce y el humo. El humo sustituye al factor del lúpulo como el equilibrio de malta dominante. Ligero retrogusto cárnico.

bottles, 0,5lt. Found at Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos.
Its just THE smoked beer. An overall winner.
Aroma of smoke and bacon and a dark appearance. The taste just complete the aroma of... smoked bacon, A very nice full body that could be a meal too. But, it goes extraordinary with some saussages or heavy pork, wild etc
And you can drink more than one, but not more than four, I guess.

Aroma is roasty, nuts and chocolate, smoky and hint of tar. Very dark and nice color, almost no head. Medium bitterness, not sweet, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation and long finish. I liked this a lot, very nice drink after sauna.

Farbe: dunkles Rubinrot mit sahniger Krone
Geruch: Rauch, Röstmalz 
Aroma: sehr rauchig, erinnert stark an geräucherten Schinken oder Fisch. Das bleibt auch absolut dominierend bis in den Abgang. Leicht bitter. 

Insgesamt durchaus gut, aber sicherlich alles andere als ein Alltagsbier
Bardzo dobra wędzonka. W smaku trochę zbyt słodkie, to mi przeszkadzało, ale należało się tego po stylu spodziewać. Świetna prezencja i odczucie w ustach. Świetne piwo!
Forte odeur fumée. Le goût fumée est très puissant dès le début, puis plus rien. Un arrière goût fumé arrive par après.
Extremely smoky. Taste is overwhelmingly smoky. Not much else. Watery mouthfeel. Bland otherwise.
Reddish brown pour. Aroma is tang and light smoke. Tastes like barbecue. Not my sort of beer.
Bottle - bright copper with a bubbly beige head. Aroma of malts, hay and light smoke. Taste is faintly smokey, wheat, peat and a little chocolate and caramel. Medium body, low carbonation.
50 cl systembolaget. Så denna i 101 öl boken och var tvungen att testa och den var mycket god.
500 ml bottle to a pint. Dark Amber brown with tan head. Nice balance of sweet toasted malt and smoked pork. Very tasty! Schlenkerla 4th best rauchbier ever.

Gravity keg at Akkurat. 

Dark brownish/amber with a medium slighty tan head. Nice aroma of smoke, ham, salt and wood. Taste of smoke, ham, wood and salt. The finish was bitter. Refreshing and really drinkable. A very nice beer.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Color: Schlenkerla Rauchbier Märzen 50cl es de color prácticamente negro. 
- Espuma: Densa y de color beige 
- Boca: Fuerte. El toque a malta y caramelo queda en segundo plano cuando toma poder el ahumado, que es difícil de calificar como dulce o como amargo. Al final aparece un toque picante. 

ELABORADOR: Schlenkerla Rauchbier
GRADO ALCOHÓLICO: 5 %

Poured clear nut-brown with a 2-finger bone-colored head. Aroma of wood smoke, with perhaps a touch of caramel underneath. Body is medium, but a touch watery. Lightly dry finish. Flavor of nutty malt with a touch of bright citrus at the back. The smoke is present throughout, but really shows at the back and lingers pleasantly in the finish. A touch of a metallic note at the back as well.

Tuoksussa savustettua kalaa ja makeaa maltaisuutta. Maku alkaa savuisen maltaisena ja päättyy savustetun kalan makuun. Suutuntuma keskitäyteläinen. Miellyttävän alhainen alkoholipitoisuus täyteläisyyteen nähden.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 Brownish medium head, persistent. Reddish brown medium body. Smoke and smoked meat aroma with hop notes. Same aromas in taste, salty with roasted and cacao notes. Nice bitter aftertaste.
500 ml bottle to a pint. Dark Amber brown with tan head. Nice balance of sweet toasted malt and smoked pork. Very tasty!

Father of Rauchbier. Clear dark brown color with a creamy head but very unstable. Nose full of smoked aromas like ham and wood. Märzen fresh aromas. Nice caramel and bready taste. Medium/high carbonation and for me its too sweet and could be ballanced with more bitternes.

50 cl bottle. Black appearance, deep burgundy red in see-thru, clear, nice creamy beige head, looks like a stout. Smokey nose indeed. Aroma of burn malts, 5-cereals, wood, charcoal. Very smoked, with speck. I remember having tried this years ago and it was YUCK!! but now its not that huge smoke i remember, its pretty drinkable. Taste is flattish, propending on the bitter side. Body is strangely light to medium, and texture is thin. Finish is smoky, woody. Peculiar one.
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!

Bottle, 50cL. Home. Many thanks to @Jaghana ! A sparkling clear red brown beer witha big off-white creamy head ; average retention. Smoky aroma, salmon, roast, herbs, caramel. Light to medium sweet, light to medium herbal bitter ; nice balance. Good body, silky texture, good carbonation, sweet smoky sweet finish. Overall, oh yeah... fantastic smoky aroma ; great balance. Merci encore Pascal !

Conoscendo il particolare metodo di maltazione utilizzato per questa birra ho sempre avuto timore nellassaggiarla. Ieri mi son fatto coraggio.
Laroma è nettamente affumicato, ricorda le cantine dove si stagionano formaggi e salumi. 
La birra si prese di color ambrato scuro con sfumature rossicce.
In bocca laffumicatura viene nettamente contrastata dalla dolcezza del malto che dona aromi caramellati e, soprattutto, un inaspettato e gradevole equilibrio. Luppolo assente.
Corpo medio e retrogusto infinito.

Bisogna essere psicologicamente pronti per il particolarisimo gusto di queste birre ma la tradizione e lesperienza in questo tipo di birrificazione producono un prodotto unico e piacevole.

My first description "its like drinking a campfire". Clear dark brown color. Aroma, well, duh, wood smoke, though that mellows on subsequent sips, and then the malt and breadiness comes through. That first sip...wow....quite intense smoke. The taste also gets more complex as time goes on, with a little molasses with the malty sweetness and just enough hops. Unique and very easy drinking thanks to the lighter consistency. It would be interesting to have this beer with some barbequed brisket.
50cl @ bottle. Birra dal colore scuro con un forte sapore di affumicato. Molto beverina e ottima nei pasti.

Poured the exact colour, carbonation and head as root beer. Strong smoke, barbeque sauce aroma. Thin texture. Strong smoke flavour. The first draw is surprising. Almost overpowering. Within a couple mouth fulls, the smoke mellows. A sweet flavour coming out. Mildly bitter middle and medium length finish. Very good. Nice winter beer.

500ml bottle into glass. AMAZING nose, like BBQ sauce. Clear maroon beer with small tan head. No carbonation. Tastes like a normal dark lager but the finish is all smoky sweetness. What a great beer! Really,really good. No, seriously, really good.

Appearance- nice big frothy (light) mocha colored head that lasted a good bit with (surprisingly) minimal lacing. Medium dark mahogany brown. Fairly clear.

Smell- holy smoke!!! The nose was overwhelming immediately after pouring. All I can think of is the aromas experienced while waiting to be seated in a BBQ joint. 

Taste- bacon/pork, jerky.

Mouthfeel- medium body. Smooth and creamy. 

Overall- good, different. Would have again but only with the right food/meal. Recommend for no other reason than to experience this unique brew.

Cheers!

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015  Permanent white foam, it?s characterised by a slightly lactic and intensely smoked aroma. The smoked taste is evident and balanced with the sweetness of the aftertaste. Bread, chocolate, toast, nuts and caramel characterise the taste of this beer.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2015 Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo  23/05/2015
color marrón, carbonatacion media Sabores y aromas ahumados
Bottle. Pours a black colour with no head, the aroma is malt and smoke, taste is bitter with smoked malt with a dry finish.
500ml bottle at home alone but with a lovely sad panda company oooh yeah :D Okay, rating..sweet smoky, grassy, soy sauce aroma. Taste is much the same. Good.

Pours a deep amber-ruby with a decent khaki head that settles fairly quickly and leaves some spotty lace. Nose involves rich toffee-caramel malt and dark dried fruit wrapped in a fair bbq-wood smoke along with some tinny lager yeast. Somewhat sweet, a bit more bitter. Light to medium bodied, fairly oily, lower carb, tending toward an umami savory mouthwatering quality, finishing rich and smoky relative to the lightness of the beer. Very nice smoked beer, not too imposing but certainly not lacking either. A benchmark.

A: deep clear mahogany brown/red. lasting beige head ang great sheet lacing

S:burnt wood, toasted malt and a faint herbal hop note

T: burnt wood plus a tart hop presence balancing prononced maltiness. slightly sweet but not at all cloyng

M: medium body. average carbonation. tart smokey finish is actually pretty nice

O: now i can say ive had this smoked beer. i love smoked everything and will try a couple more smoked beers but this does not blow me away. certainly a must try though!

What a perfect rauchbier, smells and taste like heaven. Brown beer with medium carbonation, mild smokey aroma and flavor. It is a crispy malty caramel, lager. For those like me who loves real bbq, this is perfect, 100% in the style.
Poured a clear dark brown. Tastes, well smokey. A friend of mine liked it very much, I am not to big on it. Smokey flavour isnt what I look for in a beer. If you do, then itll rock your world.
the aroma is caramel and smokey with shades of toffee... the taste is caramel and fruity with bright notes of smoked malt... dry, smoked and bitter aftertaste... very nice rauchbier...

Bought bottled 0.5 for app. 1.5 EUR.
appearance: deep reddish-amber to copper color, clear, elegant. thick and nice head, but quickly disappearing. 
nose: plenty of smoke, hint of peat, dark bread,dried and smoked fruits: plums, pears and cherries. excellent 
mouthfeel: very drinkable, smooth, low to medium carbonation, as for generally light marzbier can be described as full-bodied 
taste: smoky notes are dominating, , definitely malty character, bitterness could be higher, gives slight impression of matured islay whisky
overall: best rauchbier I tasted so far. Drinkable, smooth, pleasant and light beer with very smoky character. Not for everyone, however denitely worth a try. Cheap and very interesting!

Tastes like a beer version of a peated whisky. Beautiful, dark amber color, the head could be a bit more firm. Aromas of smoke and malt, the taste is dominated by a strong yet balanced smoke. A truly amazing Rauchbier!

16.9 oz. bottle from Cost Plus. Very big, white head on a ruby brown body. 
Nose of yeast with a hint of smoke. Mellow smoked wood flavor supported by a pleasant caramel malt body. Incredibly smooth and drinkable - no astringency despite the smoke. The almost dry finish is somewhat crisp and leaves a touch of biscuit like sweetness and a lingering smokiness. World Class.
Currently I am updating my ratebeer with al the beers I drank but was too lazy to rate at the time. I give the scores I gave back than. If I drink the beers again I might re-rate them.
couleur brun foncé; mousse beige très fine; forte odeur de feu de bois (trop); goût malté et fumé; finale légèrement amère; bière intéressante malgré le fait que je naime pas trop ce style

From brewers droop, Bristol 
500ml [BBE:04/2015] 
Blood alc:91mg/100ml 

Big rich smoked cheese aroma with sweet maltiness and one pence pieces (and twos). Nice deep brown with a little rediness and a fine white head. Flavour is light but significant smoke with a medium sweet and also dry maltiness with an afterglow of honey. 
Good
 
=72%
Dark with small white tan head. Smoky aroma. Taste medium bitter and smoky finish.

Vom Holzfass@ Schlenkerla Bamberg. Wunderbar aus dem Holzfass gezapft, stabilere, sahneartige Schaumkrone. Raucharomen überall, aber auch frisches Brot und Schmalz. Äußerst gelungen im Verhältnis BittereHerbe. Zurecht ein Weltklassiker.

This beer pours a dark reddish brown with a medium off-white head that fades slowly, and the aroma blends roasted malts with smoke. The taste is slightly sour and slightly bitter with an aftertaste that is purely smoke. The palate has a soft carbonation, then texture, and a medium-light body.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 Crystal brown/reddish color with a generous fluffy white head. Aromas is rich in smoked meat and bacon, with a sweet malt backgorund. Taste is very rich, with smoked meat, bacon and slightly dark fruits ans sweet malts. Cant find any bitter trace in this beer. Very solid.

A surprisingly dark brown (like strong black iced tea), with a medium-fine, tan head that fades to a small ring quickly. Aroma is grassy smoke with some light, grainy malt sweetness. Evokes smoked salmon. Body is medium light, on the watery side, with a medium-heavy carbonation, moderate-to-intense burn. Flavor is medium-light smokiness with some spicy grass and grain. Less sweet tasting, even a bit thin (especially compared with my expectations from the bocks by Schlenkerla). Lots of woody tannins (but certainly not any vanilla/oak). Overall, a nice smoked beer with a lighter body and flavor (despite appearances). Not as impressive or delicious as the bigger beers in this lineup (like the urbock).
500ml bottle from BePLUS, Xiamen. Pours ruby red brown with a thin white head. Lovely smoked aroma with a smooth smoky finish.

You think its black, but against the light it is cherrywood brown. Very thin off-white head. No measurable lacing.
Aromas of camp fires, burning wood, smoke, and a hint of bacon, and smoked meats.
A slightly surprising medium mouth feel, with a slight oiliness.. A lot more of the aromas are on the palate, with a sneaky sweet maltiness lurking under it all. No hop presence that I can detect.
A few years back, this was my first smoke beer, and years later, nothing has beaten it yet in this category.

Clear beautiful deep autumn auburn color with a fair beige head. The signature smokiness Ive come to love and appreciate from this series. Soft. That great campfire character. Tremendous. A great drinkable smoke.

super smoky, but a fresh smoky, like the fire is burning strongly and the sausages were just cooked, not like how your sweatshirt smells in the morning. Strong but smooth, light, leaves a great rustic/smoky tastes in the back of your mouth.
500ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a brief head. Aroma of smoke and bacon. Medium bitterness. Smoky finish. Nice.

creamy medium foam. redish dark color. smoke and bacon is very apparent in the smell, i also smell hints of (maybe hazelnut) liquor. slick texture, medium body. bacon and smoke again in the flavor, more subtle though than the smell would suggest. medium bitter finish. overall the flavors were not as strong as the smell would suggest.

Piękny aromat ala grodziskie z butelki. Piana obfita, trwała, grube pęcherze, lacing średni. Piwo bardzo wędzone. Kolor ciemnoczerwony, pełny. Klarowne. W smaku słodycz, lekki karmel i gorycz. Wszystko dosyć stonowane, w postaci dodatków do konkretnego wędzenia. Odczucie w ustach pełne, ale nie intensywne. Gaz rozchodzi się po całej jamie ustnej, lecz szybko znika. Goryczka lekko ściągająca.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 0,5 bottle. Pours brown colour with high off-white frothy, mostly lasting head. Aroma of smoked wood, bacon, malts. Flavour is light sweet, light hoppy bitter, with smoky wooden notes. Finish is medium long and smoky, salty. Medium to full body, oily texture, average carbonation. Awesome.
A proper rauchbier, mild bitterness, toffee roasted flavour with a smoky bacony after taste.

Dark brown color with creamy head. Very good lacing. 
Roast aromas, mainly smoky. Also some fruits and some of caramel and vanilla.
In mouth it is slightly bitter. Medium body and a bit oily. Good carbonation. To sum up, equilibrated but slight flavor.
500 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a tiny dark brown head. Aroma of smoked wood, caramel and bread. Quite salty taste. Almost no carbonation. A bitter finish. Not my piece of cake.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Smoked ham, coke, nuts, plum. Amber body with a medium beige head. Soft, medium-bitter taste, with an aftertaste of smoke. Smooth, medium-bodied mouthfeel. Oh, that is quite a nice one indeed.

Poured from bottle into a tulip: pours dark brown with a one finger off white head. Aroma of smoked meats, caramel, and more smoke. Flavor is light smoke, caramel, nuts, and dried leaves. Medium body, slick mouthfeel, a little bitter. Nice beer.
Dark red body, light brown head; strongly smoked, some caramel, a bit woodsy. Medium bitterness. Not for me.
0.5l bottle. Black color with medium brown head. Strong smoky smell. Strong aroma of smoke and some nuts. Pleasant bitterness in finish and overwhelming smoky flavor. Very interesting beer.

Woodsy smoked aroma. Dark chocolate with a red tone color with a minimal tanned head. Smooth crisp smokey taste.Caramel background. Has a crispy fruity feel. Once over the initial smokiness in mellows but still leaves that burned after taste. First of its style Ive had and I think its great.

Aroma of mildly caramel undertones. Taste that smashes the throat. Burnt chocolate and caramel tastes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Soy muy fan de las ahumadas, no lo puedo evitar. Esta está muy a la altura. Jorobate Flanders!

Pours a lovely dark amber with a distinct dark ruby cast. Very good head, lacing and retention. Outstanding nose of meaty bacon like smoke against an underlying dark fruit (plum, fig) note. Light medium body with a somewhat slick texture. Slightly below normal carbonation with just a touch of effervescence on the finish. The flavor profile is a masterpiece of intensity, balance and complexity. The delicious smoke character is always present, but never overpowering. It begins with campfire bacon like smoke over a slightly sweet background that has dark fruit characteristics. The middle allows the hops to impart a low level bitterness that has a citric note. The almost dry finish is somewhat crisp and leaves you with a touch of biscuit like sweetness and a lingering smokiness as if youve sitting around a campfire. World Class.
A brown rauchbier / märzen with low head. Aroma is very smoky. Taste is a bit bitter sweet. Too smoky.

Pours a dark brown with a little fine off white head. Nose is heavy, meaty smoke, a little caramel, a little coffee. Flavor is smoked meats, caramel, burnt toast, an almond essence (benzaldehyde) note. Medium bodied, slightly oily on the palate.
500ml Bottle puts a dark brown, almost black bear with a smooth off-white head. Aroma, smoke, roasted malts. Taste, light bitter and sweetness. Intriguing and unusual.

Vierte ámbar oscuro con buena capa de espuma beige que perdura en el vaso; se aprecian aromas a beicon ahumado, caramelo, madera y cuero; en boca entrada refrescante y maltosa con notas ligeramente picantes, amargor sutil tornando a dulce en el pos gusto. Cuerpo y carbónico ligeros en un estilo peculiar en el que prevalece el humo pero no se hace pesado contrastando con el dulce de la malta lo que la hace interesante y fácil de beber.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2014 0,5 l bottle, best before 10/2014. Clear red brown with frothy tan head. Aroma and taste of smoked malt, bacon, nuts, raisins and hints of caramel. Almost salty. Low carbonation, thin to medium body. Nice crisp bitter finish. Drank it while eating some pork and mushrooms. Loved it from the first sip!

Draft at Bar Brouw, Amsterdam. Pours hazy brown with a thick cream head. Aroma of caramel, smoked malt, wood, burnt bacon and toffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Flaska från SB. Mörkbrun med vitt skum. Doftar kraftigt av rökt kött och rök. Smaken är också mycket rökig med viss sötma.

500ml bottle. Pours a deep, ruby/caramel with a half finger, khaki head. Aroma has notes of tobacco smoke, caramel, and bread. Taste has big notes of smoke mixed with slight bread and caramel. Medium body and carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a semi-dry finish. Overall well done but not my thing.

On tap at Schlenkerla and Moeder Fontainas. Pours a dark Brown with creamy white head. Aroma is huge meat and smoked wood. taste is chewy malts, toffee, meat and some hoppy bitterness. Palate is perfectly light despite rich flavors. The best of its style.
A classic for the style. Aggressive smoke initially that seems tame only after it has pleasurably abused ones palate. Dirty and rustic in the best sense.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 500ml bottle poured in a dimpled pint mug.
A: Pours a deep dark amber to brown color forming a medium beige head. Medium to low retention and some few lacings left
S: Very particular. Very smoky as expected. Bacon. Roasted malts, honey. Delicious 
T: As the nose, very roasted and smoky. Bacon, honey, roasted malts, smoked wood. Very mild sweet brown sugar in the beginning but, in overall, a dry beer. End is roasted bitterness
M: A light body after all. Watery. Good carbonation. Roasted bitter aftertaste but not too bitter
O: Excellent beer, excellent drinkability. Thats what you can expect from an Aecht Schlenkerla
[ BA Review @ 10/31/2009 ]

Bottle from Cornelius as part of my German beer education. Big smokey, malty nose (think whisky distillery your). Light and sweet taste with smoke throughout. Not a fan of smoked beer but this one is ok.

500ml bottle from the LCBO. Deep brown body with thick tan foamy head. Aroma of pepper, smoke, smoked meat, cigar smoke, sausage, wet wood. Lingering smoke aftertaste with little hop presence and carbonation. Good for what it is, but byfar my least favorite style of beer. Drain pour.

Draught at Schlenkerla, Bamberg. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is smokey (bacon), light malty caramel, some wood. Taste is sweet and like the aroma smoked, light malty caramel, light hoppy bitter and some wood. Light to medium body, oily, soft carbonation. I thought that drinking this from the "source" it would be better, more intense. It was very easy drinkable, very nice paired with the food (sausages, cold cuts) but not so smoked as I expected.

Aroma: Very smokey.
Flavor Very smokey and sweet with slight bitterness.
Color: Dark brown with a light brown head.

Big sucker for smoked beers. This brings together subtle-yet-obvious hints of smoked Gouda and sweet, savory malts, makes them incredibly refreshing, and sticks that into a sexy deep bronze lager. Simple yet complex and delicious.

Smokey October 4, 2014 surprisingly good
Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

 via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle. Aromas of smoked meat. Pours a dark red with tan head. Light bitter taste. Medium body with smoked meat and malty flavours. An interesting beer.

Poured into tulip a dark brown with an amazingly light head for a dark beer. The contrast of the two alone made it amazing to look at. The smokey aroma could be picked up 4 feet away from it. Smoked meats, pork, and more smoke. Taste is of smoked pork, oak. No alcohol noted. This is a beer to be paired with meats or better yet savoured outside next to a roaring campfire in the fall. Started crisp when cold and mellowed out as it warmed. Slightly bitter but in no way overwhelming. Creamy med body. Fantastic, history in a bottle.
Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are large smokiness, oak, and some malts.

Bottle. Dark brown color, nice beige head. Aromas full of smoked ham, beautiful with hints of caramel. Taste is lightest sweet and very decent bitter. Lively carbonation and a thin texture making this beer very drinkable. Aftertaste of much more smoked ham and smoked fish, very nice. Accompanies good with a hearty meal or a german "Brotzeit".

"similar smoke flavor to the urbock, which was fantastic. thinner body, though, and a slightly more simplistic smoke and sweet malt flavor. still very good, but not quite elite imho. 2nd time held its own with the others cept for the urbock."

50cl bottles fresh, aged 1yo 9/2014 (bb09/2013) and on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Strange that Hellers standard offering of their trademark Rauchbier is technically a Märzen at a 5,1%...otherwise this is as rich and flavourful as Franconian standard fair gets, truly stellar in its sessionability. Beechwood-blackened salmon dunked in an Islay malt-inspired Franconian Keller. Lush dry caramels, a creamy palate do not hinder prime gulpability. A masterpiece in character and simplicity of quality ingredients., to be had at a lower abv payoff than their gorgeous Urbock. - Holds up rather well given its original richness, although it doesnt gain much in taste either.

Aroma: smoked fish, sausage; Appearance: clear dark red, average brown foamy head; Taste: medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium sourness; Palate: average carbonation, long finish, oily texture, medium body

Well-rounded beer, thoroughly smoked. Terrific, intense aroma. Drinkable. A bit too much carbonation in the beginning. Paired with canned tuna on rice and green peas was terrific. The beer highlighted hot pepper and curry that I added to the food.
Absolutely fantastic smokey flavour! It tastes almost like that youre eating bacon. Real good beer with both medium sweetness and bitternes.

50 cl bottle from my local Comarket in Tallinn ( 3,11), Sept 2014. BB 12/2014. Pours a reddish brown with a small light tan head that laces and retains nicely. Nose... its smoked ham. Really difficult to get anything else from behind that... After a while the "hamness" steps back a bit, giving way to a more malty aroma that together with the remnants of this smoky ham make a very enjoyable mixture. And yea, it makes me want ham. Taste is rather sweet with nice low key bitterness, whereas the smoky dryness only appears in the finish. A bit of a downer really, after the full aroma. Body is quite light, carbonation just right between average and soft. Dry, somewhat grainy mouthfeel. Ive grown to like it.

A much darker pour than the Doppelbock, it pours a deep reddish brown with about an inch of foam. It shrinks quickly and leaves better lacing.

Almost as smokey on the nose as the DB with less secondary aromas. Served cold, so maybe that explains it.

Smoother taste though still quite smokey. So smooth, I cant seem to pull any other flavours out of this Marzen so Ill give up trying. 

Close to perfection for the mouth feel.

This one, I reckon I could possibly drink another bottle of, back to back. Delightful it is.

Appearance: Very dark amber color, head white but not so stron. Aroma: mostly roast ham and roast cheese, caramel, toasted bread. Taste: good balance beetwen sweetness and bitterness. Body is too light for me. Finish is bitter.

Bottle at home, 19th September 2014. Bought in Munich, strong smokey malty aroma, with slight metallic and iodine notes, inviting. Taste is smooth smokiness, burnt bacon, charred barbecue, really works, and metallic aroma does not translate in the mouth. Great beer and a nice change to the series of IPAs, I had the same evening

500ml bottle into a tumbler. Pours a deep brownish mahogany with a slight off-white head. Strong aroma of smoke and oakiness, and light malt. Smoky malt flavour with some caramel, slight sweetness. Medium body and smooth. The be all and end all of smoked beers still has yet to be trumped.

Clear cola brown body with a beige medium sized head. Aroma is malt, strong smoke, dark fruits. Taste is sweet with light bitterness. Medium to thin body, a bit of a thin texture, some spice aftertaste.
Bottle and tap. Not much too say. The benchmark for all smoked beers. The perfect balance of smokey, roasted and malty flavours. For sure an extreme beer but highly drinkable.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 22A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch LTK. AROMA: very present smoked aroma reminiscent of burnt wood. Very faint malt aroma with no esters and no hop aromas. APPEARANCE: dark ruby color and translucid. rich and creamy tanned head with medium-low retention. TASTE: smoky flavour balanced with a slight sweet malty background. clean lager profile. very low bitterness. finishes medium-dry. PALATE: medium-low body with low carbonation. OVERALL: a nice example of a Bamberg speciality.

Bottle at the Wellington Arms, Bedford. Chocolate brown, slightly hazy, wispy khaki head. Smoked beechwood, Marmite, dark chocolate in the aroma. Reminds me of a less fishy Ted Peters (S Pasadena, FL). sweet taste, slighter than expected. A smoky bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. The palette isnt as full as youd think, but it suits the beer. At any rate the carbonation carries the mouthfeel. The paradigmatic smoked beer. A bit more ABV and body and this would be elevated to godlike status.
Bottle 0.5l frok Dranken Geers Ghent Belgium.Pour it caramel colour with small white head.On the nose smoke.Taste of prosciutto, smoked ham, caramel and wood.Very good intense taste.Great
UPDATED: SEP 9, 2016 There are few beers that can be smokier than the meat youve just barbecued, but this is one of them. Unbelievably delicious.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear dark copper with a thin foamy off-white head. Flavors are smoked meat, charred wood, roasted malts, barley sugar and caramel with fruity, salty and spicy notes. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture. Taste is surprisingly sweet while smoked flavors are most noticeable on the nose. Good stuff.

Transfer from BA review on 6-1-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a reddish - copper color with a two finger billowy beige head. The head fades relatively quickly to leave some spotty lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The nose is smacked with tons of big smokiness with some aromas of char. It smells of a fire and with hints of a salty aroma as well as a little bit of grass it gives an almost smoked meat like smell overall.

 Taste  While the nose was massive in smoke the taste was a little tuned down, although still nice and smoky. The taste starts out with some smoky and malty flavors mixed with a bit of a lighter fruit taste. The smoke as well as the fruit grow a bit stronger in nature and mix with some lighter grassy flavors. A bit of a almost salty meat flavor develop more toward the middle to the end and when mixed with the smoky flavors produce a smoked ham sandwich like taste with a little bit of fruit flavor. Odd, but interesting.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is medium to slightly thicker side for a brew of only 5.4 % with a carbonation level that is rather average. Both are rather nice for the style with the slightly chewier body very nicely complimenting the smoked flavors, while the moderate carbonation was great for the overall drinkability.

 Overall  Quite a tasty Rachbier with a huge smoky nose but yet rather palatable and pleasing blend of flavors beyond just smoke.
Bottle. Brown, minimal head, tan foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, & long finish.
Um ótimo aroma defumado, senti algo como lombo defumado, espuma consistente é de cor caramelada. Combina muito bem com um parma.

Pours a deep amber-brown with a thin finger of light tan head diminishing gradually to a thin cap and moderate lacing. Nose is dominated by mild to moderate smoked malt, with faint Bavarian hops in the background. Taste is sweet dark malt and moderate smoke, building as the pint progresses. Body is lighter than appearance suggests, with carbonation diminishing gradually from lively to moderate at the end of the pint, and a lingering smoky, bitter finish.

Not as smoky as I was expecting, to be honest. The bottle claims an "intense smoky aroma and flavour", but Id say its at most moderately smoky. It might very well be overwhelming or shocking to someone who wasnt expecting it, but I found it to be quite well-behaved and approachable. Still not my favourite style, but I could see this growing on me somewhat with further experimentation.

Dark brown color with small head. Aroma of something smoked. I believe its smoked malt :)
Taste os smoked caramel. Bittersweet. Interesting beer
Bottle at the Hanging Bat. Pours very dark brown, nose is sweet smoked sausage, taste is dry roast, light smoke, sweet toffee, chewy.
Pours dark brown with minimal head. Medium body. Smells like a bonfire. Strong smoky flavor. Delicious

500ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown to black color with average-sized beige head. Wonderful aroma of smoked malt. Sweet and smoky caramel malt flavor. Somewhat sweet with some lingering smokiness in the finish. Light on the palate. I love smoked beers and this is a good one.

Appearance- very dark, ruby tinge when held up to the light, murky, one finger foamy white head. Aroma- big smokiness, bit of roasted malt, burnt treacle, brown sugar, smoked meats, bacon particularly. Taste- loads of smokiness in this- burnt meat, bacon, hot dogs, malty, bitter malts, medium mouthfeel, fairly short finish which is reminiscent of eating barbecued food. Unique and pretty tasty.
Pours brown with thick off-white head. Tastes of ham, honey and malts. Light and refreshing.

Quire nice dark color, with tan medium to low head.The arome is quite smokey. The taste is a quite sweet, with just maybe a bit sourness. The palate is quite soft, well balanced, think to oily and soft carbonation, almost flat. Quite good beer, even though not exactly y type.

Great smoke, toast aroma. Appearance is garnet brown with a white head with avg head retention. Flavor is somewhat sweet with complementary smoke notes which help to dry it out. Hops bitterness is low. Toasted bread malt flavor. Light body with medium carbonation. Overall, its a great smoke beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Perfect amount of smoke for me. Fits very well with the base style, but I would like a but more body. The smoke will still dry the beer out in the end. Also seems way to dark for the style and body 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark red on the eye, strong white head. Very distinct smoke aroma with some hoppy notes. Very smoky yet also pleasant taste, sweet with some bitter and herbal notes- also hops. Hoppy bitter finish with lingering smoky notes.

Tried it in Greek beer bar.
The aroma consists of something like bacon and cigar, the taste is SMOKED as hell, like you just ate some smoked meat.
I wouldnt drink it every day but smoked beers are definitely worth brewing and this one is very good!

Drink cold (8-10°)
Eye: pours a clear reddish-brown colour with small beige to brown head. small regular bubbles. nice carbonation.
Nose: smoke, peat, cigar, smoked bacon (Räucherspeck), strong malts
Mouth: peated smoke, cigar, leaves, hay, smoked bacon (Räucherspeck), strong earthy malts, dark chocolate, coffee, burned vegetables (zucchetti perhaps), slightly sweet.
Palate: smoke remains, strong earthy (nature) malts, coriander, bitter finish
Overall: very good and complex strong beer (concerning the taste, not the alcohol), a bit too heavy and one sided though. reminds my somehow of a peated whisky (from Islay perhaps). I really like it, but is not at all an every day beer.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 Clear, dark mahogany coloured body and a small tan head. Very smoky aroma, firewood, tar, some malts. Taste is a bit malty but gets overpowered by the intense smoky finish. Aside from the smoke the taste is a lot like a nice porter. Smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice beer overall.
I didnt get this beer at all. It was so strongly smoked that I couldnt drink it. Not my thing.
Tastes like smoke, smells like smoke. Malty body with strong roasted flavours, not the kind of beer I prefer.
Chestnut color, light brown head. Smoked and roasted malt nose, caramel, meaty notes, earthy hops. Smoked taste, cured meat, light sweetness. Soft carbonation, medium body. Well balanced.

Bottle, 500 ml. Pours dark reddish amber with half a finger of thick off-white head. As expected, very smokey on the nose, the smoke note being a mixture of woodsmoke and smoked meat from what I can tell, probably bacon. Beneath the pillow of smoke theres a cereal malt base and a bit of (smoked) cheesy yeast. Taste-wise, the smokey character remains but is less overpowering than before, being confined to the middle at the top of the palate alongside aforementioned cheesy yeast, making this one really taste strongly of smoked cheese. Little bit of caramel malt and a tiny fruity note of uncertain character are detectable as well to even out the main smoked body, and the aftertaste is mostly cereal following a rather dry finish. Pretty easy on the palate with minimal carbonation, a good medium body (though a little watery sometimes IMO) and a smooth texture. Probably more impressed by the aroma than the taste on this one, but this one is most pleasant overall seems like a fine example of and a good introduction to this genre of brew.
Rödbrun öl med stort beige skum. Både doft och smak är mycket rökta charkuterier, korv och skinka. I botten finns en bra maltig öl med inslag av karamell.
Smoky and meaty like nobodys business but still plenty of caramel malt and spicy hops shining through.

Pours dark copper. The beer sports a tan head of medium size and medium-long lifetime and manages to leave a little lacing behind. The nose is mainly smoky - the kind of smoke youd expect from Black Forest ham - while notes of sweetish caramel malts are hidden underneath. The flavor pretty much follows the bouquet: sweet caramel malts overpowered by smoke, grassy hop on the mid-palate overpowered by smoke, woody flavor overpowered by smoke, leading to a meaty ham finish with a lot of smoke. I find it interesting how much I associate the flavor with ham although the beer actually tastes nothing like pork. Its just that this particular kind of smokiness is such a prominent component in both this beer and German raw ham. Just a side note. Man, this beer is smoky. The smoke almost made the creamy texture, medium body, and soft carbonation escape me. OK, obviously not everybody will like this, and the score (in my case 3.8) is even less meaningful than usual. Neither this review, nor any other, nor any number given to this beer can tell you whether youll like it or not, but its definitely worth a try just for the heck of it.
Clear dark amber appearance, medium head. Strong smoke aroma, caramel. Decent bodied with round sweetness and bitterness. Prolonged smoked finish. Very good Smoked style beer.

From bottle to lager glass. Pour is a deep copper color, almost brown with a very thick off-white head. Nose is big smoke, roasted malt, light hop, caramel. Taste is light medium bodied, mostly sour. Big smoky flavor as well. Finishes nice and crisp, smoke is powerful on the mouth. Cool mix of style on the marzen, definitely would recommend this.

An aroma of sweet cereal grains, bread yeast, and smoky bacon. Appears a clear deep copperish brown with off white foam and some lace. Tastes of bacon smoke and sweet cereal grains with a hint of grassy bitterness. Palate is fizzy and nice. Overall, a very nice Rauch bier.
Bottle. Pitch black. No head or lace. Nose is pure campfire--very woodsmokey. Thinnish. Strong woodsmoke, roasty malts, mild chocolate.
Bottle, pours a deep brown with a small cream colored head, nice smoky aroma, taste is light smoked bacon with some sweetness with malt and nuts notes, light smoky bitter finish, very good beer
Dark reddish brown with thick cream head. Aroma of salty smoke with roasted malts. Little carbonation, fullish body. Taste fairly saline, light bitter and sweetness. Pretty good but not refreshing.
Poured very dark brown with thick cream head. Aroma of strong bacon smoke with choc roast toast. Light carb med bod. Taste is still smokey roast balanced.

Ruby brown color with a big tan foamy head.
Little or no carbonation that I can see.
Smokey aroma dominates everything else here aroma wise. There is a sutle roasted malt aroma.
Very smokey with some roasted malt flavors.
The smoked malt doesnt overpower the beer but instead inhances the flavor.
Medium body beer with a dry finish.
The flavor also reminds me of smoked cheese if you ever had it.
A good drinkable beer but in limited amounts.

The most classic of the old German Rauchbiers, applying a 16th-century Bamberg production method of smoking malt over a fire of beechwood. Pale beige, irregular, not very stable foam over a clear, deep bronze colour. Extremely powerful aroma which can hardly be mistaken for anything else (except for the two other Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbiers, that is); I will never forget my first encounter with this brew and my amazement of finding smoked ham, smoked herring, smoldering ashes of beech wood, broth and charcoal in the aroma, adorned by subtle tones of sweet malt and peppery hops. Tastes begins softly malty with a mineral-like accent but is quickly overpowered by the assertive smokiness, woodiness, peatiness and meatiness, to the extent that one could even describe its main character as almost salty, a taste rarely found in any beverage... Finish adds some grassy hops, but the smokiness remains overpowering till the last gulp, utterly dry and very, very long. An acquired taste and one Ill never forget, but a delightfully old-fashioned world classic from Bavaria.

Tasting @ Devonshire Cat, Sheffield. Pours dark amber with creamy head and smoky nose. Definite smokey bacon, with beechwood and well-balanced smoked malt, mellowing to a comfortable level throughout the glass. Works great with smoked salmon, the richness of the fish accentuating the malt character of the beer. A classic and long may it remain so.

Bottle from the LCBO served in a classic McDonalds Snow White tumbler, what else do you drink out of at the cottage? Its the proper glass isnt it? Pours a very dark, clear, amber with a couple of fingers of tan head that reduces to a half finger with lacing. Big smoke smell with a little baked beans and malt in the back. Big smoke on the taste, kinda sausage-like. Actually very sausage-like. Some saltiness and softer malts.

The body has a deep copper body with clear reddish highlights. On top it has a tall, light tan head that makes spotty and slick lacing on the glass. Its aroma is very smoky, like hardwood BBQ smoke, roasted malt and those imitation bacon bits that go on salads. There is a deep smoky wood character with grainy malt with hints of bacon. It has some mild sweetness underneath that is balanced buy some light mineral (salty metallic) notes and leafy hop bitterness. The palate has a slightly slick smooth feel with a medium body and carbonation. It finishes with a slow deep smoky fade off the tongue.

Couleur brune avec des reflets ambrée et une mince mousse durable. Nez intensément fumée et caramélisé. En bouche cest beaucoup plus rond, fumée, caramel, torréfaction, chocolat. Corps léger a moyen. Carbonation faible a moyenne. Peu damertume. Je suis pas fan de bière fumé... une bière correct...
I like the bottle; pours brown, off white head; aroma is smoked ham, really good; taste is sweet and smokey, like a souped up dunkel; its an acquired taste that I found myself acquiring quickly.

Pale tan head, clear mahogany body, dense laceworks.
Aroma; sundried seaweed, liquorice, dark malts, hints of smoke.
Taste; smoked liquorice, chocolate, malts. Normal nice on palate.
Finishes cocoa choco flourish, good and moreish.

Bottle bought the LCBO in Toronto/Canada. Overall a very good rauchbier. Smoked meat, bacon, saussages aroma. Dark brown coloe, head off white. Taste is malty, smoked meat, a bit watery, refreshing. Tasty.

Cola-ähnliche Farbe, schön dunkel. In der Nase extreme Röstaromen sowie Bacon und Rauch. Am Gaumen abermals Röstmalz, Bacon, herbe Bitterkeit gegen Ende. Vollmundiges Bier. Klassiker, aber nicht 100% mein Stil.

On tap in Piv.brana. Very heavily smoked, great smell, medium head. Good palate. Enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Butelka; Barwa miedziana. Piana drobna, ale szybko opada do obrączki. Aromat wędzonki, dymu, ogniska, delikatne nuty słodowe. W smaku dominuje wędzonka, która jest kontrowana przez przyjemną słodowość. Goryczka raczej delikatna.
Birra affumicata per eccellenza! Sembra di stare davanti ad un caminetto. I sentori affumicato e legnoso le fanno da padrona, accompagnati da un gradevole maltato e anche da un percepibile biscottato

Pours clear dark amber with a medium sized tan head. Smells smokey and hints of caramel. Taste is smoke, hints of sweetness, a kiss of bitterness. Medium-bodied with a wet texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Schlenkerla Rauchbier Märzen finishes with a lingering smokiness.
W aromacie szynkowa wedzonka z dymu bukowego. W smaku pelne: karmel, chleb, sliwka, dym. Klarowne, kolor ciemnobursztynowy. Ikona stylu.
