Bona cervesa molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza muy equilibrada y sabrosa.
Very interesting. Holy grail for those who love smoked beer. Good texture, very drinkable
On tap at T&P Tavern. Dark orange pour with an off-white head. Aroma is campfire and brisket. Taste is about the same. Lots of malt. Way more smoke.

Dark reddish brown colour. Loads of smoked sausage and other charcuterie scents, some maltiness, sauna furniture, no detectable hops. Palate is dry with a light to medium body and with a slightly burnt smokiness. No bitterness to speak of. Perfect as an easy drinking beer with plenty of character.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Botella de 50 cl en el lúpulo en varias ocasiones, la ultima en julio de 2013. color negro con unos increíbles sabores y aromas ahumados junto con maltas y cereales ligeramente tostados. Una autentica ración de bacon. Cuerpo ligero a medio fácil de beber, increíble sabor para sus solos 5.1 vol. Para repetir de nuevo.
bottle, 500ml. red color, white head that lasts. strong aroma of back, smoked. Pretty unique beer, something different

500 mL bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA. Light brown pour with a frothy khaki head. Aroma contains heavy smoke, cooked pork, oak, and light toffee. Campfire is prominent in the taste but the sweetness of the malt balances this so that the smoke is not overwhelming. Pairs very well with gouda and blue cheeses. An outstanding rauchbier.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2016 Pours with a very dark red colour, big long lasting white head. Aroma is medium malty and softly hoppy, additional very strong notes of smoke, nice (someone said bacon??). Taste is medium sweet, softly bitter, softly sour. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation.

Bottle 0.5l. This beer smells like bacon! It is a dark red beer with a medium creamy head that fades away in a minute or two. Taste is also of bacon, so maybe it should be renamed ¨bacon beer¨. Besides bacon, taste is also slightly watery and bitter. At the end, maybe the bacon taste and aroma overpowers the beer.

Ken shared a glass - thanks. Aroma is mostly smokey. Surprise… Pours a dark root beer hue with an off white ring and no lacing. The taste is 
peaty but malty notes were also detected. Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall, not as smoke dominate as some of the other Aecht Schlenferal I've sampled.

Bottle from Fyne Wines, Argyll. Copper brown, not as thick or dark as may be expected. Aromas of Smoked meats and peppered German salami. On the palate there are more overtones of smoke - particularly smoked meats - though far behind this there are hints of bitter orange, oak chips, unrefined demerara sugar and a garlic oiliness. Overall, the smoke clearly dominates at every stage of tasting; rich and full, but a bit too mono-dimensional for my palate.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours dark amber with a small tan head. Smokey aroma. Smokey taste with notes of caramel, malts, brown sugar. Soft carbonation. A bit oily texture. Smokey finish.

A- Pours a deep brownish black hue with a small, fizzy, 1.5 finger head that leaves no lacing.

S- Smoke, light yeastiness

T- Mildly yeasty up front moving into smoke, coupled with dark chocolate and slight bitterness that fades to yeasty lagery notes.

M- Medium bodied, ample carbonation.

D- Very strange. I tried to get into this beer and to me, it seemed like a very average lager with undertones of deep smokiness. Not as complex or interesting as I would have hoped.

500ml bottle. Pours dark clear brown with a minimal beige head. Has a pleasant barbeque pit smokiness on the nose with some toasted malt and grains underlying on the taste. A medium body on the palate with moderate carbonation. Finishes with a toasted malt, earthy grains with a gentle smoked campfire flavor. A very good drinking and enjoyable brew.

Flasa. Tmava hneda farba, kremova pena. Vona jemne troska sladka, nasledne otvorene masiarstvo. Krasne udene tony. V chuti prazene a karamelove slady, udeniny od najlepsich masiarov. Dymove dochute. Vyborne.

Flaska från SB. Brunsvart vätska med två fingrar högt skum. Massiva och kraftigt påtaglig arom av rökt korv, charkuterier och bröd. Läskande smak där rökigheten är något nedtonad. Kvar finns dock smaken av prickig korv. Låg balanserad beska. Funkar förvånansvärt bra till grillad korv.
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2014 The smoked taste is sharply evident. Almost so that it becomes a bit too much. Nevertheless a good, but very special beer

0,5l bottle into a tall schooner. Deep carmel color with a tall tan head. Nice light lacing. Smoke that is distinct but not overpowering allowing subtle sweet notes and a really round smooth finish. Excellent tasty nutty floral smokey.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Wonderfully evocative smell, burning meat, bacon, campfires. Pours dark, strong on flavour although I suspect smoked beer is an acquired taste of which this is my first experience.

0,5l bottle bought in p and m getränke in bonn, germany
aroma: ham, smoke, malty, slighlty fruity
appearance: dark brown colour, nice head
taste: smoky, slighlty ham, malty, bitter, but no clear hop aroma; the taste isnt as intense as the on-tap version

Lovely beer, taste and aroma are similar to that if a peaty scotch making for a sipping beer that is well worth the experience.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown with very small light brown head. Aroma is a glorious campfire, variety of smoked meats, woody. Taste is deep roasted caramel malt, smoke, wood chips. Very drinkable, not overpowering.. nails the style.

Rated this one from a bottle poured into lager glass but have had before from the historic brewhouse in Bamburg. Aroma of smoked meats, dark murky brown with some yeast suspended. The holy grail of smoke beers!

50cl bottle from BierNavigatie. Dark amber brown with a medium soapy slightly off-white head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Smokey (like smoked mackerel) with some sweet and bitter tones. Smoked malts, caramel, brown sugar, spices and herbs. A great smoked brew.

500 ml bottle from BG Birra, served in a goblet glass. Deep amber, perfectly clear, with a nice, creamy and persistent off-white head. Glorious aroma of burnt bacon, campfire smoke, slightly roasted malts, peat and paprika crisps. Perfectly balanced in the mouth, smoky upfront, obviously quite a bit meaty, then a hint of astringency, and a good, solid malty base. Certainly more bitter than sweet. Outstanding drinkability, I wouldnt call it a summer drink, but its so easy to chug. Average carbonation, light to medium body, sightly oily texture. Great!
Backlog. Bottle from Systembolaget. Obviously lots of peat and some charcuterie.

500ml bottle - pours a dark reddish/brown . Medium soft smoke aromas . Taste is smokey sweetness . Very approachable rauch bier . Delicious . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Wasnt sure Id like this, and the 3 others with me hated it! In the end I really enjoyed it, there is more to it than just smoke. Pours medium brown, nicely carbonated and, as expected, really strong aroma of smokey bacon. Smoke is very much there in the taste too, but well balanced with malt and fruit flavours. Weird, but one I would try again.

Poured very dark brown from 0.5l bottle. Immediate scent of smoked meat which was also present in initial taste. This is surely a unique experience for your taste buds as it ranges from smoke to charred wood to roasted barley. The aftertaste also varies from start to finish. Will surely try again.

I love this breweries smoked beers so when I walked into my local (The Macc, Macclesfield) I was well chuffed to see this on tap. Aroma is obviously smokey, its hugely smokey, smoked cheese and smoked bacon lovliness. Flavour is more smoked malt goodness. The Urbock is better of course but loved this all the same.

Bottle 0.5 l. Brown color. Medium-big white head. Some lacing. In aroma mostly smoke (smoked ham). In flavor also, maybe some roasted flavors. There is no some malt/hops complexity, but this is ok for me. Overall: great beer

Bottle. Clear dark brown with big off white head. Smell is first sweet malt then smoked sausage and then dried fruits. Taste is big sweet malt body with low bitterness. A lot of dried fruit and smoked meat.

If you want a classic smoked beer this it. And you get to continue tasting it hours later. Best with grilled or smoked meat or salmon. Clearly a specific style. Smoke is from beechwood used in the malting process.
The smoke flavor is fairly intense. It smells and tastes almost like charcoal to me. An interesting beer, but the smoke is a bit too intense for my taste. Good once a year though...
Uhhh...........smoke and Words words Words wordsWords words Words wordsWords words Words wordsWords words Words words
1/2 liter bottle at DLD. Smoke smoke smoke and a tad sweet. Words words more words
Very interesting aroma. Strong roasted and smoked flavor. It is an interesting beer

Bambergbe próbáltuk ki a sörfőzdébe negyedórás sorbanállás után. Hozta a várakozásokat, a folyékony zsíros szalonna ügyben. 
Korrekt, nekem nem jön be az íze. Túlságosan hívalkodó.

My first smoked beer. Chestnut in color with a small fizzy white head that disappears quickly. Smokey and meaty in aroma with some freshly tanned leather. Taste is malty with a lingering flavor like bark and grain. Mild bitterness finishes very dry. Mouthfeel is light and watery with medium-low carbonation. An interesting beer. The quality seems fine, but it may take a few of these to develop my palate for them. My first one was not that enjoyable and I have tried most styles.

Bottle from Le Bon Marché, half priced as the best before date was approaching & drunk 1 day after it "expired". A gusher, dark ruby brown with a thick beige head of foam plus some lacing. The aroma is fantastic bacon, some peat, roasty smokey goodness. A smooth soft mouthfeel with a full body. The taste is a dozen different kinds of smoke playing in my mouth, served at 16C the flavors are kind of intense, smoke, caramel, light tobacco, honey glazed ham, toffee, etc. Great stuff, theres a reason its a classic!

On tap at Barley Brothers, Winnipeg. My first smoked beer. Deep, clear, golden amber pour with a creamy off-white head. Smoky nose, but not overpowering, with some subtle malty caramel and fruity notes shining through. Flavour is less smoky, nicely balanced with caramel and fruit, notes of light fruits like apple and pear, and a very slight tangy edge.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Pours dark brown with reddish hue, nice foamy head. Aroma is amazing, very smoky, a kind of beefy smoke aroma which is sticky, some nutty toast and roast, perfectly combined. Taste is first very toned down compared to aroma, a lot of smoke though, a bit roasty, and a bit bready, but it still feels watery, its easy going, but with a wonderful complex aroma, and a more than decent taste.
beautiful dark beer with long lived foam.strong smoke in the taste but at the core a bit watery.-- via beerbasher/winphone

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée à la LCBO de Hawkesbury. Dégustée le 30 août 2009 (lager glass). Bière brune foncée tirant sour le rouge. Mousse beaucoup, col beige, crémeux, compact, épais et persistant. Très effervescente, bulles moyennes à grosses. Odeur de fumée marquée, de bois brûlé, de jambon fumé. Goût de fumée bien présent, saveur +/- agréable, un peu âcre. Donne limpression de boire un "feu de camp liquide". Il sagit probablement dune très bonne bière pour ce style mais il faut aimer ce genre de bière pour vraiment lapprécier, ce qui nest pas mon cas. Pour moi, larôme et le goût de fumée sont trop prononcés, ce qui enterre le tout et rend cette bière unidimensionnelle.
Dark pour with a nice head, smoky, malt and wood aroma. Taste is balanced, obvious smoke notes, malty elements, quite a light body. Quality beer

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2014 Dark brown beer with a huge beautiful brown head, very unusual for a lager, as it is. Smell is nicely smoked, it reminds soon some bacon/italian speck. Taste is also smoked, but not too much as I was afraid to taste, very balanced, and there are also some light tobacco notes. Mouthfeel is perfect, this beer is filling the palate, and since it has quite a low carbonation, its also very drinkable.
It was my first smoked beer, and I was positively impressed! I really enjoyed it.
Im sure that with some heavy stew or game dishes it fits very well. To drink it alone, instead, is good but one bottle is more than enough.
UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color marron oscuro. Sabor a malta tostada, salmon ahumado. Muy fresca. Una cerveza muy sabrosa.

Bottle. Pours a clear ruby red, brownish beer with a small beige head on top. Aroma has some malts, caramel, nuts and earthy touches. Flavor has a subtle smoke influence in the back of the taste. It starts off quite sweet and nutty. Some light red fruits detected. Aftertaste is short, watery mouthfeel and soft carbo. Decent, subtle smoke beer.

Bottle from Redmonds. Deep, dark brown, milky coloured foamy white head, doesnt last. Roasted malt, smoked malt in the aroma, tcp, peat and definite bacon notes. Follow follows the nose closely, peaty, bacony malt heavy, decent body, low carbonation. Finish is the same as the flavour, lasting. No messing around here.
Flaska från systemet. Brun färg med en tunn skumkrona. Doftar och smakar rökt skinka.

Ahh, Schlenkerla! One of my favorite beers since many years.. But havent been drinking it in a while. I first drank it in the original Schlenkerla Bar in Bamberg, the overall atmosphere of the city and Beer combined made a great impression on me, and that has stuck Highly recommendable!

Dark brown, with a medium, tanned head with a good retention time.Smokey smell, with hints of red fruits. Also quite smokey taste, malty, medium bitterness, some grassy notes, full body and a long lasting smokey aftertaste.

Im not a big fan of smoked beers, but this is really drinkable.

A very special beer!! .....
Gout de jambon fumé....
Marrante à découvrir :)

Bottled. Brown closer to the red hazy color, thin but stable beauge foam. Nice aroma based around smoked bacon. Tastes solid, medium body, some sweetness with some bitterness around. Decent smoked beer.
Aroma is log cabin, campfire. Taste is clean lager, malty finish with smoky bacon flavor. Surprisingly pleasant.
A rich dark brown colour with light carbonation and almost no head. A smokey aroma and a taste of wood smoke with a smokey oily palate

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2016 Reddish brown color, huge staying tan head. Some lacing also. Medium body, average to high carbonation. Aroma is smoke, pancetta, roasted malts. Taste is on the sweet side, fruity, maybe raisins. Low bitterness, if any. Also, its little bit too thin. Other than that, excellent smoked beer.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Clear dark ruby, brown with light brown lacing foam head. Aroma is stark smokey, old barbeque wood. Tastes quite smokey also, interesting. Lasting fresh char coal aftertaste. (Velp 201403)

Pours a deep dark amber almost black with tan Carmel head aromas a very heavy smoke and malt. Taste is mostly a nice mellow smoked beef and roasted malt . Nice balance with a true smoke flavor and malt
50cl bottle. Red dark color with thin medium head. Light sweetness. Nice saltyness. Salmon, bacon and smoke.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv rauchig, Schinken, leicht röstmalzig. 
Geschmack rauchig, würzig, geräucherter Schinken, klasse!
cereal, toast, brown, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, lively,
33cl fles. Donkere kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : rook, bbq, zwaar.
In fles van 0,5l. Zwart van kleur met een normale schuimkop. Doet zijn naam eer aan.... smaakt en ruikt naar rook.
Strong burnt-smokey flavour, medium carbonation, firm head, great smoked meat aftertaste, beautiful, flavour rich beer.
Delicious! Strong burnt wood aroma, medium body. Very smoky taste, with a hint of licorice and banana. Makes me imagine Im in a log cabin in the winter.
Bottled , Cesky Brod , CZ , Malt,caramel,burnt wood and strong smokey aroma , Clear brown amber color with bigger lacing head , Sweet taste with long smoked finish , Medium body , Very pleasant.
500ml bottle (dated 08/2013) Dark amber with creamy white head. Aroma has heavy smoke and bacon. Taste is beautiful balanced with salt smoke, malts and hops, with thick chewy smoke flavors.
Smoked beers aren't really my deal, but this has enough balance to keep it drinkable. Doesn't overpower.
UPDATED: SEP 1, 2014 Nice dark amber color, medium tan head. Medium carbonation. Creamy feel, full body. Finish is smoked meat.

Draft into tulip glass. Dark espresso color with off white, thick head. Aroma is heavy smoke, some hickory, sage. Taste is smokey malty, not sweet though. Small amount of hops, not bitter at all. Very nice mouthfeel, heavy, a little chewy almost. Nice beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 500 ml at home, many thanks to McTapps! Into a Guinness pint, ABV 5.1%
Beautiful very dark brown, almost black colour on the body, with two fingers of thick, tan head sittinig on top of it. Good retention, medium lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of smoke, peat, smoked ham, light wood.
Taste follows, lots of smoke and peat, taste like a good smoked ham. Very good.
A bit thin on the body, soft carbonation. Dry on the palate and a numbing feeling on the tongue.
Very good smoked!

Poured from bottle to glass. Dark copper hue with off white head. Aroma campfire, caramel, cola, cloves, lager-like esters. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a medium body and good carbonation lends to its creaminess. Taste is sweet initially with a savory smokiness throughout the finish combined with a nice CO2 sharpness to round everything off. Overall this is a fantastic raunch bier! Not too much of anything...well proportioned and VERY balanced!
If it werent for Schlenkerlas Urbock and Eiche, this would be my favorite Rauchbier. Similar smoke notes as for the Urbock, but thinner and less robust. Still an excellent beer.

Bamberger Bierwochenende, Bier Nr. 3. - Vom Faß im Schlenkerla, Bamberg. - Dunkles Goldbraun, klar. In der Nase Karamel, Blockmalz, Schwarzwälder Schinken, Rauch, leichte Frucht. Das unverkennbare Schlenkerla-Raucharoma ist zunächst gewöhnungsbedürftig. Erst nach einiger Gewöhnung schmeckt man angenehm aromatische Karamelsüße mit Noten von Mokka und Nuß. Mild rezent. Leicht, ja schlank; zart salzig. Im Abgang etwas holzig und trocken; schwächer gehopft als in meiner Erinnerung. Leicht bitterer Nachtrunk. - Ein Bier der Extraklasse, bei dem das nächste Glas tatsächlich immer besser ist als das vorige. Komplex und harmonisch, schmeckt es bei jedem Besuch ein wenig anders. Diesmal fiel mir besonders die Fruchtigkeit auf. Nur das Schlenkerla-Fastenbier ist noch besser ...

Cerveja muito interessante da região de Bamberg. Cor escura, quase preta. Aroma singular de maltes defumados, remetendo a carnes de porco. O sabor não se traduz nisso, ficando em um agradável tostado.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a big creamy head. Aroma is heavy burned malts, peat and campfire smoke. Medium body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with well roasted and burned malts, oak and caramel.

Aroma is very very smokey with caramel and roasty notes. Tastes of ash and smoke. Rich caramel malts picked up aswell. Appearance is clear dark amber body with a thin pearl head with medium retention.

Bacon beer! Thats the way I describe it to unsuspecting first time drinkers. I lived in Bamberg where this beer is brewed, and the rating is based upon drinking the beer in their Brewery Ausschank in Bamberg. Aroma is of smoked meat, mostly bacon. Taste has a distinct bacon flavor, but not overpowering. The bottles available in the United States lose some of the quality, but it is still a great, and interesting beer.

Cerveja defumada, estilo que particularmente vai melhor numa harmonização do que somente a cerveja. Coloração âmbar-escura, espuma de boa formação e estabilidade, aroma intenso de malte defumado, sabor defumado, amargor sutil e residual defumado.
Degustada na Confraria do Malte - Cabo Frio - RJ

Currently drinking whilst typing and on tap in Benson & Blakes. Wow! Aroma is of sweet beechwood smokiness melded with a very mellow hop note. Looks like one dark vessel like mahogany with a fluffy smooth head of a cream colour. Taste is just like a ham sandwich! Beautifully sweet beechwood smoked malts dance in the mouth whilst smooth and subtle hops give great quality to the beer, aiding a rather clean and pleasant after taste. Smooth and clean on the palate with a gentle carbonation, medium bodied with a texture like velvet. Overall very good, a beer that I can happily have for my dinner!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rødbrun klar med beige skum. Lukter røkt skinke. Lettere smak av røyk enn i lukt, salt smak, noe bitter brent karamell også i smak. Kort og lite bitter ettersmak.

Bottle bier huis ossett. Red brown colour shortlived beige head. Aroma is strong burnt wood. Taste sweet malts followed by strong Smokey woody flavours leaves a long lasting Smokey taste in the mouth like If ude just eaten a box full of used matchsticks. Medium body soft carbonation. Good stuff ecspecialy If u like looking around fire damaged houses.

Massive smoke nose. Clear and dark with white foam. Sweet malts start light, but then toasty notes as the smoke wells up on the palette. Smoke lingers long in the finish with a woody bitterness. A definite favorite for those who love smoke.

(bouteille de 500ml âgée 4 ans) - En ouvrant cette bouteille quon mavait conseiller de laisser maturer quelques années, je ne mattendais à rien. En fait, janticipais le désastre autant que lémerveillement. Je verse la bière. Elle semble plutôt tranquille. Brune foncée aux reflets rubis. Le nez est magnifique, comme un incendie qui respire encore de ses cendres et qui laisse miroiter un espoir de reconstruction. Ça sent le vestige dun brasier qui veut revivre. En bouche, la fumée semble sêtre légèrement atténuée par rapport au produit qui aurait été servi frais. Aucune ride en bouche, cest impressionnant. La fumée enrobe un liquide légèrement caramélisé et grillé qui sillustre pratiquement sans défaut. Il sagit du meilleur produit à garder quelques années selon mes multiples expériences de vieillissement des dernières années. Il sagit aussi de la meilleure bière fumée quil ma été donné de savourer. La prochaine fois, je garde une bouteille 5 ans, juste pour voir...

500ml bottle from Tallinn, Dark brown colour, medium mostly dissipating off-white rocky head, fair bit of lacing. Roasty malts in aroma with plenty of smoke and tar along with some hints of resiny hops. Taste is initially slightly sweet, roasty and somewhat meaty, moderately bitter roasty finish. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture. Not bad at all, as a friend of all things smoked I enjoyed it quite a bit, hop profile couldve been more interesting though.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought from Malting Pot in Brussels. Smokey flavour dominates the taste but very pleasant. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours opaque brown with two-fingers, creamy head. Aromas of campfire, bacon, smoked ham with malty background. Smoked taste with wood notes. Light sweetness with roasted character. Nice, light bitterness in the finish. Little hop aroma. Good beer.

50cl butelka. 
OCZY : kolor ma mahoniowy. Piana jest średniej wielkości o kolorze beżowo-szarym. 

NOS : kawa z mlekiem, orzechy, toffi, banan, oscypek, węgiel drzewny. 

USTA : ma teksturę oleistą i jest dosyć dobrze gazowane. Słodkie o nutkach przypalanego karmelu i słodkiej kawy. Delikatnie kwaśnieje po chwili trzymane w ustach. Kwas podobny do zsiadłego mleka. Podczas przełykania zaczyna dochodzić gorzki jak węgiel smak. W posmaku wszystkie nuty się wygasiły pozostawiając delikatny smaczek zadymionego węgla. 

ODCZUCIE : piwo to jest mniej fantastyczne od Urbocka ale wciąż jeden z lepszych wędzonych piw jakie piłem. Bogate ale równocześnie łatwe w piciu. Opisuje to piwo zaraz po przyjściu z pracy i jestem naprawdę usatysfakcjonowany. Perfekt na tego typu relaks. 

OCENA : 
smak : 7/10
pijalność : 7/10
On tap at barley bros winnipeg. Nice smoke aroma. Also some sweet malts behind it. The taste is smoother and less harsh than some rauchbiers. I liked this a lot.

500ml bottle. Toronto, Ontario. Pours an almost opaque brown colour with a small creamy head which settles quickly. It has a smokey aroma which reminds me of the summer nights I spent at my cottage sitting around the campfire. It tastes smokey and hoppy with notes of metallic taste. Medium carbonation.
While smoked beers remain to be my least favorite style... I can appreciate the original. Nice campfire and bacon aromas. Flavors are smoky with a touch of bitter in the end.

500ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. One finger tan head which settles quickly. Dark brown, reddish, almost opaque body. Aroma is mainly smoked caviar, bacon and malt. Sweet on the tongue, light bitterness.
Shared 50 cl bottle. Pours dark bronze with a small head. Aroma is loads of smoke and sweet malts. Taste is again smoke and sweet bread.

Color - brown, with bronze-red tint, transparent to the light reddish. 
Foam - hearty, creamy, light yellow color, dirty, slightly gray, resistant (3-4 min), sticky. 
Fragrance - smoke (like clothes smelled campfire), bacon, shpikachki, singed pork skin. Smoked flavor is very pronounced, clogs everything else later on their way - coffee and wood notes. 
Taste - a balanced, harmonious - smoked bacon, roasted malt bitterness and hops, light sweetness in the finish. Body average density, average carbonation, long aftertaste, bitter.
Overall, a wonderful beer, no complaints, but we must understand that the kind of beer, drinking is often not desirable.

La mia prima Rauchbier. Una birra davvero stranissima e particolare. Inizialmente ero un pò scettico...infatti allodore mi ha portato alla mente la pancetta affumicata e al sapore la sensazione non è cambiata e devo dire che la cosa mi ha alquanto sconcertato. Al secondo sorso e cominciando a prendere confidenza con lodore che oramai si era fatto piacevole devo dire di aver apprezzato questa birra...Colore castano luminoso e schiuma beige molto densa. Da provare e riprovare ancora! BUONISSIMA!

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2016 Pours deep brown with moderate creamy head. Aroma of malt, smoke, caramel. The palate is medium. Nice combination of caramel and smoke on tongue. Smooth & dense. Now I at last dig it. Very good. A bit more hop on ending would make it even  perfect
Røget bacon, lejrbål. Klar mørkebrun med lille skum. Fyldig fornemmelse. Tæt, fyldig smag, knap så markant som aroma. Let bitterhed men samtidig forholdsvis frisk. Medium eftersmag, malt dukker op.
Bottle, 500 ml, at Pivkan, Zagreb. Pours dark brown, as expected tastes like smoked bacon or cheese. Not everyone will like it, but well worth trying.

Look: Pours with a huge frothy light-brown head, medium sized bubbles. Slow retention, mostly diminishing. A thin unequal layer stays on top. Leaves good amount of sticky lacing. Lots of visible carbonation. Color is clear dark brownish/black with strong red hue.


Smell: Holy shit. Bacon. Read about it, but didnt really believe it. Fun and interesting. Also some light smokiness, caramel sweetness and herbal freshness underneath. 


Taste: Light/medium pleasant caramel, light herbal spike, lightly roasted bitterness and then full-on bacon at the end. Maybe some hop in the bitterness and a hint of tart.


Mouthfeel: Light/medium creamy body, fair amount of carbonation - makes it lighter and very easy to drink. 


Overall: Sexy bacon beer. Fo real. Try it.

Bottle pour at Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA.
This is a campfire in a bottle and I love it immensely.
Veneentervauksen Janojuoma. Tervapastillia ja piipputupakkaa. Yllättävänkin hyvä tuttavuus. Junnujen mm-finaalin aikaan.

Great beer! Brown color, mid-sized off-white head. Aroma of smoked ham and malt. Taste is similar to aroma with smoked wood notes. Medium body and carbonation. Moderate bitterness in smoked and roasted aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle. Pours dark brown liquid with ruby reflections in the translucent body. No head, the minimum that appeared disappeared immediately. Aroma of smoked ham, smoked wooden tones, caramel. Medium body, lively carbonation, very drinkable. I would say a nice fresh easy drinking beer for spring holidays- sunny day in Austrian Alps on snowboard or for Easter holidays - I can imagine drinking this on Easter Monday by the whipping festive tradition. Taste is very pleasant, lightlz smoked ham, meaty flavor, lively carbonation as it should be for a lager (Märzen), typical lager bitterness in the aftertaste. Strong malty notes. Caramel only on the beginning as a harmonic complement.

500 ml bottle. Pours a very dark garnet/brown with light head. Aromas of heavily smoked bacon. Flavors of hickory/birch smoke and underlying roasted malts. Nicely done, not overpowering or overly heavy - like good smoked meat.
500 ml bottle, Dublin. Dark brown pour with average head. Light texture, smoky aroma and taste.
Pours a dark brown beer with a good white head. Smells bacon and malts. Tastes about the same. Average carbo, thin body and a watery texture.
0,5l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head and nice lacing. Nice smokey aroma, similar to smoked ham. Taste is also quite smokey with some bitterness. Very unique taste and aroma.

Bottle from P+M Getränke. Very big, white head, beer pours very dark, nearly black.
Has rich smoked flavors, reminding me of smoked ham and fire. Tastes of smoked wood and ham, carbonation supports the intense taste very well, piney wood tastes get stronger while the beer warms up. A sweet, crunchy roastiness defines this beer for me. Gets supported by a throughout pleasant malt body, which lets the smoke flavor stand out, both go together very well. Enjoyable, warming finish, whith some salts in it.

Bottle at de Paas. Pours dark brown with a generous beige head. Aroma is tobacco, smoke, caramel, malty and some pine. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Quite tasty. Nice balance and long smoky finish.

Tummanvärinen, miltei läpinäkymättömän musta. Tuoksussa tummaa, paahteista mallasta. Aavistus savua ja aavistus makeutta, hieman leipämäinen. Maku maltainen, hieman makea, humalaisuus tulee miellyttävästi esiin jälkimaissa. Suutuntuma hieman hapokas ja melko täyteläinen. Miellyttävä, tasapainoinen kokonaisuus.-- via beerbasher
Bottle->tumbler. Dark brown with faint lite tan head. Smoky bacon dominates, with malt undertones. If you like this style, this is a must-have.
Very little head, heavy, Amazing smoke flavor. Almost tastes like bacon!

Im Antrunk etwas laff ist der Hauptteil neutral-süffig. Erst im Nachgeschmack entfaltet sich die Rauchnote vollkommen. Auch liegt der Schwerpunkt dieses Rauchbieres im Nachgeschmack, der neben der Rauchigkeit auch noch eine ziemlich trockene Herbe aufweist - und für meinen Geschmack zu herb, da die Herbe schon fast eine Konkurrenz zur Rauchigkeit darstellt. 
Insgesamt ist es ein durchaus schönes Rauchbier!


Test vom 20.2.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,10,11,10,12,10 - 10,45

shared bottle (thank god) at a bar. poured a dark brown colour with a ligt tan head. smell is intense smoked bacon and a parma ham. cant say much about the taste. its completely smoked. its like eating the skin of a parmaham drowned in a used ashtray. no... its a kind of beer you like or not. i;m not a fan. nice to try.

I was introduced to this little oddity earlier this year when I went to visit a friend in London, he took me to a nice German pub he was fond of and insisted I give this a try and Ive since had a couple more bottles of it. It pours a dark brown and the smell instantly made me think of smoked bacon (yum!) but how would this fare in the form of a beer? The taste is what I expected with the smoked bacon and a slight woody quality to it, along with a this malty sweetness balanced with a little bitterness. I certainly enjoy it but it wouldnt be an everyday beer and something to drink when I am in the mood for it. Anyone who likes beer should definitely try it even just once!

Huele literalmente a aslchichas de cerveza y bacon. El ahumado es muy marcado, ideal apra los fans del estilo. Es como comer una barbacoa. Muy oscura, queso idiazabal, todo lo ahumado que uno conozca concentrado en la cerveza. Puede entusiasmar, puede saturar o puede espantar, depende de cada uno.
Smells like pepperidge farms smoked sausage. Peppery, beef, pork. Dark brown, no head. Taste is malty, and strange with all the sausage flavors. Watery.

500 ml. bottle. Ive had this beer before a few times, but never rated it for some reason. It pours a very dark amber/brown color with a lasting khaki ring of foam. The aroma is so distinct with campfire burnt wood and beef jerky. Savory, salty and smoky. The flavor has more savory notes and not quite as much smoke as the aroma. Pretty dry with a smoky aftertaste. Good body, but pretty light. Maybe could use a touch of sweetness... otherwise, this is THE smoked beer.

Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Märzen
Smag: Krafitg duft af røg, bacon. vanilje ege, 
Smag: røg, vanilje pulver, mærk malt. frugtig.

Reviewed 07/01/10
Poured from bottle to new belgium tulip.

A: Dark brown and deep ruby. No head. No visible bubbles. Excellent clarity.

S: Smells like a campfire. Very comforting and embodying of outdoors experience. I would argue, for the style, over smoked.

T: Super smokey. Great for pairing with sausage lunch. Would pair well with sauerkraut or other acidic foods. Mostly like liquid smoke.

M: When chilled, a bit awkward as the body is medium light with quite a dry finish. Much more enjoyable as the beer warms - the smoke is more appropriate as it warms.

D: Good beer for times when longing for the outdoors, childhood memories and for occassional novelty beer. Nice, nice beer. Not among the top of the smoke beers IMO. Although, having been to Geramany, the rauchbiers are much better there.

Serving type: bottle

12-21-2010
Bière très originale aux saveurs fumées. En fait, le fumé dissimule un peu trop le reste de la saveur. Très rafraîchissante en bouche. Plus jen bois, plus japprécie. Une belle surprise.
UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 A very special beer. Strong smoke flavour and taste of smoked bacon are dominating. Rich maltiness adds to the extraordinary impression. Love it or hate it.

Aroma: smoky bacon (like breakfast this morning...). Appearance: dark brown, almost black, small light head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: light bitter, releasing smoky flavours again. Overall: very special beer - not for every day. Bottle from Wittich Weine, Switzerland.
Bottle. Smoked aroma. Really nice! Sweet smoky bacon taste with nice heavy body. Short sweet malty finish. Really good beer!
0,5l bottle. A dark red/amber beer with light brown head. Smoked aroma. Slightly bitter flavor with notes of bacon.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2013 Bottle. Clear dark brown with a medium sized creamy off white head. Smoked salmon, bark, wood, dark bread. Medium body, soft carbonation, soft and creamy texture. Malty sweet with little bitterness. Very pleasant.

Nice, hearty nose with an interplay of smoke and malty goodness (caramel, smoked ham, bacon ice cream, a bit of wood...). Cant comment much on the palate, as the bottle was mishandled. Solid taste with moderate bitterness and sweetness, with a lingering smoky aftertaste. Very nice.
On tap at beer revolution. Clear dark brown. Great gentle hop, robust yet smooth smoked aroma. Taste is nicely bitter with a roasty, dry finish.

Barva: tmavá rubínová jiskra. Vůně: nádherná uzená lehká. Pěna: drící. Chuť: fantastický uzený nástup s kouřovým pozadím v plném těle s vyím řízem, vyvýenou hořřkostí. Dlouhý "uzeno - chmelový dozvuk" Výborné pivo.

Keg at BD Shepsy B. It pours dark brown with a medium beige head. The nose is smoky, bacon frazzles, light roast and some candy/caramel action. The taste is earthy, toast, smoke, bacon frazzles, meat and caramel with a bitter-sweet finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Smooth and very drinkable. Nice example of the style.

(Bottle): Pours a mahogany with a tan head. Aroma of smoked bacon, burnt wood and toast. Flavour is at first just a mouthful of smoked ham/bacon but as you continue drinking and get over the initial meaty flavours, you get some real nice burnt notes, toasty malt, sweet caramel and ash. Unusual but surprisingly nice.

Dark red copper, frothy tan head, vanishes quickly, strong smoky aroma from beginning till end, smoked sausage bacon/ham, wood, oak, malty medium sweet taste, medium to full-body, creamy texture, long dry smoky and bitter finish, hint of salt, earthy

Bottle poured a clear brown hue w/ a large beige slowly diminishing head w/ thick sticky lacing. Bold smoky aroma. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a smoke filled finish. Tastes are smoke, ash, malt, and cigar. Medium bodied, well carbonated, and watery mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Clear dark redish brown colour, medium off-white head. Aroma of sweetish toasted malt and smoked ham. The flavour is sweetish, toasted malty, smoky, with a lingering, bitter and smoky aftertaste. Not my favourite Schlenkerla, but pretty good nevertheless.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Tap at BD Shepherds Bush. Not sure what to make of this. To be fair I havent had a great deal of intensely smokey beers. This is basically the equivalent of 10 pieces of bacon smooshed between two pieces of bread. Oddly decent

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2017 Niestety, wędzonka jak wędzonka... W zapachu silne nuty słodowe połączone z kiełbasianymi akcentami. W smaku już silna kiełbasa, ale dość dobrze zbalansowana przez mocno karmelowy słodowy zasyp. Piłem wcześniej inne wędzonki, które smakowały podobnie lub ciut gorzej. Jako, że ta jest archetypowa stwierdzam, że to nie mój styl. 3.2
EDIT
Jaki karmel? Śliwka! Czysty profil. Ognisko, nie kiełbasa w smaku. Dużo, dużo lepiej.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with a medium sized, beige head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, caramel and smoke. Sweet flavor that ends up with a mild smokeyness and bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily text. and soft carb. A nice smoked indeed.

Flott mørk farge og kremaktig tykt skum. Lite kullsyre, lukter kraftig av brent treverk og kaffe. Smaker som den lukter, dette var ikke helt min type. Lang, bitter og "røykaktig" ettersmak som varer lenge.
Das erste Rauchier. Dunkel, cremig mit einem schönen Schaum. Intensives Raucharoma, spannend. Toll zu deftigen Speisen. Erinnert ein wenig an einen sehr guten Schinken.

First Rauchbier I ever drank. Interesting smell, of course as others wrote it reminds of ham or bacon, but it reminded me even more about "Lapsang Souchong" I used to drink regularly a few years back.

It was the last bier in a tasting evening, its certainly interesting to pair this beer with food. 

Im certainly looking forward to discover other Rauchbier.

500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours chestnut brown with a big white long-lasting head. Aromas of smoked cheese, ham, and soy. In the now immortal words of a friend of a friend, "It tastes like I have a pork product in my mouth." I think she was vegetarian. About halfway down it starts to taste like a more normal beer, which I guess is your brain adjusting.

This is a fantastic beer. Mahogany, big white head. Superb flavours of bacon and smoked ham. Taste is wonderfuly balanced, despite the strong smokiness: just the right level of sweetnees and bitterness. Long aftertaste.

Love this smoked beer. Deep dark brown pour with slight creamy head. Aroma hits you like a powerful campfire, with malts and oak as well. The taste has a nice smoked ham flavor with some burn sugar, caramel, and a touch of bitterness. Mouthfeel is creamy and nicely carbonated. Not too flat or too thick. Wonderful.
Bière brune. Senteur de fumée, de saucisse et de bacon. Goût de malt fumé bien présent mais sans tout recouvrir. Très interessant et très bon !
From a bottle. The initial impression is that this is very smoky. Its also tasty and refreshing. Creamy, somewhat malty.
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (26:-). Rök och charkuterier i doften som påminner om bränt trä. Även i smaken finns det rök och charkuterier men också lakrits.
Bottle. Pours deep dark opaque brown with a layer of cream colored head. Aroma of smokey goodness. Taste of smoke with a move balance of carbonation.

Bottle. Pours dark, tawny brown with creamy off-white head. Aroma is smoked pork, toasted malts, light toffee, light woody notes, and plums. Flavor is dry malts, smoked meat, light earthy hops, and faint dark fruit esters, dry, smokey finish. Medium body and low carbonation.
From a bottle. Pours clear medium/dark brown with a creamy off white head and some lacing. Tastes very smokey, ashy, earthy. Low/medium body and light carbonation. Smells like smoked meat and ash.

Dark brown maltbier. Generous, dirty head with a red tint. Smells like mild bbq smoke. Tastes even better. This brewery knows how to smoke malt to a T making the most enjoyable smoked beers. Sounds horrible, tastes awesome. This ones a little milder than the others Ive tried.

bouteille de 500ml de brune. arome puissante de jambon fumé et de tire. gout de fumé assez puissant. notes de bois. un peu sucré et petite amertume. bonne avec des arachides BBQ mais seule nest pas super... pas fait pour tout le monde

Poured from bottle into Tulip glass. Pours a light brown that's fairly see through. Almost no head. Thin body. Taste is surprisingly subtle. Soft malt sweetness with a background smoke flavor that builds throughout the taste. While the smoke is surely present, it's not overpowering or even salient. In fact, the entire taste is a bit muted. I would like to see some bolder flavors here. However, the brew is well balanced and has decent mouthfeel and carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours oil spill black with a thin cap. Before I can even tell her to come over & smell the glass Shawna says what in the world is that? Unlike other reviewers below I dont find the smoke too much. Yeah its full force but it doesnt flatten the tongue. This is less southern bbq & more smoked cold cuts. Think of Lapsong Souchong (Winston Churchills smoked black tea). This is great as I put the finishing touches on my Memphis style ribs (and will really rise to the occasion as I eat them).

gob smacking assault on the taste buds aroma is smokey like a barbecue dish,taste is smoke with dry bitter finish ,with good body if like smoked food you will love this,one my favourites,some people take time to get a taste for this i loved it from first try

A: Foam gushing out of the top of the bottle. Cola brown. Frothy off-white head.

S: Smoked bacon.

T: Very chocolaty. Smokey bacon. Half sweet. Vinous chocolaty aftertaste.

M: Very lively.

O: Not as bacon tasting as other Rauchbiers I've had. Pretty good but not something I'd have without food.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 This is a very intense beer. The first time I tried it I hated it. It has since grown on me. Smoked malts dominate the aroma. Brown lager with tan head. Some sweetness underneath the smokey malts. A terrific beer to eat smoked sausages and bread with. A classic.
Bottle from BeerRitz, Leeds. Dark mahogany beer with a white head. Tastes of smoked ham at first. Loads of smokey flavour. Get more enjoyable the more you drink. Very good in the end.

Dark brown with an off-white head that reduces to a thin layer of foam. 
Aroma is very smoky, smoked meat, campfire flashbacks. 
Taste is also very smoky (ham/meat) but has some sweet malts and light caramel. Has a nice smoky aftertaste. Medium bodied, very enjoyable.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2014 Intense aroma of smoke sauna. Appearance: dark brown, slight brown head, which stays for a little. Taste: smoke is dominant, but there is also some sweetness, bitterness and saltiness, caramel is also noticable and cola. Aftertaste has pleasant cola bitterness, which last for some time. Medium carbonation. Overall: this is one of the great ones that every beer lover should taste at least once in his/hers lifetime.
de couileur abrune foncer on sens des aromes de malt fume avec copeaux de bois avec un leger gout de caramel on goute le fumé mais c est pas trop massivecomme gout tres bonne biere quand meme

Première "Rauchbier" que je goûte. Cest très étonnant. Une odeur de fumé et de charcuterie, cest assez frappant. La première chose à laquelle jai pensé : voilà une bière à boire avec une bonne choucroute.
Une couleur assez sombre, mais une texture qui reste assez légère et beaucoup moins écurante que ce que lon pourrait croire. Le goût est assez bon et construit avec une dominante très nette du fumé.
Vuurstapel, gerookte paling en kaneelkoek als aroma. Smaak is mild rokerig met typisch peperig zoetje, fijn mondgevoel. Dunne platte kraag op donker bruinzwart.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2015 Bottle 50cl. Clear amber brown, small creamy beige head, recedes slowly to a thin layer, good lacing; strong smoked aroma, smoked ham, sausage, peat, burned wood; taste medium sweet, light bitter, roasted malts, meaty but foremost smoky; medium body, oily to watery texture, mild bittersweet aftertaste, bit salty and still smoky and meaty; very special, very good. Retasted 150205: taste more mild and balanced than at first tasting (better temperature?) resulting in higher score (was 3.7).

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2014 0.5l bottle at home, pours brown with nice off-white head. Smoked sausage all the way. Some caramel malts and perhaps coffee and some nuttiness. The smokiness is medium-level, compared to their Doppelbock for example, but pleasant. The savoury, meaty flavour remains the whole way through, although this beer could do with more intensity as the flavours are so lovely they deserve more attention. Medium-bodied and a light carbonation with a drawn out finish leaving some bitterness at the end. I do like this, but it?s not their best.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2015 Bière brune aux reflets rubis cuivrées, plutôt limpide, effervescence moyenne, surmontée dun col beige pas tellement large, mais très mousseux, bien dense et persistant. Arômes totalement dominant de malt fumé, ça sent la fumée, le bacon, la viande fumée et le charbon de bois. Derrière cet écran de fumée, on peut percevoir quelques subtils effluves de pain grillé, de céréale et dun léger caramel. Il sagit dun très beau nez, très appétissant, très intense, complexité plutôt moyenne cependant (cest presque tout en malt fumé!). En bouche, pétillement faible sur la langue, belle onctuosité au palais cependant, cest rond et velouté. Au goût, comme le nez laissait présager, le malt fumé domine avec ses saveurs de fumée, bacon, viande fumée et charbon de bois. Et on retrouve davantage en arrière-plan les notes de pain grillé, céréale et léger caramel. La finale apporte une amertume plutôt faible mais tout de même bien sentie sans goût houblonné particulier (le malt fumé est sans doute trop dominant!). Très bon goût, intégration des différentes saveurs bien réussie considérant la domination du malt fumé, un peu moins intense en bouche quau nez, complexité toujours plutôt moyenne. Très bonne bière!
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

Bottle. Pours a deep copper brown with off a soft white head and a little lace. The aroma is savory peppery smoked meat. The flavor is less so these things but rides out with a distinct smokiness after a balanced clean malty and earthy bitter middle. Feel is lively soft, fairly fresh, very slightly metallic. Its just awesome. Thankfully I found a place where I can get them for only $5

Djup brun öl med brunt skum. Doft: Tjära, ved, grill, fresh höst luft, svart te, rökt korv. Väl balanserad rök doft. Smak: Rökt kött, tjära, sött svart te, malt. Balanserad och fresh smak, dessutom mycket lätt drucken.

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Dark brown colour with dark head. Since this is a smoked beer it has the smell of smoke. Taste is similar to other beers made from dark roasted malts but with the addition of smoke. Well, I tasted also some tar. A bit on the light side, since this beer has not as much alcohol as some of the other dark beers. But thats OK too. Nice in the cold winter nights.

Extreem rook geur. Spek geur. Aangezien ik geen spek eet is dit een rare geur en bevalt mij dit niet echt.

In de smaak is niet extreem veel terug te vinden van de spekrook.
Ligt bitter. Erg watterig.

Bottle @ CORSO ADB 2013. profumo intenso di affumicatura. Si avverte anche una nota tostata. Colore marrone, limpida, con schiuma beige abbastanza fine, solo qualche bolla grossolana. La persistenza è buona. Il gusto è dolciastro, poca astringenza da acido, amaro dato non dal luppolo ma dal tostato/bruciacchiato. abbastanza corposa, è armonica con una lieve sbavatura sullastringenza che però la rende più bevibile di altre Rauch. buon equilibrio.

Dark reddish brown, Smoked ham, burnt malts, hints of tar. Medium sweetness. This is one of the universally acclaimed beers that I dont seem personally to be able to enjoy quite as much as other people. Smokiness obviously dominates, all other traits are somewhat masked by it.

Pour is dark amber/brown with a thick creamy tan head. Nose is very smoky. Smells a lot like smoked sausage actually. Taste is pretty darn interesting. There is certainly a smokey note to it but again it tastes like it smells...smoke sausage. Its a very interesting and enjoyable beer. Mouthfeel is fairly light considering how dark it is. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear, dark amber color. Frothy and long lasting head. Aroma of smoke with hints of coffee and caramel. Light bitterness, taste like a becon. Average carbonation. Very good smoked beer.
Bottle. Dark color, tan head. Aroma was a sweet smoky smell. Taste is also a sweet, tasty smoky flavor.

Aroma is of fire embers. Great appearance, dark almost opaque with a hint of bronze. Taste is agreeable despite not being a big fan of the smell of smoke in general. There is a pleasant lingering finish which is a mixture of malt, smoke and leather.
Dark amber body, low white head. Strong aroma of smoked bacon, wood and caramel. Smoky bacon taste, very similar to the aroma.

Ampolla.
Aparença: cervesa de color fosc, ataronjat i alhora neta. De bombolla petita, a més, està acompanyada per una escuma poc pressent, que baixa amb rapidesa.
Aroma: fum i fusta, tocs dembotits fumats.
Sabor: En boca no destaca per tenir un cos important, no perdura en boca. 
és una molt bona cervesa, fresca, lleugera i aromàtica.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2013 Bottle: deep-ish brown with a lighter hue & a little more clarity than the Urbock. Wispy, off-white head fades quick but clings to the glass at the top just a bit. Aroma is fantastic as always; pure smoked malt, charred wood, light charcoal, campfire, with the lovely "meat" aromas of smoky sausage & bacon. Somewhat straightforward but still lovely. Taste is a little lighter than the Urbock, but similar. Smoked malt, light char, mesquite wood chips, more smoked meat, and some back-end sweetness (think liquid smoke). Light hint of toffee malt under the smoke. Thinner mouth feel than the Urbock. I prefer the Urbock & the doppelbock by a little bit, but this is still a damn good beer.

clear dark, slightly reddish brown with a fine head. strong roasty smoke aroma. some dark bread. balanced taste with dominant roast and smoke notes. like drinking bacon. interesting, but definitely not my type of beer.

Dark amber body. Strong smoky aroma. The aroma is very similar to the taste. If you are in the mood for a great rauchbier this is a must try. I have had quite a few rauchbiers from various microbreweries, but this one is probably my favorite.

Like drinking smog, I tried and to each person resembles it favourite smoked food (salmon, turkey...)
Quite unique, and the lasting of the flavour and specially the aroma in the nose (you will feel how it climbs from your mout to your nose) its incredibly long (from 5 to 15 minutes) A great beer for lazy days.

50cl bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring. Dark chestnut with a billowing cream head; smokey aroma; smokey bacon taste,; some smokey warmth to finish. Just about everything that can be said about this beer has already been said. But has anybody mentioned that its smokey?
Smoked bacon as a drink - interesting - tried for a different experience and it sure delivered! Quirky... A bit too much so for me but fun none the less.

Bottle from Central City Liquor Store in Surrey. A very dark chocolate brown with moderate head. Smoke on the nose. Smoke and malts on the tongue. Smoke predominates, and that in a good way. A great rauchbier!

Bottle from Whole Foods. Pours brown with red around the edges, a medium sized tan head. The aroma is mostly dark malts, a little roast, and a bit of smoke.. not as pungent as expected but pleasant. The taste has a big woody, hickory type taste, some light roastiness, some residual smoke. Solid brew.
Dark amber body, low white head. Strong aroma of smoked bacon, wood and caramel. Smoky bacon taste, very similar to the aroma.

Bottle-Aroma lots of smoke. Pours a brown/red with a tan head and good lacing. Creamy smooth character that leads into smoke and a touch of sweetness and caramel. Complex when you get adapted to the smoke. Darn good.

From bottle to a weizen glass. Clear dark brown with white head moderate lacing and nice collar. Aroma of smokey bacon with notes of chocolate. Taste of smoke, bacon and tannic grains, with touches of wood. Pronounced saltyness on the lips as i drink this. Dry finish. Interesting to drink by itself. Curious about how it would interact with a meaty meal. Not sure if the saltyness adds to the beer or detracts from the smokey character.

Bottle
Aroma-smoke, wood, malt
Appearance-brown, colour, tan foam, clear, 
Taste- smoked bacon, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter, finish
Overall- fantastic
Pours a dark amber color with off white head. Smoked malt, caramel and wood aroma. Reminds me of smoked meats. Smoked malt, caramel and wood flavors with a thin body. Smokey malt finish.
Bottle from Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. I think. Kempkes is a butchers on Abbeydale Road in Sheffield. His is the best smoked bacon you could buy. This beer tastes like Kempke smoked bacon.

0.5l bottle. Dark amber/brown body, light brown head. Smells like a nice smoked ham and ashes. Taste is also like smoked ham, but it has some bread and a floral hop character. Very nice rauchbier from the smokier ones.
December 2009. 500 ml. bottle. Liquid bacon! Dark amber color with a tan head. Aromas of caramel, malt, smoke, and bacon. Good stuff made by the experts.
500 ml bottle.Dark (almost black) color,high head yet short duration.Aroma of bbq,roasted malts and caramel.taste is similar.
Deep brown pour, cream head. Wood, smoke, bbq, caramel, more smoke. Great palate, smoke, bbq, caramel, sweet, delicious.
Donkerbruine kleur en een mooie plakkerige kraag. Ruikt naar rook, as , gerookte ham. Smaakt idem en vrij bitter. Rokerige nasmaak. Wat weinig body helaas. Goed te drinken.
Black coloring, dark head. Aroma of gammon, gammon and gammon. Take a good german black bread and you got yourself a perfect supper! Taste is the same, with hints of malt, coffee and chocolate.

Very dark brown/ruby body. Its almost crystal clear against sunlight and its medium carbonation is well visible. Has light brown medium creamy head, which stays long. Aroma is mostly smoky. Smoked wood and smoked bacon/pork meat is dominant. In taste it feels like normal light beer at start with small bitterness, but immediately smoky taste comes to the front and stays to the finish. It finishes also a little bit sweet. Very, very tasty and drinkable beer.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2015 Dark color (almost black) and high head with short duration.
Strong aroma of smoked meat, wood and grape.
Despite this strong aroma, the taste is smooth, with notes of toasted malt and BBQ sauce.
Different beer but I liked it.

Bottle to glass. Dark hazel pour with a thin bubbly off white head. Nose is smoked malt with some caramel notes. taste is smoke, malt, some sweet notes sneaking around in the background. Smoked malt dominates. Smooth yet somewhat thin mouth feel.

Bottle 0,50L. Clear, chestnuts brown colour with visible live carbonation and average big, light brown, creamy head. Aroma of mild smoke, smoked bacon, smoked pork meat. There is smoke in taste and aftertaste, but its very mild and nicely balanced, not overhelming. Taste is light bitter at the start, then goes to moderate bitter and finish somehow light sweet. Hard to describe it by words, you have to try it. I wish I have some grilled pork meat or smoked bacon with this beer... Maybe next time.
Aroma di malto tostato davvero eccezionale abbinamento perfetto con qualsiasi piatto che sia affumicato e non solo questa birra è ottima anche da sola davvero unica

Dark brown with a decent size head that creates some lacing. Nice Smoked malt aroma. Not much carbonation in this one which makes a smoother feel on the palate. The smoked malt shines through to the end. Ive waited a long time for this beer to arrive in Texas.

From bottle. Color: Dark brown, coca cola-coloured. Smells strongly of smoked mutton, fenalår. Smoke aromas dominate, on top of what would probably otherwise be a quite nice dark ale in its own right. Very satisfying, very different.

A smoked Marzen beer is always an interesting choice, I had to try this one. This pours a medium brown color with a thin head. The aroma has that classic smoked grain smell which always reminds me of bacon. The texture is smooth due to low carbonation. Very unusual flavor not quite sure what to make of this one other than interesting.

Poured out a dark, smoky, maroon color- brown/grey colored head. Super smokey taste up front.. Slightly hollow body; not as much malt as preferred. Bacon, woody taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not a huge fan of smokey beers but this is acceptable. It is prominent and doesn't linger so it remains subtle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear dark brown with a thin creamy layer of off white foam and great legs. Aroma is smoke, wood, toast, and some bacon like notes. Taste is smoke, wood, nice malty sweetness that helps balance the smoke, toasty, a mild dryness and bitterness on the finish. Very clean beer with a great smoke and malty balance.

Pungent, smokey, almost peaty nose and flavor. Similar to a nut brown ale but the smoke dominates. Not bad but very different.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear Coke-like brown beer with a nice big-bubbled permanent head. The aroma and flavor is heavily smoked with some tar and roasted ham. The palate is medium full and the finish short. Theres a fair amount of carbonation. Its a classic, I expected a bit more but I guess I gotta try the Urbock version.

Dark brown with some red here an there, big foamy head which falls down slowly. Lots of smoke, smoked ham, smoked malts smoked everything. After a while there is some sweet and salty malts popping to my nose. Taste is of course very smoky, but in a good way. Some sweet malt flavors keeps the smokiness in balance. Full bodied and soft carbonation makes this an perfect beer to enjoy slowly. Excellent.

500ml bottle to tulip glass. 

Appearance: Transparent dark ruby red. Head is fine and off white. Retention is OK.

Aroma: Sweet burnt toffee, smoke, burnt wood, slight licorice and raisin. 

Taste: Caramel, chocolate, smoke...sweeter than I expected and it reminds me of root-beer for some reason. 

Palate: Thinner than it presents itself, quite light bodied. CO2 Average. Good flavours throughout.

Overall: A very enjoyable and agreeable beer.

Dark, clear, ruby-red beer and it has a slightly brown layer of foam. A lot of smokey aroma, and therefor nothing else to find in it... Slightly bitter, smokey taste which returns into the somewhat bitter aftertaste.

Donker robijnrood, helder bier een een lichtbruine stevige kraag. Volledig rokerig aroma waardoor er verder niet veel te vinden valt. Bittere rokerige smaak die overgaat in een lichtbittere nasmaak. Je moet er van houden....

A smooth taste, and fantastic aroma. Next to no aftertaste. A very pleasant beer which I would definitely have again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,5L bottle. Mid-size white head. Dark golden-brown color. Very strong aroma of smoked bacon and some very poor notes of caramel. Taste is very... specific. Strong smoked malt, some bitterness. Ive expected something more interesting and richer. First time bought it, and I think the last.

Bottle. Pours lovely clear dark amber with a medium off-white head. Aroma is soft smoked, bacon and some malts. Taste is slightly sweet, "drop", soft smoked and bacon. Soft bitter finish with a lingering smoke and bacon taste. Medium body and carbo. Quite a smooth texture. A quite nicely balanced smoke beer.

On tap at Beer Revolution.12oz at 5.1%. Pours a coppery brown in colour with a minimal tan head that fades quickly. Distinct smoky aroma (smoked bacon, ham roast) from this pour. Like Im getting the meat sweats from this beer. Very unique body, mild alcohol warmth, predominant smokiness on the palate tempered with a true, malt forward Marzen with sweet toffee notes. A gem.

Pours ruby-brown into dark brown with a decent tan white head that lasts at about a finger width. Striking aroma of smokehouse bacon and a touch of malt. Very smooth drinking with sweet malt and more mild smoky bacon flavor. The initial aroma was so surprising I was concerned that I'd be drinking breakfast - but I actually quite enjoy this unique beer. Like nothing I've had before. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from 500mL bottle. Clear mahogany brown with nice beige head. Very smokey wood aroma with some bacon. Very malty with slightly smokey flavour, smooth medium body.
Cerveza con olores ahumados, sabor intenso en boca, muy rica pero para tomar sólo una
Mörkbrun! Doft och smak av rökt kött. För rökig för min smak! UNDVIK! : )
Big smokey nose. Smoked sausage flavor, charcoal, peppery finish. Fun bbq-in-a-brew experience.

Delicious smokey aroma. Smokey, slightly sweet taste. Pours with a slight off white head. Very nice and the smokiness is not overpowering at all. Smokey aftertaste that reminds me of a house fire I once witnessed (in a good way). Great beer.

Niesamowity wędzony, mocny aromat. To samo jeśli chodzi o smak. Wprost genialna wędzonka. Bardzo pijalne. Trudno więcej sie nad tym piwem rozwodzić ponieważ zarówno w smaku jak i w aromacie mamy tu jedno wielkie wędzenie. Jest to piwo na pewno niepowtarzalne a jego smak na długo pozostaje w pamięci. POLECAM!

Dark brown pour. Small head with tiny bubbles. Smells like raw bacon and some dark malts. Tastes like bacon and dark malts, but not the best kind of bacon, though - more like the artificial bits than the real thing. Average all-around. Some others seem to be noticing things that I am not noticing, but I just found this to be a decent smoked brew - nothing more or less.

1pt 9 fl oz served in an allagash glass.

A - Dark brown with amber highlights, 2 fingers of sturdy off-white head, the head is moundy and clings to the edges of the galss.

S - Very smokey aroma, some lye soap aroma, burnt grass, smoked Canadian bacon, bbq wood smoke, smells like sweet black pepper bbq sauce.

T - Smoked bamboo stalks, smoldered grass, some sugary fruit in the background, grassy hops invade the smoke toward the finish. Some burnt caramel lies underneath the smoke. Savory smoked meats come to mind. Finishes quick with a swift but dry smokey note.

M - Lush carbonation and feel, medium to light body, dry smokey finish.

Very focused on the smoke obviously but lets the other flavors play out. The aroma is much stronger in smoke than the flavor. The aroma has more of a bbq smell, while the taste has more of a smoked grass flavor. Awesome if you like smoked beers.

Serving type: bottle

04-12-2013

500 ml. bottle, red - amber colour, with a small off white head with not much retention and a small ring of lace. Smell of smoked salmon domintaing it all in the beginning, with some notes of malts, caramel and toffee later. Light creamy body, taste of smoked salmon, but malts are more noticeable here: toffee, caramel. It will be great of course with a smoked salmon of some other smoked fish, but great too with sausages. Not for everyones palate (maybe even for mine), but a good beer indeed.

From 500 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with red highlights and a small cream coloured head. Smells strongly of smoked ham with some apple and figs. The taste is quite similar with a smoky initial taste before some lighter fruit comes through toward the end. Smoke again in the finish. Something of an acquired taste, but not my personal favourite.

Bottle at home. Dark amber colour, dark golden head. Aroma is bacon, smoke, meat. Taste is meaty too, but some sweetness, bit of caramel. Malty. Much more subtle than smell. Still some smoke but in the background.

This smoked beer is the real deal...not that others Ive had before were not great brews. Pours a burnished dark brown with a soapy foamy tan head. The nose a solid whiff of smoke, ash and earthen roasted malts. Sweet toffee and toasted malts mid palate with a earthy smoke through the finish. Lingering burnt and smoky notes are mild and accompany a mild malty bitterness (no hops noticed at all). Although a rather smoky beer the flavour is mild and moderate with a easy drinkability!

Appearance: dark brown, bright
Aroma: wood fire smoke, smoked meat, bacon, caramel
Flavour: malt-bitterness
Finish: short, smoke, lingering malt bitterness
Maltiness: medium
Hoppiness : low+, 
Body: medium-light
Mouthfeel & Texture: crisp, creamy

Smoke smoke smoke, good for some, but if you dont want a smoked beer dont try this! Pours a dark but still translucent brown without much of a head. Smoke dominates the aroma. Smoke continues on into the flavor, meshing nicely with sweetness from the malt. Little alcohol profile. Disappointed by the light mouthfeel, but the aftertaste is a pleasant lingering smokiness, like smelling campfire the next morning.
Bottle at bar. Dark brown color, white head. Bitter taste with smoke, caramel, nuts, bread and malts. Bittersweet taste with caramel and smoke. Very nice rauchbier.
Pours a brown colour with ruby red notes in it. Aroma is bacon. Taste is bacon.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2014 23 Jan 2014. BOTTLE 50CL.
Aroma: Smoked sausages, prunes, caramel. Taste: smoky, light sweetness, light sour notes, umami/salty. Finishes with light bitterness, burnt wood/ashes.
17 June 2013. BOTTLE. 

Head: light beige, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: deep red-brown, clear.

Aroma: strong smoke, smoked prunes.

Taste: smoky, caramel, slightly some bitterness and a lightly sourish note.
I you love smoked beers, you gotta try this on. This is the original German rauchbier; intense and powerful.
Bottle - Smoke, oak, roasted malts and some dark fruit. Clear mahogany with a thin brown head. Much lighter than I expected, pleasant sweet smoke (BBQ like) and raisin. Very refreshing and nice.
50cl bottle. Pours dark amber with a fast diminishing head. Aroma is all about smoke. Flavor is bacon and smoked. Interesting beer but really not my type...
home from Bamberg by my parents in law. Clear brown body with a medium white head. Aroma is smoke, fireplace, sawdust, caramel, malt

Dark brown color, fluffy medium head diminishing quite fast. Very intensive aroma with lots of smoked malts (similiar to the smoked meat). First sip is full of smokiness, thereafter appears dark malts with minimal fruity (plum) elements. Very low bitterness, however its quite drinkable. Nice smoky finish. Fantastic rauchbier.

Ambrée foncée, fine pétillance, mousse beige clair persistante. Très fumée/grillée, amertume houblonnée assez présente, un peu sucrée. La première bière fumée dont le malt sert de base à plusieurs autres bières du même genre, dont La Fumette de la Brasserie Millevertus.

Poured from a 16.9 oz. bottle into a tulip.

Out of the bottle this has a dark raisin brown base color with a dark copper edge. A fluffy white head rises an inch or so up, leaving some lace down the sides of the glass as it fades.

The smokiness is very apparent in the nose. It is different than American beers that simply use smoked malts. This has a cured nature to it, almost like a spicy cured meat. At first it smells like there is something wrong with it, but the smell is beginning to grow on me. There are some light sweet malt notes underneath the smoke.

There is a moment where the flavor on the tongue is more malt than smoke, but that flavor does not last long. There is a soft bready sweetness with a gentle suggestion of dark fruits. Throughout the rest of the sip, however, the smoke really dominates, washing over the malt and controlling the flavor. It reminds me of a well-smoked meat.

The body of this beer is rather light, as it does only have a 5.4% ABV. The carbonation is appropriately smooth while still slightly crisp. There is not much in the way of residual stickiness or flavor.

This is one of my first forays into rauchbiers, and I have to say I enjoyed it. I would not drink this all of the time, but I appreciate just how different it is compared to some traditional styles.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2013 Very different. Taste and smell is obviously present and I love that about it. I guess only bad thing is every time i drink it I start craving to eat things like pepperoni sticks and cold cut hams.
0.5 l bottle from brewpub, Bamberg... Nice dark color, good head... Intensive smokey malt and bacon aroma... Interesting sweet-smokey dark beer taste... Average ending...

Pours clear and dark copper with a good head of tan foam that fell slowly to a nice layer on top and persistent lace. This is my first taste of the style and I am very surprised that nose smells just like meat! Ham or bacon. Smoky, salty, charred. Its not what I expected in the beer glass. Theres a faint underlying malt sweetness and some hop floral. Taste is a blend of smoke and full malt. Its so darn smooth for what is on the nose. The malt is deep and rich and balances the smoke and char. Little toffee, little bread and finishes with a small hop bitter and almost dry. The smoke flavor fades pretty quickly from the aftertaste and the smoke quality adds to the slight dry finish. 

I am glad that for my first try I got one of the best examples of the style. I cant say that I would have it again and I cant even finish the bottle. Its strong but not harsh.
Bottle. Pours black color with beige head. Aroma of smoked meat, bacon, some sweet hints. Taste is smoked bacon, malty and caramel. Nice bitter finish.

Bottle brought home from Bamberg by my parents in law. Clear brown body with a medium white head. Aroma is smoke, fireplace, sawdust, caramel, malt. Flavor is caramel, smoke, malt, wood. Round and smooth. Indeed, they brew delicious beers.

Bottle at beertasting with Carsten Bertelsen 19 / 6 2013. Aroma, lots of smokey notes, oaky, some roasted malts. Taste, again lots of smoke, oak, roasted malts. Leaves smoky, weak bitter malty aftertaste.
(bottle 19/06-2013) low beige head, clear dark brown color, bacon smoked aroma, medium co2, light sweet smoked taste. BB date 05/2013.

Bottiglia 50cl.
Marroncina, schiuma chiara che svanisce subito.
Affumicata già al naso, in bocca risulta poco carbonata, amara e affumicata.
Da provare...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iFonz
Dark beer that appears almost black. Against the light you see a dark red glow. Smell is metallic. Taste is malty smoke but also refreshing.
Like drinking bacon. Goes great with or without the customary pig dinner. Dark beer and delicious.
Bottle at Craven Arms, dark brown pour with beige head, smokey bacon crisp aroma, smoked ham taste like your finest charcuterie, very pleasant.

50 cl bottle. Very smoky aroma with some wood notes. Flavor is nicely smokey and long.The carbonation is balanced well. It is also malty. Bitterness shows after smoke is gone Feel in the mouth is nice and smooth. Excellent brew.
Odeur noisette.  Goût Fumé, noisette, bacon, vraiment unique.  Arrière goût très doux.  Sucre timide, peu dAmertume, bonne bière de relaxation après le repas.
Draft. Classical rauchbier from Bamberg. Smoked bacon in aroma and taste, very rich smoked malt, uncompromising smoked!

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Rerating 2013 review, 500ml bottle at Sternbräu Rankweil. Aroma is bacons, caramel, roasted meat, nuts. Appearance is ver dark black with a niche brown-ish head. Tase is light sweet and some bitterness. A little bit sour. Has a slightly watery mouthfeel and not much texture. Soft carbonation. An overall very good Smoked Beer.

Pours a dark amber with a huge, tan head.  Aromas of charcoal, sausage, and a bit bready.  The smoked malts are the flavor, leaving behind a long, charcoal and BBQ sauce finish.  Medium bodied beer with a sticky mouthfeel.  This beer is highly recommended for a beautiful autumn day by the grill.
Special product With Special Taste. Focus is only in the smoke Taste, which is actually Very OK. One bottle shared with friend is enough.

Poured deep red-brown with good sized light tan creamy head. Aroma of balanced smoked meat and smoked cream cheese. Flavours of mild smoked sausage, well balanced. Very smooth and creamy on palate, very long finish, moderate body. Went well with knackwurst and kraut.
Dark amber with light tan head. Aroma is standing close downwind of a bbq smoker. Taste is smokey, sweet malty and woody. Damn I want sme scottys baked beans.
Metallic aroma. Barely any smoke it the nose. Sweet honey and smoke flavour. Some tingling at the back of the tongue.
Intense smoke aroma. Low carbonation leading to smooth mouthfeel. Great smoky taste with lingering smoke finish.

Una de las mejores cervezas que he probado, además de todo un referente dentro del estilo de las ahumadas. Fuerte olor y sabor a las maltas "quemadas", entra genial y no satura, para mi gusto. Todo un cervezote. No entiendo como tienen una nota media tan baja, debería rondar el 4.

Draft at Gingerman. Wow. Pours a lovely dark amber with a thick off-white head. The aroma is really something; huge, huge notes of BBQ, mesquite, smoke, bacon/ham and lots of wood. Taste is woody, smokey, malty and light caramel. Even though the smoke profile is stong in the aroma it is perfectly balanced in the taste and not strong on the palate at all. I was really suprised at how much I enjoyed this.  Delightful beer.

Pours reddish brown with a little white head. Very strong, smoky aroma with smoked ham and malts. Taste is sweetish at first with strong, smoked malts dominating - rich but bit one-dimensional flavours. Palate is smooth, medium bodied and nearly flat. Nice speciality that could be stronger and fuller bodied.

375 ml bottle.  Pours a dark amber color with a small foamy head that fades quickly and leaves nice lacing.  Smells like a smoldering campfire and I really like it.  Taste is basically the same as the aroma, a nice slightly charred wood / smokey bacon taste.  This would be a great camping or bonfire beer.  Medium body.  Finish is slightly watery but not too bad.  A very enjoyable smoked beer.

Pours the color of black coffe with a thick, pillowy off white head. Smeels of wood embers, roasted malt, smoke and cured meat. Medium bodied palate is full of flavor and perfectly balanced. Flavors of charcuterie and more leather and smoke aromas lead to a surprizingly clean finish. Despite the heavy sounding flavors, this beer is low in abv and very easy drinking. Outstanding.
Helt såld bara på dess lukt. Bör egentligen smaka den igen för att kanske komma ner på jorden.

The first time I tried this beer was in its very original Bamberg. The city was in the midst of some local festival, with music, flowers, colours, sizzling sausages, polka dances, buxom girls carrying trays with an unbelievable amount beer "steins", smiley faces, red noses, and plenty of laughter. Had I not known I was in Germany, I could have sworn we had been dropped in Middle Earths Erebor. We made our way through the sea of Lederhosen without even cringing, until we finally found the brewery. And this is when I was born again. 
The beer was reddish brown, with a lovely sand-coloured head, very much as the bottled version that I took home and now, as I appreciate a new bottle. The aroma is a killer. The most heavenly smoked bacon, more specifically grün Speck. I love the spices and herbs that come with it, perhaps carraway, peppercorns and marjoram, not too pungent, always well hidden by the smoked pork. Yes, a full Franconian kitchen. In addition to the malts, that are sweet as love, the flavour is loaded with peat, smoke and wood again, and I cannot tell what type of lumber it is, but I can guarantee that it is one of the most formidable beer experiences. You should find some indications of fruits left in the cellar, the spices and that glorious smoked pork belly and all the salt that comes with it, bringing the beer to a notch up (or more) above the so many others. The hops are lost in this glorious dream of medieval carnivals and foolishness, but they come out in the bitter finish. This is an earthy, but smooth beer, perfectly balanced. I can perfectly sympathise with a moment of reckoning as one drinks it for the first time. 
The worst thing about it is that it makes the others look really really bad...

Bien rouge à la lumière, elle possède un petit col de mousse ; odorante, elle dégage sans surprise de fortes effluves de fumé, de bois calciné et de sucre. En bouche, tout est en subtilité, le fumé vient complimenter le sucré dorge et le malté sans le dominer. Cest une sublime bière fumée, un modèle du genre, bien balancée mais sans timidité.

500 ml bottle into pint glass, no bottle dating.  Pours fairly clear medium reddish brown color with a dense 2 finger cream colored head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Dense spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with some moderate streaming carbonation.  Aromas of huge smoked wood, caramel, brown sugar, toast, bacon, ham, light roasted malt, brown bread, and smoked earthiness.  Fantastic aromas with very prominent smoke character; with great balance and  complexity of malt and smoke notes.  Taste of smoked wood, caramel, brown sugar, toast, ham, brown bread, bacon, floral, light roasted malt, light clove, and smoked earthiness.  Lingering notes of smoked wood, ham, caramel, brown sugar, toast, light roasted malt, brown bread, and smoke earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance and complexity of malt and smoked flavors; with nice robustness and no cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a fairly creamy and smooth mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.
