Overall this is a highly excellent Rauchbier style!  Great balance and complexity of smoke and malt flavors; and very smooth to drink.  A highly enjoyable offering.

Cerveja antológica, extrema, costumo chamá-la de "meu suquinho de bacon". Defumação muito intensa, difícil de ser consumida em grandes quantidades, mas que representa uma experiência única de cerveja, e que definitivamente se completa em harmonizações com carnes e queijos também defumados. Não se pode morrer sem conhecê-la !
Classic example of a BALANCED beer. Not the hit-em-over-the-head American smoke beers that I have tasted. Just right. The Germans know what they are doing. American brewers take note. Less is more.

Deep brownish-orange in color with off-white head.  Deep, meaty, salty smoke with faint ash, cheese, and fruity malt.  Gentle, yet assertive.  Flavor is more of the salty, semi-ashy smoke with background Munich-type malt fruitiness.  Definitely smoke forward with base to the background.  Yet, all flavors well blended and not overbearing.  Medium creamy palate.

Pour brown with an amber hue. The "grey" head leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is smoky of course, only smoky in fact. Taste is quite dry with a low level of bitterness. Flavors are once again smoke, brown malts with a little grain. Mouthfeel is a little watery. Not bad, not great. Pretty average really but well made.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a dark cola color with a thick tan cap. Smell is smokey, bacon, peat, roast and malt. Smell is fairly thick. Taste starts with roast, caramel. The smoke is more in the middle and is not as harsh as the aroma. The body is light/medium and the beer is slippery with mild carbonation which is finely constructed. I was happily surprised as to the complex flavor and easy drinking nature of this beer.

Bottle. Dark brown beer with a small beige head. The aroma is wonderful, smokey wood. The taste is smoked kippers, wood and roasted malts. A sensation of burnt charcoal lingers on the lips and tongue. An excellent beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: This beer pours a deep maroon, with a small off white head. The aroma is huge!! Huge notes of smoked sausage, smoked ham, bacon, charcoal, and roasted corn. Tasting notes include toffee, licorice and other medium malts, as well as barbecued sausage. This is a very unique beer, and I love it! This would go spectacular along with some summer bbq!
Botella de 50 cl. Color marrón oscuro, casi negro. Abundante espuma, duradera. Olor a ahumado por todos los sitios y en boca, más de lo mismo, ahumados...con un cuerpo excelente y un sabor único.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours dark copper with a lasting foamy head and a really great smokey scent. First sip is weird for a bit, metallic in taste. After aired in the wild for a while its definetly abit better. All tho i like rauchbier this on is not as its best at the moment. The smokiness of this one is legendary tho havent tasted another one with as great smoke flavoer as this one. This one i shall re-rate.

Intrigued by the particular type, I decided to try this beer, colour is amber red with good persistent creamy head, aroma is of smoked salmon, in mouth is light and drinkable in body, not very teasty, but the aftertaste are only smoked and persistent...
Personal comment; For this beer one 50cl is exaggerated.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours beatiful deep ruby red with a large dense off-white head. Aroma is smokey wood, meat, some minerals. Taste is ight smoke, roasted malt and very easy drinkable, a light lingering smokiness.

Original rating April 26 2013
Bottle from Systembolaget. Dark brown witha a dirty white head. Smoke. Malt, wood, meat. Taste is light/medium bitter with a sticky mouthfeel, end is smokey and some bitterness. 
8-4-6-3-14=35
Balanced. Nose is not too smokey as is the flavour. Just the right amount of smoke but keeping it easy to drink.
(Bottle) Smoked malt, an open fire with spicy sausage and smoked ham. Does that sound nice? Then you will love this beer!

500ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. Clear brown-golden colour with a reddish tinge, thin biege head leaving some lacing and aroma of smokey wood, smoked meats & malt. Taste is smoked roast malt caramel & grain, bacon, nutty notes. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, fairly well balanced with a light bitterness through to the finish. Quite drinkable.
Очень специфи& Копчено& жуткая. Никогда больше не куплю.///-//-( via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Delivered straight from Switzerland, thanks Nate! Pours a dark reddish brown with not much head. Aroma is overpowering and smells of smoke... mostly smoked meats. Salami, burnt sausage and hickory char. Taste again is very smoke-forward. Very roasty malts, no hop character, and the smoke overpowers. Medium bodied, but the smoke stays with the palatte long after a sip has been consumed. Glass also needed to be thoroghly washed after the beer was gone as the smoke will dominate the next beer poured in. Too smokey for me...

Bottle (500 ml). Clear dark reddish brown with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma is of smokey-everything... smokey wood, smokey malt, smokey, smokey meat and... smoke, but not overwhelming though. Taste is also of smokey malt, bacon, wood. Medium body. Finish is a tad watery. Good balance... for this kind of beer. Its quite drinkable for  a beer that is that smokey. Not in the same league as Fastenbier though.
Bottle. Pours a reddish brown with a moderate head that lasts. Aroma is smoke, cured meats, grain, caramel and hard cheese. Palette is soft bitter with a moderate sweetness. No carbonation.

Smells of smoked salmon and salami with a hint of sweetness. Pours reddish brown and sparkling. Reveals a light taste of smoke (maybe umami too?) and a palette of delicious spices. Yummy! It pleasantly coates the tongue and leaves behind the spicy taste for a long time. I really like this beer!

(Plastic) gravity cask In De Wildeman. Clear brown color. Dense off white head. Aromas of smoked cheese, strong smoke, caramel, soft. Flavor us caramellish, light sweet. Body is fairly full for this strength. Medium bitter finish. Nice!

Even better than before. :-)

Tasted in October 2011.
Aroma: Wood and smoke.
Appearance: Black, average thickness and lasting for head but very dense and creamy.
Smoke taste is very strong as attack, with notes of acidity and grain bitterness. Smoke notes are lasting almost forever. Finish has notes of chocolate. An honest smoke beer, a bit acid, with no sugar flavor and a smoke bitterness.

0,5L bottle. Strong smoky aroma. Taste is to difficult for me. At the beginning is smoke taste principal. After that is little sour caramel and quite hard on mouth. Finish is soft smoky and watery. Hard to drink for me.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2013 Draught at Bamberg, Germany. Poured a dark brown with a red tint with a one-finger light beige coloured foamy head that diminished quickly but laced well. No carbonation. Aroma dominated by smoked bacon. Taste very smokey like smoke from a fire then followed by a smoked bacon flavour. Light to medium body. Long smoked bacon finish. Very different.
On tap in the bar. Dark and mysterious, aroma of the smoked malt, but so wonderfully smooth and slips down so easily. Sweet toffee/caramel malt.

De color rojizo oscuro, y con una espuma biege clara y persistente, lo mejor sin duda es su aroma, intensamente especiado y ahumado. En boca es más suave, los matices ahumados son más sutiles, aunque al final se acentúan un poco más. En cuanto al cuerpo, es una cerveza muy ligera, agradable y fácil de beber. La recomendaría, sobre todo, acompañada de aperitivos salados, comidas asadas etc.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 Un liquide brun assez transparent , un petit col sans dentelle. Au nez ,le fumé,style smoke meat,saumon fumé,la boucane de bois ,que ça sent bon!!!!!!!! gout,très près de ses flaveurs et un sensation fumée qui signe et persiste en bouche,moi jadore ça !Pour moi,cest la quintessence des bière fumé.Vive les Rauchbiers !

Aroma: dark and somked malts.
Appearance: Amber orange with rigid foam.
Taste: dominate smoked flavours, well balanced.
Palate: carbonation is quite soft.
Overall: Classic smoked beer with traditions. Everyone should try it, even only once.
coffee-dark brown colour, medium beige head; aroma and taste of smoked ham/cheese with some malty sweetness and bitter/sourish aftertaste; excellent marzen

500ml bottle - Lovely deep mahogany body, thin white head, good clarity. Aroma is bonfire, rich smokiness that captures the nostrils, sadly this doesnt carry through to the taste. It comes across very weak and watery, not very robust, and not much going on afterwards.

Appearance: Brown with red tint and white head.
Aroma: Sweet smoke, hickory and soy sauce.
Flavor: predominately smoky with some maltiness.
Overall: An excellent rachbier

Dec 2012 - cold bottle.  Nice smokey flavour like the others, but a bit watery towards the end.  No bitterness, just sweet smokiness to start and then a slightly disappointing finish.  Still nice though.

Appearance: Nice amber color with a off white head that leaves a  fine curtain lacing.Aroma: Rich smoked.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: First of all there is a lot of smoked flavor. When I search a bit I also find a solid malty background. Some hopps and light fruity.Overall impression: My second attempt on this one. First rating was so bad that I got a angry mail from our kind Norwegian moderator. Maybee I have grown up? Not that bad, but still nothing I will be rushing out to buy some more off.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway.
Pours dark brown, nice cream head disappear fast, strong smoked at nose, but very disappointing in mouth, uninteresting after 100ml...

Pours dark amber with half finger cream head- dissipates quickly.
High carbonation, compared to other Heller beers, taste is flimsy with sweetness. Aroma of smoke with sweet background. No complexity.

Pours a very dark brown with some head but hangs around for a while. The aroma is very strong smoked that overpowers much of anything else. The taste is also extremely smoked and almoat feels like bacon, but still somewhat drinkable. This is probably the strongest and most typical smoked beer in Europe. Drinkable, but
Scura, affumicata da legni di faggio. Carbonazione discreta , sapore intenso di scamorza affumicata, poca schiuma e non persistente. Troppo affumicata alla lunga stufa, non la mia preferita.

Det här är kul i teorin men inte lika skojigt i praktiken. Röksmaken är mer bränt bildäck än alspån, lavendel eller ek eller vad som nu eftersträvas. Resten är inte heller mycket att hetsa upp sig över. En bra idé som uppenbarligen gått upp i rök nånstans på vägen till smaklökarna.

Very appealing bottle pours a nice creamy head protecting a dark ruby Märzen. Not hazy at all. Huge smoky aroma, reminds of any kind of smoky meat. Medium body, quite sweet, long finish. Overall a very interesting beer and if you enjoy the style, youll love this.

Beautiful deep amber, brown with a nice off white head. Aroma: Smoked ham, campfire, sweet breadyness, slightly spicy. Taste: sweet with a light bitterness. Notes of smoked meat, bread, campfire, caramel. A very nice brew!

Dark amber with rich, stable head.
 The aroma is pure smoke goodness, nothing more nothing less. The palate shows incredible balance. Yes, the smoke is huge, but so are the chewy, earthy malts. The wood finishes the beer, lending it impeccable balance and drinkability.  Perfect looks, great aroma, great flavour, perfect balance.  Intensity of the smoke, coupled with the spiciness of the hops, leave the palate numb.  Finishes brilliantly. So polished and elegant, but magically rustic, as well. Hail to the wonders of double-decoction mashing. 
Already Missing!

Nice smoked aroma, pours deep brown reddish. From this brewer its not best for me cause of too carbonation and not so many about flavour tones. Malty, toasted, min sweet. Dry finish.  Casual brew, nothing special.

Aroma: smoke, roast, pine, woody; Appearance: clear reddisch black, quite big and strong off-white head; Taste: medium bitter, lightly sweet, maybe something like umami?; Palate: medium body, thin/creamy feel, average carbonation, long "smoky", bittersweet finish; Overall: very good smoked beer, recommended

Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier has a very thick, soapy, beige head, a clear, quite bubbly, ruby red or red-brown appearance, depending on how the light hits it, and fairly good amount of lacing sheen left on the glass. The aroma is very much of wood smoke, with possibly some sweet brown bread showing as well. Taste is of smoke, with a bit of sweet bread in the background. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier finishes crisp, somewhat refreshing, and smokey. Whether one enjoys smokey food and drink will determine how much they like this. I believe everyone should at least try it, though. RJT

500ml bottle at Porterhouse Cork. I have heard very divided opinions about this so was eager to try it.  
Pours a deep copper-brown, with a thin shortlasting white head. Beautifully powerful aroma full of strong smokey oak, fresh pine, smokey bacon, with a decent dollop of treacle. Medium sweetness and bitterness, with light sour and salty overtones. Loses a couple of marks for a bit of a limp mouthfeel, but a nice smoky and sweet aftertaste makes up for it. There is so much going on here that its hard to get your head around it all, but for me its really interesting and a great beer.

Pours a deep brown with nice head leaving a lacing. Aroma of smoke, burnt wood, bacon, ham, cheese. A bit of chocolate. Taste is more of the same, neither sweet nor bitter, a little salty. Medium body, solid carbonation. Very good
Tastes like a smoked sausage. Is there anything more to say about this beer? Not my favorite beer if I say so.

Brownish red with a tan head and decent lace. Overpowering smoke on the nose like a barbecued ham. Caramel malt sweetness peeks through the smoky flavor. Medium body, silky smooth mouthfeel, moderate carbonation, and a sweetness in the finish. The smoke was too much for me.

Dark caramel colour, lots of smoke aromas and flavours, like drinking firewood, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is full of smoke, very strong, but pleasant.
Taste is largely smokey, bit of roastedness. Little bit of a bite on the finish, but not too much of an aftertaste. Still, nice flavour.
Medium mouthfeel and carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle. Pours a brown-reddish colour with an off-white head (slightly tanned). Light body and soft carbonation. Smoky aroma, taste even seems like meat. No alcohol notes. Really curious, although thats what I was loking for when I bought this. Watery at the end, but not bad.

Dark brown color, small head. Strong aroma of smoked wood and bacon. Dry bitter smoky taste with smooth finish, also a bit sweet, with caramel, malt, bacon, bread and some herbs. Medium body and soft carbonation. Very enjoyable smoked beer.
Really nice taste and aroma, this is a good thing to drink. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]
Dark brown-amber color with off white head. Smoked pork, roasted malts, wood. Nice bitterness and full taste.

Dark reddish brown, off white head, and decent lacing.  Smoke,  roast, wood, and dark berry aroma.  Full bodied, flavor like aroma with Simone floral hop notes.  Smoke dominated, dry bitterness, burnt, and mild hop bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013/01/16 - Pours a dark amber color with a frothy off white head that disappears quickly. Aroma is dominantly smoked pork. Taste is a sweet smoked pork with a slightly bitter finish. Much smoother than expected. Pleasantly surprised.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

draft at cml , shared by 77ships. 
smells smoked , pours orange/brown, no foam, mild carbo, very smoked taste yet its still drinkable..

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2013 Tap @ Schlenkerla, Bamberg 01/02/13. Pours a dark auburnish brown with a huge, beige-colored head. Aroma is - as expected - smoke and smoked ham, some caramel too, but the smoke dominates. Taste is smoke and tar, caramel, smoked ham as well. Or rather smoked side of pork to be exact. Not sweet, very full taste and flavor. Just overpowers and coats the mouth. Stiff and full. Superb from the tap in Bamberg at least. Will have to try the bottle to compare.

I really liked this, but didnt get into it as much as hoped. Guess Im just not  a smoked beer nut. The oddest thing about this was that it tasted minty to me, I hadnt just brushed my teeth so not sure of the reason, just some taste receptor wires crossed while drinking.
500 ml bottle. Aroma heavily smoked, lots of beer sausages, smoke, tar and notes of chocolate. Tastes roasted, but not much else. Thin body

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2017 28/01/2013 Brasserie 4:209 (tap). Bevuta al Deutsche Beer Festival. Color ambrato carico, miele di castagno, con bel cappello di schiuma bianco sporca, abbondante e persistente. Aroma intenso di affumicato (scamorza, bacon), leggero malto. In bocca è affumicata, molto ben equilibrata, note di malto leggero, finale discretamente secco. Corpo medio-basso, leggermente "watery", molto carbonata. Gran bella birra!

Bottle shared with ClubGonzo. Pours a clear deep mahogny colour with a light beige creamy medium head. Delicous smokey aroma towards whiskey along with beech wood, tobacco and sweetly smoked meat. The flavour follows up but with more leather, wood and with a lingering smokey taste in the end. Has a slick and smooth mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. An incredibly balanced aroma and taste with smoke through and through.
Aromen påminner om en rökt ölkorv. Vid smaken försvinner korven och den smakar mest rök.

on draft poured dark reddish brown. had big frothy head it was the end of the keg. big smoky aroma off white lacing on the glass. taste/flavor is smoked roasted malts mild blended very well together not overpowering on the tongue like some others i have had. very good.
Perfecta. Color rojizo oscuro, espuma sin grasa de color tostado. Aromas a las maderas propias de la fermentacion de esta cerveza. Sabor a ahumado.

50cl bottle which poured a very dark brown with amber tinge colour.This one was quite cold when i sampled it but it still had immediate strong smokey malt and ham aromas.I had been putting off drinking this one as i have mixed feelings on this style.That said,the flavours matched the aroma and in a very nice way indeed.Some of these beers taste to me like they have been brewed in used sausage water but this one was just right.Everything in tune and balanced perfectly.Smokey malt and ham with a bit of background alcohol hovering there too.Really nice,enjoyed it and would drink it again given the chance.

This is my favorite smoked beer. While the aroma is liquid smoke, the flavor is a perfectly burnt salty bacon that ends slightly bitter. This beer can be perfectly paired with beef or any heavy meals. I love it with jaegerschnitzel.

Leftover from my advent calendar.  Smells like smoked wood. Pours a dark black. Not bad but well not great either   As interesting as it smells not a lot of the smoke comes through in the flavour does have a bit of a smokey after taste. I dunno my bottle is pretty old maybe that has something to do with the lack of flavour.
In fairness this beer was ten years old. Aroma of cheap cigar ashtray. Poured a murky weak coffee color. Taste of slim Jim and swamp.

Aroma interesante, sabroso y agradable. Notas ahumadas predominantes y ligeros aromas a tocino.

En cuanto a apariencia, color café intenso, algo turbia, destellos rubi a la luz. Cuerpo y carbonatación media. Corona de espuma abundante en principio, dejando posteriormente una capa ligera de mediana retención.

En boca suave, seca, refrescante y agradablemente ahumada.

Al paladar es una cerveza suave y ligera, denotando su estilo de baja fermentación. Así mismo se perciben sabores a malta y tal como se percibía en el aroma, sabrosas notas ahumadas.

En general se trata de una cerveza original y excepcional, suave pero con ese toque de distinción que la hace única!
Strong smoky aroma with a hint of bacon flavor. Much smoother and clear finish than expected, malty aftertaste
Clear dark burnt amber with a thin beige dissipating head. Nice smoky aroma of camp smoke, ham, and toasted English muffin. Nice smoked ham flavor with a bit of biscuit and earthy märzen malt.

Esta cerveza es muy sorprendente. Nada más abrirla sale un increíble olor a queso idiazábal o a bacon ahumado. El ahumado es menos dominante en boca, donde se mezcla de una forma equilibrada y compleja con otro montón de sabores que apenas distingo; disfruto sin comprender.

#3
Wer für "Rauch" im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes etwas übrig hat, erlebt hier seinen Himmel auf Erden! Als Islay-Fan und Havanna-Liebhaber habe ich mit dem Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier meine Erfüllung gefunden. Die deutlichen Rauchtöne harmonieren perfekt mit dem Malz und der Würze des Märzen, superb!
	
Test vom 5.11.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 15,15,15,15,15,15 - 15,00
Bouteille de 500ml, robe ambrée,arôme de fumée , goût très prononcé sur le caramel fumé!

sprigiona un profumo affumicato devastante..a mio parere si avvicina a pesce affumicato come salmone,aringhe con le quali labbinamento dovrebbe essere proprio adatto..gusto altrettanto affumicato con sentori cioccolatosi,legno e finale amaro pronunciato che si blocca in gola a lascia assaporare bene laffumicato..schiuma poco persistente,bianco/beige, dal colore ambrata/scura..sicuramente da provare per apprendere lo stile,anche perchè di affumicate fino ad ora non ne ho assaggiate molte..rimane però uno stile che passa in secondo piano rispetto ad altri..non è una birra da "sbronza" perchè rischia di stuccare un pò..!
Bottle @ la tana del luppolo. It pours dark with a good head on top. Aroma is smoked, flavor and taste too. Smoked malt rules on bitterness and everything else in this beer. Good beer, by the way.

Nez de bacon et de fumé, avec des notes maltées de caramel doux ainsi que des notes de houblon herbeux et de cuir. Rondeur moyenne en bouche. Goût très fumé rappelant des saucisses noircies en poêle lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût fumé de bacon avec des notes dhickory et ensuite un goût plus doux et sucré, malté de caramel toffee très doux et finalement, un goût de fumé revient en bouche avec des notes amères de rôti léger et de houblon. Arrière-goût long, fumé de bacon avec des notes légèrement amères de houblon et des notes de viande (comme du beef jerky).
Bottle 0.5l. Colour is copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours are smoke, bitterness and malts.

Incredible! It smells like a packet of smokey bacon crisps (which is a good thing!) and definitely has that flavour lingering on the palate. Pouring it into a glass, it oozes out the bottle with a deliciously dark colour. Its one of those where you will either love it or hate it. I love it!
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared with McTapps. Pours in amber to brown with a medium head. Nose is smokey - smoked malt maybe. Drinkable if cold but if it becomes a bit warmer it is like every other rauchbier - disgusting.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2014 Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Deep brown-black in colour with steady and creamy head. Smooth texture. Taste of camp fire, smoked steaks, Black Forrest ham and rich malt. My best smoked beer until now but I will probably never like them. This one is very light and fresh.

Draught, 0.40l. Clear dark amber color with medium creamy brownish head and tiny bubbles. Strong aroma of smoked malt and grassy hops. Taste is smoky with decent bitterness in the aftertaste. Full body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Excellent Rauchbier, slightly better than their Weizen...

Világosbarna szín, bézs színü tartós hab. Jóféle házi füstöltsonkát idéző illat. Ízét is az aromás füstösség uralja, amit hosszan elnyúló komló zár. Külön kategória ami valószínüleg megosztja a sörrajongókat is.

.5l bottle @ Alko
Pours copper with low head. Aroma is smoke, roasted malts, ham, sweetish. Syrup?
Flavor is smoke, roasted malts, some ham. Nice beer!
Clear, deep red in colour. Light, wispy head. Wood smoked bacon on the palate. Incredibly tasty.

First some beer Ive tried. Been drinking it for nearly a decade. Nice in the fact that it is first and foremost a smoked beer, and a marzen close behind which suits the smokiness. Gives it a refreshing edge, compared to most of the more stouty smoked beer Ive tried. A light mouthfeel but suitable. Heavy smoke aromas and flavours; hickory wood chips. Small unobtrusive touch of cured deli meat; perhaps salami. Notes of leather. A great accompaniment for Oktoberfest fare and/or heavy deli sandwiches (ie: smoked blue cheese and all-out spicy salami. Or a classic Limburger and fried onion sandwich. Damn. Now theres an idea!)

The aroma is like walking into a restaurant where theyre serving burnt pancakes with maple syrup along side maple smoked bacon. The flavour has some sweet and sour notes, caramel, roasted malts and a ton of smokiness - charcoal, ash, tobacco, smoked meats. I find this very off putting. I dont think smoked ales are my thing.

Pours a clear dark brown with red hue & very little head and a small off white ring. Huge aroma of campfire smoke, burnt wood, bacon and smoked salmon. Taste is smoked salmon, some sweet caramel, a nice steady bitterness throughout and almost a bit of a sour salt on the palate. Ive never really been into smoked beers but this one is really easy drinking and super tasty.

0,5 l bottle.  BB 04/13. 
smoke, toast, roasty, leather, earthy, woody, coffee, brown, clear, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, salty, medium body, oily feel, sticky, average carbonation, long smokey finish,
very interesting and really smelling and tasting like a smoked meat. clear red in appearance, bitterseet, with a long sweet aftertaste, head disappearing quickly
Purs dark brown with little tan head. Smoky aroma, smoky taste, a little bitter. tastes like smoked salmon.

Pours black with creamy off white head. Aroma is sweet with a huge smoked meat note. Taste is extremely smoky, but with banana, bubblegum and yeasty notes. Smooth palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark yellow colour to amber, small head. Aroma is smoke and also some smoked lachs!. Tastes smoekey, strange, not bad, but strange peculiar again. In Aufsturz Berlin from bottle.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2016 Color mogano scuro semitrasparente con un cappello di schiuma pannosa color beige chiaro. Aromi di fumo, cenere e torba; gusto che rispecchia le aspettative, piacevolmente maltato e con un finale asciutto ed amarognolo. Un po debole di corpo, discreta al palato anche se un po "sottile"; il prototipo della rauchbier.

Bottle, courtesy of MiP. Pours hazy very dark brown with airy off-white head. Dark aroma of roasted malt, nuts and caramel. Slightly bitter, but very pleasant, intensely roasted flavour with rough finish.

Bottle. Pours dark red-brown with good lacing and lasting tan head. 
Aroma smoked wood, oak, caramel, fruity esters, and earthy hops.(Maybe a hint of sulphur) Taste is medium sweet, mild bitter, umami and salt? Body is medium, texture is soft and slick, average carbonation. Ends dry, and light astringent. The sweetness, smoke, bitterns and smooth body balances each other nicely.

Smells like a bag of Frazzles. This could have been included in a meat raffle. Bit like Austrian smoked cheese but without the tricky peeling involved, and I wouldnt spread it on a cracker. Maybe toast. Im totally off the mark but this is what I imagine Id drink if I was a Vandal. Id have followed Genseric and looted and pillaged as I went.

Bottle at Sir William Pub, Ljubljana. Aroma of bacon and bonfire toffee. Colour profound hazy brown. Small head. Taste is rich and smoky, with some coffee and dark fruit notes. Finish long. Impressive beer and something to savour with a good hearty meal.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

No bottling information.
Appearance: The body is a beautiful deep garnet/mahogany color that looks clear, but is dark enough to block light from passing though, the head is thick and tan with average retention, it leaves minimal lacing and a messy coating on the surface.
Aroma: Boy this is a smoked beer, the aroma is completely dominated by smoked meats, it reminds me of my clothes after a night at a campfire. Im able to pick a malt base under the smoke, but boy its hard the smoke is strong and assertive.
Taste: The smoke is prominent here with a smoked meat flavor from start to finish leaving a lingering flavor on the tongue, but the mid-taste has some light malts, some fruity esters, and light earthy hops. This is nice.
Palate: Light to medium body, light carbonation.
Overall: This is a very smoky beer and I like this. This is a smoked beer done right, very smoky and heavy on it, but if thats what youre looking for then this is where to look.
First impression wasnt good but it felt better with every swallow. Very nice taste of smoked meat. I believe it would be even better if there would be some good meat too.
Clear dark brown pour with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and smoke. Taste of roasted malts, slightly dry and a long smoky finish. Medium carbonation and slightly thin mouthfeel.

I think everyone who knows Im into beer has had to put up with me butchering the hard German "ch" in the Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier name. But I cant help it. Im vegetarian and never liked gammon one bit anyway, but this tastes like divine gammon.

Cola color with some head that disappears, Aroma of smoked meat, a bit malt. Taste is not as harsh as the aroma but you can feel the smokey meat in a really nice way, some sweetness as well,  end is dry a bit like wet wood. Overall I enjoy it but I am not a big fan of smoked beers.
Pours dark brown with a dissipating cream head. The aroma is strong smoke, earthy and a bit malty. The taste is smoky-bitter up front, with an otherwise clean, dark malt profile.
Broen color with biege head. Intense smoked aroma, also strong at taste. Medium bodied with heavy smoked flavour.
Seller recommended drinking this at room temperature. Nose was smoke and faintly skunky. Smoke came through in the flavor. Makes me wonder what hickory or mesquite might do.
2012 - 11 - 07 500ml bottle medium brown colour. medium, off-white head. smokey aroma. light bitter taste.

bottle. brown deep colour, but not opaque. Very thin head. Aroma is a blast of smoke, meats, ham/bacon, really unique. Taste isnt as intense as the aroma, but still strong smoked meat notes. Very unique, wont be for everyone. Its like the equivalent of a peaty scotch. Yummy.

The nose is certainly intriguing but not necessarily all that appealing. The smoke comes through distinctly along with some slightly muted spicy dark malt. The appearance is unremarkable which, unfortunately, is more than can be said about the flavour. The smoky flavour is pronounced but sadly didnt appeal to me at all. This was just too weird for me. Curiosity and a love of beer could still only see me through a couple of mouthfuls before the rest went down the sink - unheard of in my house.

500ml Bottle from Peckhams, Glasgow (£2.75):
The strangest smelling beer I have ever had and that was my opinion without giving it a proper whiff. There was an overpowering ham aroma right off the bat and that was almost putting me off trying it. It was quite smoky and had a  little bit of wood in there once it began to open up a little. The only thing that was noticeable without really close inspection was the strong smell of cured ham and it wasnt all that pleasant.

Reddish brown to mahogany colour with an inch tall, slightly off -white head that is quite bubbly and manages to stay quite well with only a slight reduction in size over the course of a few minutes. 

A strong smoked taste to begin with, there is also some of the cured ham but thankfully it wasnt as strong as the aroma. There was a malty base to it along with some peat and wood to it. The meaty taste is one that lingers for some time after the sip and overall it was quite a strong flavoured beer and has quite a strong oak flavour to it.

Smooth and medium bodied with a strong wood feel to it. There is also a lingering meat and bitter flavour.

Not a good beer at all, this one had such a strange and unusual taste that it wasnt enjoyable at all. It was a hard one to get your head round as it basically tasted like a ham or broth and nothing like  a beer for the most part. There was a smoky flavour in there but it wasnt a beer that I liked at all.

Bottle. Dark mahogany, brown. A lot of smoked beech on the nose. A bit of maltyness also. Body is medium, soft, a bit creamy almost. A lot of smoke. beef jerky, bbq. Dry, with not too much bitterness. An excellent beer, the king of the style.

Bottle. Dark ruby pour, bubbly tan head. Delicate carbonation. Aroma is huge smoke, cedar, a sweet dr pepper note (caramel probably). Hints of smoked sausage, earthy. Medium to thick. More smoke and peat, mildly sweet hint of cocoa with a medium, slightly grassy finish. Really nice balance and great big flavors. Probably not a great start for someone just getting into beer, but if you like it youll probably love it.
Mai bevuto questo genere, questa è la prima per me ed è fantastica!!!
caramel, coffee, toast, smoke, woody, brown, hazy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, average carbonation,

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2012 
Location: Bottle shared w/ jcos, 10/20/12


Aroma: This one has a rather smokey nose, with some roasted malts and little else

Appearance: It pours a red-brown color, with a small beige head and spotty lace

Flavor: The taste is fairly smokey, with a medium maltiness, and not much bitterness

Palate: This one has a medium-plus body, with a soft carbonation, and a lightly dry finish

Overall Impression: 
I thought that this was a solid smoke beer for sure.

On tap. Dark brown body, with a rich very light brown head that stays until I finish my glass. Gorgeous. Not very smoky aroma at the start, but as the beer gets warmer, smokiness starts to dominate, very nice. Nice smoky flavor, cant taste anything else, but its a smoked beer, right? Soft carbonation, creamy texture, heavy bodied. A very good rauchbier, maybe I had more expectations, but still, its a very good one.
Bottle. Pours somewhat clear brown color with decent white head. Aroma is smokey, especially smoked cheese. Flavor is malty, smokey with a hint of some herbs. Dry and smokey aftertaste.

Bottle picked up at Systembolaget Drottninggatan, enjoyed 11/9-12. Body is dark brown, a bit muddy, and it has a very thin beige head with small bubbles. Aroma is smokey, dry meat, campfire, light caramel. The smoke really follows in the taste, with bacon, sweet malts and raisins. Really nice. Palate is good, rich body, and the smoke taste stays in the mouth a long time, well accompanied by bittering hops. I find this a really good example of its style.
Nice beer, aroma like smoked jam, wood and spice, nothing that I ever tasted before, even so easily to drink and refreshing

500ml bottle.  Pours a clear reddish brown color with a large tan head that recedes slowly and leaves thick lacing.  Aroma is strong with smoke. Flavor starts a bit sweet, in the middle comes the smoke, and then the end is long and lingering smoked meat flavor. Body is medium, fairly slick, with minimal carbonation.

Bottle. Deep brown pour with medium, foamy head. Lots of bubbles on the glass side. Aromas of hickory smoke and copper pennies. Thin mouthfeel with good carbonation. Malty character predominates until the finish, where an herbal bitterness gives way to a moderately smoky end.
Bottle at home. Dark brown color with white head. Strong aroma of smoke and oak. Roasty and smokey flavor with good body.

Poured into a 500 ml Stange glass (Lowenbrau glass).

App-  dark brown . 15 fingers head  off-white colour
A-     rich,  smokey malt, wood
T-    absolutely smoked but with a refreshing   bitternes,  well  balanced  in my opinion
M-  long taste  in mouth, smoked malt predominance but with a good presence of hop too
O- medium body and carbonation.  A favourite for me, because it is drinkable and unique.

Bottle to glass. Pours brown with a foamy khaki head that lasts. Aroma is like walking into a meat locker with drying beef jerky and smoke/peat. Taste is more smoke and beef jerky with malt and faint sweetness. Palate is medium and dry. Pretty good smoked beer.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours a dark red/brown with a frothy, fluffy head which leaves nice lacings.
Aroma is overwhelmingly smoky! Hemp rope, tar, leather, smoked meat and sweet malt.
Taste has same elements as above plus chocolate. 
After taste long and dry.
Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Mouth feel is smooth.
Bottle - at home - Incredible aroma and flavour, but let down by being a little too fizzy for my liking
500ml bottle, This beer is near perfect. More breweries should smoke their beers! The taste is unbelievably great. Smokey , rich in taste with fruity undertones.
The idea of smoking beer is just brilliant. It tastes celestial. The aroma is unique. One of the best beers Ive drunk in my entire life.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Scott on September 28th, 2012.
Appearance: Pours a dark opaque.
Aroma: Aroma of smoke, faint bacon.
Taste: Smoke, faint malt, faint hop, less bacon than in aroma.
Palate:Medium light body.
Summary: My second from Brauerei Heller, with two more at home.  Lot of taste considering the low abv, and the smokiness is done well.  Never thought Id like smoked beers, but apparently I do!
If you like smoked beer, this is the KING. If you don´t, try something else

Bottle 500ml. Pours a dead white kind of nothing head. Relaxed carbonation. Dark red brown color. Aroma of bread and rottening fruit. Taste of prune and bread.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown original smoke beer. Nice foam. Aroma of smoke and bacon. Taste of smoke and ropes.

One of my favourite beers worldwide. Its very singular, a beer in which the smoke rules the whole beer: aromas, appearance, flavour, palate...Smoke in different forms: bacon, salmon and hints of coffee in nose, meat and bacon in mouth. Perdurable flavour, marvellous head and lace, marked and longlasting...The overall is overwhelming, convincing, unforgettable.

Aroma: The smell is mostly burnt moist wood, some dark roasted coffee and a hint of stable and earth.Appearance: A very dark beer, black with a hint of brown, seems clear. The head is light beige and leaves rather much lacing.Taste: A sweet tone at first, from dark syrup and dark bread. A hint of coffee and smoked sausage.Palate: The liquid is soft, mild carbonation and overall smoth.Overall: Something to drink by the fire!Note: Bottle. Reviewed 2010-02-13.

Redbrown coloured beer with a fluffy tan head. Smell of smoke and bologna/charcuterie with elements of tar. Taste av malts and smoked meat/charcuterie. Some bitterness. Light feeling with some crispy carbonation. Some burned bitterness in after taste.
Dark reddish brown colour. Wood smoke, salty charred meat, tar and nutty malts on the nose. Relatively thin body, lingering finish. A unique and delicious autumnal beer.

Pours dark reddish brown with little white head. The aroma is what makes the beer. A rich smokey roasted pork and earthy wood aroma. Up front the taste is all smokey and most a charred bacon but after a while the beer starts to develop under the smoke. A light bodied hearty dark German lager develops nicely. Robust but I like some of Aechts others better.

Bottle at home - 23/09/12.
Pours a rich dark chestnur brown with a large bubbly tan head.
Sweet smelling roast malts backed up immediately by frazzles, smoked bacon/gammon and a little charred wood.
Smoked malts, smoked piggy tones, wood and hints of toffee.
Medium bodied with a bit of umph, moderate soft carbonation and a fairly smooth smokey finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Draught @ "In de Wildeman", Amsterdam.
Pours a clear dark amber, almost no head. Low in carbonation. The Bamberg nose is unmistakeable.
This is the most approachable Rauch I know, without compromising on quality. The Rauch is there, but is not as aggressive as often. Feint caramel and a bitter finish. It does not linger. We had it with some smoked eel, perfect!
Wood and bacon in the taste and the aroma. Also,caramel malts and smoke (a little BBQ). The beer that comes in my mind when I think about Rauchbiers.

Bellaspetto marrone ramato, con una schiuma bianca abbastanza persistente.
Naso intensamente affumicato, con malti caramellati e miele di castagno.
Secca, morbida, snella di corpo, bel finale pulito, lungo e persistente sui toni affumicati.....da abbinare a speck e wurstel...

Poured from a refrigerated bottle into a pint glass. Lours a dark translucent copper. Near brown. The head is pretty creamy with a beige color to it. The aroma is uncooked bacon or smoked sausage. Taste is smoky bacon and sausage. Mouthfeel is full and heavy on the tongue.
Very particular beer, nice colour.  The taste is nice but you basically just feel the smoky aroma

This was very dark and smelt like smoke. I couldnt smell anything else and the first taste was like something burnt. While it rounded out and I could appreciate it as a well done beer, I think Ill stay with the norweigan wood smoked beers for this style.
Purchased large 500ml bottle by accident. was open minded about trying it so I popped it open and it hit me WOW. holy smoke. Im sure by the ratings it is ok for its genre but not my cup of tea.
UPDATED: SEP 6, 2012 What an amazing unusual taste. The black color isnt very attractive but the taste is like smoking bbq and sausages. Wow!

AROMA: roasty, toast, bread, smoke, vanilla, woody, 
APPEARANCE: red, clear, minimal head, white foam, 
TASTE: umami, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
PALATE: light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 
OVERALL: smoke clearly present but not overwhelming, quite sweet, very malty, pleasant aromas and taste, bit too thin on the palate.

Not for the faint hearted this one. My wife asked if i was eating bacon before she saw i was drinking a beer. Its really that strong. Smoke, smoke and more smoke. I couldnt get anything else from it. An experience, not one ill be having regularly though.

16.9 fl oz bottle poured into a regular glass.

A: Pours a dark burgundy color with great translucence in spite of its shade. The head is a two finger light mocha color with lowish retention, but a nice texture. Spotty patches of lacing left on the glass.

S: Holy crap, this is smoky. Admittedly, Im no bacon fan, but this definitely has a bacon vibe to it. Tons of wood, saltiness, and of course smoke come across strongly on the aroma. Wonderfully augmented by its subtle marzen sweetness from the malt.

T: Initial flavors are, of course, smoky. Lots of beechwood and bacon-y sweetness open the initial sips. Also, its not as phenolic as I feared, thankfully. The rauch profile calms down as more of the beer is imbibed, allowing its marzen roots to shine through - the way the flavor progresses gradually from rauchbier to marzen is almost masterful, as before long, the flavor profile switches to a caramely, nutty composition where the smoke only augments things. However, its a slow sipper, if only because it behooves the drinker to find differing subtleties in the flavor from sip to sip. For what its worth, its the most complex lager Ive ever had, and its balanced like a champ to boot.

M: Well textured (not too thick or too thin), with a light bittersweet dryness. Carbonation is near perfect.

O: If this was my first beer of the night, I likely would have gone "LOL BACON SUX I NO LIEK THIS BEER" and given it something along the lines of a 2.55 overall. Luckily, I came into this after having a few beers, and they helped smooth this out brilliantly. Its one of those beers that works better the more you drink it, allowing me to see it for the incredible beer that it is.

Poured out of a bottle
Thin head that fades quickly
Dark amber to brown in color
Smokey nose
Smokey, malty, with the slightest hint of caramel.
Medium mouthfeel with with a lingering smokey smooth taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black and deep rubin red colour. Lovely light tan frothy head. Can smell the smokeof the beer from far away. Smoke and meat/bacon on the nose. Mouthwatering! If you like open fires/bbqs this is for you! Aromas of roasted malts with a hint of the bitterness of nuts. Soft bit oily. Lightly bitter with some sweetness. Medium body, smokey long balanced finish.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear deep reddish chestnut, with a medium off-white head, which lasts fairly well and leaves decent lacing. The aroma is intensely smoky and tannic, with some faint lemon hops notes. Mild lemon hops up front lead through into a savoury and richly smoky body, which offers a blend of hickory and smoked paprika. There is a slight touch of coffee towards the finish, but that delicious smokiness reasserts itself in the aftertaste. This beer has a much stronger smoke character than Aechts weizen, with the smoked malt really dominating proceedings, giving it a fantastic savoury feel. Great stuff.

Pours clear, dark brown....purple against the light....decent tan head.
Nose is campfire bacon, ham...nice smoke notes.
Taste is surprisingly understated smoked meat.....malt.
aits very good, but the aroma is much more than the flavour...
More of a smoky porter/brown ale in taste....
Not that thats a bad thing......this beer, though a bit thin, is excellent..........

Even through dense head the aroma is quite strong. Nice pure, natural tar hides fruits. Color is deep, dark red wine, seems brownish in glass.  Good, dense and rocky light beige head stays quite well, lacing also. Looks good. Tar, salty licorice, ripe dark fruits and herbs in taste. Light to medium body, light feel, easy to drink. A good one, nice flavors, pure and natural.

Cask at Great British Beer Festival. Dark brown with slight ruby. With a heavy thick light tan head. Smells incredible. Like someone has steeped pork scratchings and bacon in beer. Smokey and salty. In the mouth, it's more bacony bits, and a mouthful of cold liquid smoke. My first experience with a rauchbier and I'm blown away by the flavours and aromas. Finish is bitter and smokey and makes me feel like I've just had breakfast.
Best smoked Ive had. Just because it felt more like a beer than the others ive had and I like to think im drinking beer when i am.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2013 
50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090129.
Pours clear red-brown color with large, frothy head. Aroma of smoke, ham, butnt malts, bread and some dark fruits. Flavor of smoky ham, burnt malts, bread and caramel. Slick malty palate with a dry burnt finish. Excellent. A regular buy.
4326

500ml bottle. This smoked beer is an unicum for me, i never drank before. It has more intensive odor than aroma, taste is a good smoked cheese. Aftertaste also. :) Rather light CO2 and decent reddish-brown colour.

(Bottle 50cl) Pours beatifully reddish brown with a light head. Aroma of smoked ham/wood. Flavour of malts, burnt wood and smoked ham. Actually quite smoth, but I dont actually like it; non smoker ;-)

Delicious smoky aroma that is immediately there. Color was clear and dark brown. Taste was not as fantastic as its aroma but was still there. Palate was minimal. This one would be great with a nice smoked steak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured with very little head, with small off white bubbles. Aroma was smoked and slightly spicy. Color was a red/brown and let a good amount of light through. Taste was not as smoked as aroma, with very little palate. No bitter finish. Would pair well with smoked cheese!

A: This beer appears a mahogany brown hue with crimson highlights. The head is about an inch thick and leaves some good lacing on the glass.

S: The beer smells like a campfire, similar to an Islay scotch, but not nearly as boozy, of course. Scents include smoke, malt, peat, earth.

T: The flavor is fantastic, with a prominent smoke taste that is right on the money. Well balanced and delicious.

M: The feel is fairly thin bodied with a moderate carbonation level.

D: This brewery sets the bar for rauchbiers. When I have a hankering for a rauchbier, Schlenkerla brews are the first thing that comes to mind.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-24-2011
light body, smoke, brown, frothy. Focus on smoke aroma and taste.. Otherwise not so fantastic.
Really not for me. Smell of smoky meat, campfire in your hair the day after. Taste of smoked sausage, bacon and dirty ash. Unpleasant in a beer.

Pours dark brown/red. Aromas of intense smoke and some oily olive notes. Fairly smoky flavor too, although some unsmoked malt cuts through to remind one that this is in fact beer and not liquid gouda. Not quite as serious as the urbock, but easier to drink.

The classic stuff. Pours a dark reddish brew with a very nice tan head that leaves a beautiful lace in the glass. The predominant aroma is of smoke with hints of a very nice sweet malt aroma. Almost no hop aroma. Nice body. The taste is again predominantly smoky but without being cloying. Malt dominated beer. A world class.

Poured from a bottle and is dark with a good head which does not last long, the aroma is smoke, medium carbonation, the taste is malt, smoke and some molasses, palate is thin and not much residual or alcohol warmth. Decent but not my style.

The head is ok, the body dark-brown. It smells smoky, darkmalty. The taste is smoky darkmalty, refreshing, fresh, serious. To drink this beer it is something between drinking and eating. Very ok 13/12/11/12/13/12

Bottle to oversized snifter.  Looks good; mohagany with thin white lacing.  Smells and tastes like Christmas ham...liquid Christmas ham.  Mouthfeel is average.  Not my favorite style, but a good representation nonetheless.

Bottle from local Sake Marche. Good smoke, smoldering wood ash, ham, and a bit of scuzzy urban alleyway. Dark translucent brown, great lacing. Nice smoke flavor, a bitter mid palate, and a very long subtle bitter aftertaste. Thin body, but the flavors compensate and make it seem bigger. A very good smoked beer. Not overwhelming, but rather very balanced. Yum!

500 ml bottle - kindly shared by Dennoman. Pours reddish light amber with no head. Aroma of intensely smoked and roasted bacon, burnt wood and charcoal, cherries on rhum and slight almondy. Light body with subtle sourness and sweetness. Taste is huge smoked bacon. Impressive beer for a 5.1% ABV!!! Wauw.
A hard to drink beer for me because of its overflowing smokiness and ham-iness. Maybe a good companion to meat and some cigars.
Lots of smoke, wood, bacon in both the aroma and taste. Like liquid campfire hot dogs.

Great beer all around!  Clear dark amber with a surprisingly white head.  Very smoky and malty smell, almost like bacon.  Tasted about the same.  Very malty with just enough bitterness to keep it balanced.  Rich creamy texture and full bodied.  Long finish with smoke and malt slowly fading away.  Favorite beer Ive ever had so far!

Definitely the "smokiest" of 5 rauchs sampled. This is the archetype for a Bavarain rauchbier. Once you get used to the flavor it rally stays with you and on your palate. Perfect sipper to enjoy with some German sausages and cheeses.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2014 Bottle from Pivotéka u Modrého lva. Clear dark ruby-brown colour. Big airy off-white to beige head,  rather quickly diminishing. Aroma smoke, smoked ham, light coffee and caramel. Very harmonic and smooth taste, the smoke is at a very pleasant level, not too much, not too little. Balanced with nice caramel maltiness. Finish is pleasant smoky and better.

16.9 oz bottle.  Pours amber brown with a medium creamy off-white head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is smokey malts of the liquid smoke variety with some sweet BBQ.

The flavor is sweet plasticky (esp in the finish) caramel malts and smoke (a little BBQ) with charred roast.  The mouthfeel is light to medium bodied and a little watery.

Overall, lots of smoke, but its a bit thin with some off notes.

Dark reddish pour.  Big creamy head.  Aroma of smoked meat and bacon.  Slightly salty quality.  Mouth is very full.  Taste is super smokey but the after taste is surprisingly mellow.  Some copper in the taste too.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with medium creamy off-white mostly lasting head. Smokey bacon hotwing somthing aroma and flavor. Not my type of beer.

Clean dark amber body with beige frothy head. Very big on the smoke, hard to get more than that. Very powerful. Taste has more subtleties, with a smooth malty base, earthy, hint of dried plums and a hoppy backup near the end. Aftertaste is surprisingly short, which fits this beer well.  Very drinkable. Awesome if youre into smoked beers, not so much if  you hate them, obviously. I think I like this though, especially the taste. (50cl bottle)

Dark brown and a beautiful thick beige head that stays on top of the beer almost all the way down. Smoke on the nose, of course, most aroma notes will go in that direction, like (smoked) bacon and (burnt) wood. You also notice the smoke on the palate, but theres an array of other flavours as well, particularly a malty sweetness and bitterness that kicks in towards the end. My first experience with smoke beers, maybe a year ago, I think was a smoked Baltic porter. I found it way too smoky and almost undrinkable. But its a style thats growing on me and I found this one most pleasant and the smoke character was now not at all intrusive.
Great color, nice smell. Smokey taste makes it very interesting. Taste great with some smoked food. Give it a try !

Poured into a tulip glass. Copper color, almost opaque. Nice inch and half of dirty-white head.

Well, as I poured it I could smell the smoke. It is like being at a campfire as only the embers are glowing with no flames. Amazing.

Smoky grain taste, light hop bitterness at the end. Very smooth flavor.

Soft, medium body, moderate carbonation. A little less carbonation would be nicer for me, but it does not hold the beer back at all.

Excellent. Easy to drink and hits the Rauchbier notes perfectly (it is the original apparently).

500ml bottle pours a brownish amber color with a small off-white head that settles to some thin spotty lacing.  Aroma is smoky with some light caramel and chocolate and mild hops.  Taste is smoky with malty sweetness and a mild herbal hoppy bitterness.  Light to medium body with decent carbonation.  A nicely done rauchbier with a decent balance of flavors and recommended for tasting.

From draft in Bamberg.   Dark amber with a medium head. Aroma is malty with smooth smoke. Flavor is bready with nice non-overpowering smoke. Medium body with average carbonation. Nice woody smoky finish.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Smokey barbecue aroma. Dark brown, reasonable head. Smokey bacon flavour. Smooth & tasty. Perfect partner for barbecued food. Brilliant beer.
Cerveza ahumada de carácter impresionante. Notas de especias variadas, apariencia schwarze, cuerpo medio a bajo, propio deL tipo. Una joya.
Majbål, majs och allm. rökarom spåras. Fyllig och nästan lite krämig. Spännande och rätt svårbedömd. Men god är den!

500ml bottle. Clear dark red glowing amber with huge firm frothy tan head. Intense smoke aroma, ham-like, salty. Taste is way more decent smokey, has a slightly sweet dark malty touch, also some dry hoppy notes. So good.

Bottle. Clear deep amber with a medium head. Aroma is pretty much all smooth smoke and some bread. Flavor is rich and bready with a smooth smokiness. Medium body with average carbonation and a long finish. Great beer, very smoky but easy drinking.

Very nice smoky flavour and aroma. Yet a bit watery and lacking in a strong, complex malt flavour. It is very nice but if the malt was stronger and more complex I would give it a higher mark. It is a bit too dependent on the smokiness.
Tastes like smoked sausage with a very peaty aroma. Superb after dinner with some snacks, potato chips or peanuts.

Pour out of bottle, dark brownish black pour with creamy off white almost tan head, aroma brought big smoked meats, salt, bacon, chocolate, hints of campfire and woody notes, touch of ash but not bad, some nice dark fruits poke their head in as well.  Taste is big bacon and chocolate notes, big campfire, roasted, ashy notes, oak and wood come through, hints of fruit, finishing very smoky and dry.  Almost a bit unbalanced, but very tasty.

Slightly cloudy dark brown colour with a nice tan head; aroma is smoked wood; flavour is smoke, burnt wood and bitter; an acquired taste I have yet to acquire.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

16.9 oz bottle poured into an imperial pint glass.  Pours very dark brown/black with reddish hues.  With a large tan head.  Smells of smoke, bacon, various smoked meats.  Tastes of smoke, bacon, caramel, mostly just smokey bacon though.  Nice creamy texture, medium in carbonation.  Not bad I suppose but Im not sure smoked beers are my thing.
Det bästa rökölet enligt mitt tycke. Doft och smak av tjära, järnvägsslipers, röktkorv. En upplevelse.

500 mL bottle. Poured a deep reddish black, a thick beige head and good lacing. Deep smoked aroma, a little dusty. Reminiscent of all my favorite smoked foods, brisket, ribs, katsuobushi. Finishes with a little malt bit and very little carbonation. This is my first smoke beer and its a little hard to pull other flavors out of this, some soy sauce like notes and more wood.  Interesting, would be willing to try more of these.

This was my first smoked beer. It sure was interesting to sense smoked meat in it. Dark brown color with thin head.
It was very dry and strong smell of smoke. Maybe little too strong smoke aroma. Next time i will drink it with grill food, I have one in my refrigerator waiting for this occasion.

Bottle, poured a dark copper brown color with medium head.  Big, big smoke aroma, roasted malt, bacon.  Light bitter.   Medium body.  Creamier texture.   Softer carbonation.  Caramel malt and oak  comes out in taste with lots of smoke and roasted malt.  Pretty smooth smoked beer.

Pours a very dark red colour with a short lived white head. Aroma is smoky with notes of wood. Taste is also smoky and notes of wood. Finish is dry. Slightly watery texture. I quite like the smokiness although Id like to taste some other flavours as well.
Bottle. Dark brown with red hue. Medium beige head, stays. Roasted malts, smoke in aroma. Very smoky body, hints of caramel. Dry everlasting smoke in aftertaste.

Pours a very nice deep ruby brown with a frothy off white head. Nose is smoky meats, with wood and saltiness. Light brown sugar sweetness and roast on the entry leading into nice flavorful smoked meatiness with some tree bark. Finishes dry and a bit salty. Tasty beer.

Dark brown with a red tint and a light brown head. Smell of roast and smoke. Malt and salt. Gentle smooth rich body thats a little watery. Taste of bacon and burnt. The balance of smoke and smooth water makes for a really great drink.

500ml bottle. A dark ruby-brown beer with medium crème brûlée head. Medium retention. Delicate and light aroma: a little caramel, hops and brown sugar, wood smoke.
Taste if smoked coffee, lots of smoke, dried prunes. Very light and almost no carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 500ml bottle. Smoky, caramel aromas. Pours dark copper, clear, nice tan head, some persistance and lacing. Lilght to medium body,and average carbonation. Taste is smoky, maybe some other flavours but since it is not balanced at all they are well hidden.  Tasty anyway, but palate saturating one.

Keg @Schlenkerla, Bamberg. 06-08-2016.
Nice and fresh. Good.
Tanto el olor como el sabor de esta cerveza es ahumado, casi humo!!. Perfecta para acompañar barbacoas, salchichas, salmón....

May 5 2012. Bottle pours black, dark brown in light, with 1 inch tan head that dissolves to tight cap. Just a little sticky lacing. Aroma is a strong sweet smoke trailing with smokey malt and spicy pork (just a little). Sweet smokey nose transfers to taste as flavour is infused with sweet smoke. Sweet malt is balanced by a salty olive lingering in aftertaste. Palate is also infused with smoke. A tad oily that sticks to mouth and allows sweet smoke and salty aftertaste to linger for a long time. Not heavy but long-lasting. A one of a kind taste that makes me long for smoked sausage, kippers or smoked herring.
Smells like liquid smoke.  Tastes smokey but  delightfully so.  Black.  No head.  No lacing.  Smoke rests on palate.  Well balanced.  This beer begs to be drank with a cigar or a meaty meal.

Wow... this smells like I just stuck my nose into a smoker. HUGE smokey aroma thats actually inviting. The smokiness comes off in the taste, too, thought its not overpowering there. Its surprisingly light, I think, and doesnt have the heavy aftertaste I was fearful of. Great brew.

Fantastic smokey aroma pours deep amber brown small head with some lacing smoke taste slight malt sweetness medium body sticky texture lively on the tongue dry finish long lasting smoke flavor One of the best smoke beers out there.

It pours deep reddish-brown with ruby highlights; the head is off-cream and foamy. The aroma has notes of: charcoal, peat, bacon, candied dates, perhaps nutmeg, and hickory wood-smoke. The taste is medium sweet that finishes light dry and medium-light umami; there are notes of: hickory, black-coffee, Islay-scotch (peat/iodine), and a hint of cocoa. The palate is medium-light bodied, aqueous, with a decently long finish; low carbonation. Overall, fantastic for the Marzen stylebut I prefer the Urbok  it needs that body.

Aroma non molto potente, o comunque dominato dallaffumicatura. Il colore, bellissimo, è tipo granato con un cappello di schiuma finissima Sicuramente particolare al gusto. Tipo fumo di caminetto con qualcosa di patè di alici. Il retrogusto è unico. Ottima. Daltronde il bello è variare. Non può ,ovviamente, piacere a tutti.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2012 Bottle - 0,5 l - jollybeers.net and Beer OClock Bucharest
Appearance: Dark amber color with a medium, mostly lasting, good lacing beige head (DONT pour it gently if you want a nice head) . 
Aroma: -moderate to high- smoked ham, pork, smoked wood, roasted malt with some hints of chocolate and caramel
Taste: -moderate salty and lightly sweet with a moderate to high bitter finish. Nice blend of tastes.
Palate: full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium to long finish.
Ovearall: a nice beer, scores points in novelty

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2012 Aaahhh...yes.  The Schlenkerla Märzen Rauchbier.  This is what got me into Rauchbiers (smoked beers) initially.  I remember my first bottle as if it was yesterday.  Well, as a matter of fact, I did have one yesterday!  I bought the 50cl pint glass as an homage to one of my personal favorites.  This is basically the beer I use as a base to benchmark other rauchbiers.  Aroma is of course smoke, and malt, perfectly balanced.  Color is dark brown.  I dont understand people saying that this beer has no head as I always get a good (and smoky!) 1" to 1 1/2" head when pouring into my Schlenkerla pint.  Taste is malty and smoky (of course), a bit salty, and I could also almost say umami, as far as Im concerned.  Very slightly bitter aftertaste.  Body is medium, with a good lively carbonation.  An excellent brew, goes really well with food, barbecue (hmm...where did I get this nickname of mine?) and aged cheddar (3 years and more).

Bottle 500ml.
Pours dark brown, with almost no head. Aroma is of massive smoke. Taste is of smoke, malt. Nice beer, surprisingly drinkable. Better than the nose tells you.

Dark brown. Aroma: smoky and malt. Taste fairly well balanced for a smoked beer. Little salty (?). Medium carbonation. Would recommand if you like smoke beer.
Brun foncé. Aromes: fumée et malt. Goût assez bien balancé pour une bière fumée. Un peu salée (?). Carbonatation moyenne. Je recommande pour les amateurs de bières fumées.
Aroma of smoked wood, pork, wheat and hints of chocolate.  Pours dark brown with a thick creamy head.  Taste is nice and smokey with a nice hearty malt taste.  Nice and delicious.

Aroma of charcoal, bacon, smoked ham, oak. Taste is very smokey, with notes of vanilla, leather, and oak. Smooth creamy palate. The finish is hoppy and abrupt, keeping it from becoming overwhelming, and giving it drinkability. Very good on its own, but really cries out to be paired with a bratwurst, or a bacon cheeseburger, or even a big stinky blue cheese. Definitely a food beer.

Brown but clear. Yellow brown foam that lasts somewhat. Strong smoky aroma, not typical Icelandic, tar. Medium carbon, medium to low body. Smoky flavour. short bitter aftertaste that lasts for a short time. Good balance

500ml bottle. Poured into tulip glass. Wonderfully thick tan head took half the glass! Knocked over instantly by the campfire smell. Im a big nut for campfires - I have them all year round even in the dead of winter (Canada). But the smell of this really wasnt expected and I was thrown off instantly. (This is my first smoke beer, and I didnt know this was one). Gorgeous deep brown with some burgundy where the light can actually penetrate (Lovibond 30).   Taste is overwhelmingly smoky at first but soon brings to mind some bock beers Ive had. Man that smell is NOt just smoke... But FISHY! like smoked herring! Some sweet character as well, but no bitterness or hops detected. Palate is rather watery and very flat (low carbonation). Truly, after several swigs it tastes good, but the smoky aroma is just too out of place for me to recommend.

Smokey but it was not over the top and didn't drown out the flavor.  Still has plenty of transparency with amber hues.  Not heavy at all and a few rounds will still please before the smokey flavor sends you in a new direction.  A very tasty beer with food such as meat and cheese tray.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Originally reviewed: 7/17/09. Pour into my stange (first time Ive ever used it; cool glass) a dark brownish red, like watered-down coffee. Big light tan head on top. Excellent retention, leaves some spotty lacing. Smells like smoked ham, a dirty grill, and faint sweet maltiness. 

Mouthfeel is crisp with a moderate amount of carbonation present. Flavor is smoke, smoke, meat, smoke, smoked meat, slight bitter hops, and smoke. Wow. I was a little hesitant going into this one, but I dig it. I wouldnt want to drink one after the other, as it is a bit different, but I can drink this one plenty fine.

Dark ruby red colour, smoke in the smell. Initially tastes of leather and burnt wood. I first wondered if I could finish the bottle but now wish I had a couple more. Not overly fizzy and not much head. Looks great, smells great and tastes even better.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2013 Update.  After having on draft at the pub I must say that this is one of the best smoked beers I have ever had.  Perhaps I got an old bottle because this beer is amazing.  

Pours transparent and light brown out of the bottle but as it gathers in the glass, light ceased to get through and it becomes black.  Small off white head gather on top but quickly recedes to a few scattered bubbles.  Nose is smoked oysters, wood, burnt meat and bacon grease.  Taste is light.  Really light.  Expected more.  Its mildy sweet and more on the bitter side.  Smoke in the flavor isnt as pronounced as other rauchbiers from the same label.  Mouthfeel is crisp and oily, light to medium body with a medium long aftertaste.  Not bad, but not my favorite from Schlenkerla.

Clear dark brown with a rather fizzy yet foamy head. The smell reminds me of a Bonfire up in the northwoods at my cabin, thats the best way I can describe it. On the other hand, the flavor is unlike anything I have ever had. Im getting smoked ham, smoked oak, with some chocolate and oddly enough, sweet malts. The body is also very light and creamy, and its also very easy to drink. Having not tried a Smoked beer before, I was very surprised with how much I enjoyed this beer and I will be trying this style again in the very near future

Pours a dark golden brown with a white head that settles fairly quickly.  Moderate lacing hangs to the glass.  Oak smoke aroma backed by caramel and toasted bread notes.  Smoke and burnt sugar (you know, past caramel) start off the taste.  Some roasty tones.  Non-smoked oak is also apparent in the flavor.  Vanilla, marshmallow, toast.  Add some chocolate malt and youve got a smore.  The palate is on the thick side with some lingering stickyness that doesnt present as sweet so much as just thick or sticky.  The smoke is well balanced and complements the beer quite well.  Good example of this Bamberg specialty.

A light brown coloured beer, with an off-white head that mostly diminishing. The aroma is roasty and smokey. The taste is bittersweet with notes of smoke, roasted malt, dark chocolate and hops. The finish is bitter.

Oct 2011: Popped into a local pub last night because they were having a two week Octoberfest type thing: pleased I did because there were bottles of this for £3.20.

Sadly they didnt have any of the correct glasses or steins, so I poured it into a Becks Vier glass which actually suited it well. It showed off the body and head nicely and allowed the smoky aromas to waft out.

Really is an acquired taste and my wife hates this beer (weve been to Bamberg a few times). I am not a smoked bacon guy, nor do I smoke or eat much smoked ham or cheeses, but I do like this beer.

Tap @ fermentoren pours clear amber light sepia. Aroma : cured meats, salami, smoke is very present, though not overwhelming, some caramel, malty, grain, meaty, Bon fire. Taste: smoke upfront, some caramel sweetness, malty, grain, grassy, salami, high drink ability, a lot of smoke but very balanced.

Big creamy head and powerful smoke noticeable immediately. Burgundy color, aromatically and visually exciting. Not too much but not too little carbonation. Easy going aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 17, 2012 Pours a brown with a white head.  It smells like ham or cooked meats. Extremely unique!  The taste translates into that, with a very earthy and smoky flavor.  Although I do get a bit of a watery flavor.  Still definitely unique.  Something I need to try again.

Purchased at Schlenkerla in Bamberg, Germany as it was too crowded to sit, enjoyed at my hotel room relaxing after a long day of walking the beautiful city.  I hope I didnt spare myself from not having on draft there, figured to have this fresh from the brewery would be as good, and it is very good.  Appearance is surprisingly clear, dark amber, rich off white head.  Aroma of burnt wood, bacon, ash, I can only imagine how many known carcinogens Im ingesting right now.  Taste is purely classic.  Its intense without being too potent, doesnt taste like Im drinking ash, I can even get a bit of lager yeast in the flavor, along with the wood and bacon flavor.  I liked the Weizen and thought Fastenbier was ok, this is the best, hands down.  Best smoked ale around.

Realy enjoyed the smoke flavour was awesome!  Will have this beer on hand when I get the BBQ out next.  The smell and taste of smoke is always present but stays at a constant level, never over taking the beer but intwind in its base.  After taste left me with the impression of well cooked bacon.  
Realy want to put on the BBQ now!

500ml bottle. Aroma is old wood stove, bacon and brown sugar malt. Looks kind of like root beer when poured out into a glass. The sweetness and smoke are balanced reasonably well in the taste. Body is medium/heavy with decent carbonation to keep it from weighing down too much. Overall, the smoke tastes less forced and artificial than North American interpretations of the style, but Im still not sold on drinking bacon.

This is a beer I could appreciate once but will most likely never drink again. Smoke is definitely present--even the appearance resembles smoke--and there is a strong undertone of meat. One of the most interesting beers I have ever had and amazingly executed, but drinking a whole glass of smoked meat was difficult for me.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2012 Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a dark brown color with orange highlights and a huge creamy beige head that lingers forever and left incredible lacing. The aroma was rich and full hickory smoke and bacon. The flavor was rich hickory, bacon and a bready malt presence like lightly toasted bread slices. Long bacon finish and moderately full bodied. Like breakfast in a glass - tastes like bacon, fried eggs and toast and does so in excellent fashion. Even better than the weizen. Outstanding.

500ml bottle @ Rymy-Eetu

Pours dark brown with a smooth head. Aroma of smoked ham, roasted malts and chocolate. Taste is smoky and malty with notes of ham, roastiness and hints of hops. Finish is smoked with notes of roasted malts. Nice, tasty and not over the top smoked.
fantastic beer. lingering and powerful smoke finish. easy to drink. light but tasty. dangerously more-ish!
Dégustée trop froide. Le col est presque absent et disparaît rapidement. Belle couleur brune un peu translucide. Goût trop accentué de bacon et viandes fumées. Très effervescente en bouche.

Clear dark brown pour with a one inch slightly off-white head. Wonderful smokey, bacon aroma. Smells like breakfast ham cooked over an open camp fire, with ever the slightest sweet caramel undertones. Taste is not nearly as dominated by smoke as I expected given the aroma. Actually quite subtle. First and foremost, clean and light like a traditional marzen, mainly caramel and biscuit malt tastes. Smoke flavor is more accoutrement than entree. Adds an extra depth that most lagers lack. Finishes slightly dry, with a lingering smokey aftertaste like the smell of your clothing after a bonfire. Quite delicious. I had not been a rauchbier fan prior to this, but I would certainly come back to this again.
Dark, tan head. Aromas reminiscent of a really well smoked salami. Sweet in taste and easy drinking. Of the smoked beers I have tried this is outstanding.

Clear, dark brown body, or maybe deep amber, with a large, creamy, long-lived tan head that ends up in a nice layer and lots of lacing. Very strong aroma with plenty of smoke and camp fire, but most of all I get meat. Smoked ham, smoked sausages, cured ham, smoked pork chops and other meaty products. All good dishes, but as a beer? Moderate sweet taste with just a hint of bitterness in the finish. I also find it quite salty, but Im not sure if that taste is real, or if its just the salty smoky meaty flavours that trick me. The flavours are as powerful as the aroma, and although there are no off-flavours I cant say Im that thrilled about liquid meat. I would probably have liked it better if the smoke and the faint peaty notes were much stronger and the meat less obvious. The carbonation is too soft for such a light bodied and watery beer, and there is also a very faint metallic feel to the beer. I dont think I know of a good english antonym to "refreshing", but I think Ill start saying "Schlenkerla Rauchbier Märzen".
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed approximately at BB date, from Vinmonopolet Storo, Oslo]
@ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, 25cl from cask. Nice amber/brown color. Strong taste of smoked meat. You have to learn to drink this kind of stuff, but once you tried your first, than youll love it.

Bottle. Pourse dark brown color with decent brownish head. Very aromatic. Smoke (smoked ham) and wood dominate the aroma. Very strong smoke flavor that overwhelms all other flavors. Thin bodied (much thinner than I expected). Dry finish. Defenatly a beer that has to be enjoyed together with different kinds of smoked meat.

500 ml bottle. Pours an orangeish dark brown with a thick beige head. Smells of smoke, caramel and dry wood. Tastes very smokey, salty and slightly herbal, earthy. Leaves a long, lingering smoke taste in mouth. Body is very light and watery. I wouldnt recommend it, unless one is a big fan of the style, but I personally enjoyed it.

Intense dark red, practically black colour. Smoky, kinda hammy smell (in a nice way). Tastes much the same as it smells but not as overpowering or weird as I thought that it might be. In fact its delicious. Lovely smoky aftertaste. Very interesting beer - not one for a session, but will absolutely buy again.

500 ml bottle. Pours pitchblack with a decent large beige head. Aroma is dominated by smoke but has also some notes of sweet malts. Smooth taste has smoke, roasty and caramel malt. Rather long finish and low but stingy carbonation. Light and little bit watery mouthfeel. The smokey notes in the beer reminds me for some reason of grilled sausage or ham. Good beer with food. Nicely different also.

50cl bottle.
Pours a dark clear ruby red with a large offwhite head.
Smells of charred meat, bacon, and campfire.
Tastes of bacon, smoke, and sweet malt; a medium sweetness and medium bitterness.
Texture is oily, body is medium, carbonation is soft.
Finishes dry and smokey.

Big bottle from Halftimebeverage.com  Pours beautifully and aromatically with a puffing head of tan foam that lasts down to the final swallow.  Wonderful aromas greet the nose immediately whetting the appetite for the first mouthing.  Old smokehouse flavors and cask conditioned enhancements remind the drinker of a fine whiskey or flame seared steak, well balanced with a lingering caramel sweetness.  Perhaps the finest rauchbier in the Marzen tradition I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.

This was my first smoked beer, so I was quite surprised with what I discovered. 
Pours a cola color brown with a two finger tan head that quickly dissipates. Smells very smokey, resembling smoked Gouda with some smoked sausage notes. Tastes of sweet malts with a smokey leathery taste, the Gouda is still coming through even now. After taste is still very smokey and is clean and moderately dry. This was a whole new beer experience for me! I didnt know beer could taste like this, and I am still getting used to it. But the more I drink of this and become used to the taste, the more I can see this is a very well crafted beer.

Another satisfying smoked beer from the brewery that mastered these.  This is the 3rd in their series I have tried, and I am very happy to get "schlenkered" again.  This one came to me in the usual 500 ml bottle and pours almost clear copper brown with a nice tan head and some lacing.  Aroma is of smoked ham or bacon, but not as much bacon as their doppelbock.   Ignoring the smoke (which is impossible) the taste is on the bitter side.  Roasted malts come out in the finish.  Very enjoyable.
Has a dark brown color. Smell is of smoked meats. Taste is smoke, bacon, very meaty, something I cannot get into. Overall I was unable to finish the glass.
