Smoky bacon or perhaps closer to smoked fish on the nose. Not over powering smoke in the mouth and it is quite dry. Feel slightly let down by the Smoked beers as the smoke seems quite one-dimensional to me, without much else going on in the beer.

Bottle enjoyed at home
This brewery is an institution when it comes to smoked beer. Im excided. It pours dark brown with a nice beighe head. The aroma has smoke, bacon, roasted malts, some burned wood and a real barbeque feast. Nice. Taste reveals more smoke and some discrete sweetness, the beer is actually quite dry. Finish has subtile bitterness that bites more and more for each sip. Still, the smoke is what this beer is about, and it is really nice balanced into the brew. Body is medium to full with a nice pricky carbonation.
Tastes like Pale Horse Winter Seasonal. It has smoky bacon and fire roasted flavor. Considered a classic example in its category.
Courtesy of Nate at Ho1kB.  Dark chocolate, white head.  Smells of bacon and PA BBQ.  Tastes of sweet bacon, but not over the top.  Wow.

Ruby tinted dark brown, tan head. Nose is very smoky, malty. Taste has more malt and intense smoke, with salty, slightly cheesy notes. Bitter, slightly dry finish with yet more smoke. Thin to medium body. Nice.
The taste and depth of flavour didnt live up to the smell and aroma. Overall I was left feeling a bit disappointed.

From beerlicious iphone app:
Smoky Burnt aroma
Red/brown cloudy color with minimal tan head
Light sourness to start with a short light bitterness of a finish
Body is oily and cream with avg carbonation and a long mouthfeel
Awesome beer

Dark red/black, large beige head.
Strong aroma, smokey bacon/salmon.
Medium carbonation/palate.
Dont enjoy the flavour, intense smokiness.
Very strange and unique.

Drank this out of the barrel at the Schlenkerla restaurant (also had one from the tap at a nearby spot).  My first experience with Rauchbier and I had no idea of whether Id like it since Ive hear how polarizing they can be.  Well...I really loved it and am so happy to find something truly different within the somewhat restrictive brewing laws of Germany...

Poured dark with a hint of amber look and a very small head.  Naturally, the smoky smell is strong, but then one tastes it and it is decidedly lighter in body than I expected.  The smokiness is fantastic and while it is certainly noticeable, it is not overwhelming as some might say and it absolutely rocks with something like a pork knuckle.  The aftertaste is wonderful with the looming smokiness, but it never really feels like you just ate a big smoked salmon or a smoky cheese.  To me, the smokiness works well...worth the hype and worth trying.  #1 for me in Germany so far...

One of my friends bought this at Los Manantiales Liquor Store for his birthday ,well its kind of difficult to me to review this because its quite an unusual taste and aroma;Bacon/Pork notes...yes you read that right.And quite complicated aftertaste so full of notes that a low temperature are hard to identify.However this beer its a unique recipe and so a different experience for beer,although not my thing

Bottle. Poured a dark brown color with a tiny brown head. Aroma was ham, roasted peanuts, bacon and malts. Flavor was woody, roasted, ham and finished with hints of caramel. Not a big fan of the style, still an ok beer.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, almost black, almost opaque, some foam. Meaty, dominant smokey aroma. Bitter, smoke and wood take over the mouth. Smokey finish, light body but finishing my share of the bottle is always a challange. I love it.
Great smokey flavour and taste! Its like drinking a smoked sausage! A must-try!

Cerveza excelente manteniendo los aromas ahumados del tueste de la malta. No a todo el mundo le gustara esta cerveza por su fuerte nota a humo (parece que se este comiendo un embutido o salmon ahumado a la vez que se bebe la cerveza) pero esta muy bien acabada
A personal favorite with great smokey flavor.  Love everything about this beer.  If you dont like smokey flavor stay away but if youre like me and enjoy the taste of smokey bacon, enjoy!

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2013 Best smoked beer ever...
Dark color. Aromas of smokiness, bacon and smoked meat.
Taste the same.
By far the best smoked beer i ever had.



Draught @ chez moeder lambic.
Once again, I do confirm it, ITS the best smoked beer ever. Even at draught. Super fresh and smokey.

Pours dark brown-gold with lasting offwhite head. Strong smokehouse aroma. Surprisingly sweet malty taste, together with the aroma it gives the vague impression of glazed bacon.  Medium body, soft carbonation. A really unique, strong flavored beer.

Didnt really enjoy this as much as I thought I would. The smokiness was just too overwhelming for me. It was heavily evident in the aroma and taste. Pour was dark amber with a huge brown head that dissipated rapidly. Body was surprisingly light with a lively but clean finish.

Bottle...  Poured a dark reddish/burgundy with a white head. The head dissipated to a lacey presence on the surface. Nose smokey malts, campfire, bacon, smoked pork.  A decent amount of carbonation, mild mouthfeel and texture. Some malt sweetness, low yeast characters. Dominant notes of smoke, ash, toasted and smoked grains and vegetables, smokey meats. Clean finish with a residual smoke flavor. Pretty solid.

500ml bottle. The darkest shade of amber with a short head. Wonderfully smokey aroma. I cant fault the taste or the moutfeel too much, but despite still laying on the smoke it doesnt quite grab me as much as the aroma did. I will definitely be back for more smoked beers though.

Deep red pour, off-white head vanished quickly. Aroma of smoke, honey, caramel, bread crust. Medium body, medium carbonation. Very nice  crisp clean bitterness in the aftertaste, with smoke and vanilla.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2016 Rerate August 20th 2016: Had it many times now and it takes a little getting used to, but once you do it is quite nice. -- Original rating: 50cl bottle @ De Paas, The Hague. Clear dark brown-ruby red color, decent sized off-white head. Smell bacon and smoke. Taste is a decent balance of malts and smoke. Suitable carbo, low to medium body. 4-4-6-3-12.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 Colore ramato, schiuma ben presente ma non troppo persistente. Aroma maltato non troppo invadente. 
Dapprima, al palato, scivola via che è un piacere, con un corpo forse leggermente watery poi arrivano le classiche note dellaffumicato, legno, frutta sotto spirito, carbone. Molto + "facile" da bere delle aspettative. 
-------- dalla botte a caduta, grande fragranza e freschezza, scorre che è un piacere, nota affumicata ancora più presente e caratterizzante anche se non sovrasta gli altri aromi della birra.

0,5 l. bottle. Clear, dark brown colour with a deep red hue. Small, off-white head, that faded fast. Powerful smoked aroma with coffee, bitter chocolate, leather and burnt wood.  Smoke in the water! Medium body with an oily to slick texture, soft carbonation. Long finish with lots of smoke, bacon and wood. Excellent beer if you´re into the smoked stuff.

Pours dark colour with a nice head. Intense smokey aroma. Surprisingly very refreshing despite what you might think from its appearance. Undoubtably the BEST smoked beer out there. But this is a definite love it or hate it! I LOVE it MMMMMMMMMMM SMOKEEEEEEYY.

16.9 fl oz bottle, shared with my sister. Nice smooth khaki head, leaving some lace... Clear copper-brown color. Pronounced, but smooth carbonation, dry texture. Awesome campfire aroma, just like the doppelbock, just more drinkable this time around. Something sweet in the taste, but its subtle, and works well with the smoke. Another satisfying smoke beer... [My sister seemed to think it was too carbonated... I thought it was moderate, but smooth enough]
coffee, chocolate, herbs, basement aromas, skunky, smoke, woody, brown, sparkling, rocky head, brown foam, light sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, salty,

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ itself, Bamberg 07/2011. Dark brown clear hazy with big frothy head. Aromas smoke, roasted malts, toast, grains. Texture is medium to full bodied with lively carbonation and smooth mouth feel. After taste is sweets malts, with nice bitter hoppiness to the medium finish. It is  a great beer and style.

Quite interesting.  The aroma is full of malt with an underlying fire side smokiness.  The beer is a beautiful dark brown, but the head is thin and fading.  The taste is great smooth malts, mild bitterness, and a refined smoke. The body is medium thin with a smoothness. Good with barbeque.

Hehe :) I dont know what you guys are talking about. This beer is just plain disgusting, I hesitate to call it "beer" anyway. Any sign of a carefully brewed Märzen is completely hidden underneath the muffled, overwhelming taste of  WTF  smoke! Nothing against a beer along some smoked ham or goose breast, but for me the bouquets should complement each other, not try to imitate them. To each his own...
Nice smoke aroma of smoked fish and bacon. Full body and a malty undertone. A real classic.

500 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on January 6. Pours chestnut brown with a big fizzy brownish white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some nice lacing on the glass. Smell is malty sweet with sundried sweet fruits, wood, peat and lots of smoke. Taste is rather sweet with lots of smoke, some metal, peat and wood. Finish is slightly sweet and smokey.

Eccellente birra scura quasi nera, dallintenso aroma affumicato, con note di castagne del prete. Il gusto conferma laroma. La schiuma tende a scomparire quasi subito.
Conclusione, una buona birra da accompagnare ad abbondanti piatti, magari un bel piatto di cavatelli fatti in casa con funghi e salsiccia.

Deep rose wood colour with a large frothy white head. Medium to lively carbonation. Great looking beer. Cherry, caramel and smoked aroma. Strong smoked flavour with malt and caramel. Smooth texture with a tangy smoked finish.

50cl bottle. Plours brown with big light brown head. Smells smoked meat. Tastes smoked and abit bitter with a similar finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Già dallodore si sente il gusto intenso e deciso tipico di una smoked. Birra dal sapore forte che ben si presta a sorsi lenti e discontinui. Può stufare se bevuta in media quantità. Di sicuro una birra difficile da dimenticare.
Birra davvero molto particolare, si presenta con una schiuma non molto compatta e poco persistente, ma con unaroma e un sapore stupefacente, laffumicato si fa sentire !

My second beer of Christmas 2011.  The smoke beer is unique.  The smoke flavor is like drinking burnt bacon.   The smoke flavor is like burnt wood in the glass.  The mahogany color and tan head is very inviting.  I can see where this style of beer could grow on you.  I like the half liter bottle.  This would be a tavern worth visiting in Bamberg, Bavaria.  The medium body lager had modest carbonation.  Finish was smooth no bitterness but a hint of burnt wood.

Ce nest pas mon genre, mais cest une expérience.  Odeur fumée franche viandée.  Jai beau imaginer un malt fumé au bois de chêne, cest une viande fumée qui arrive à mes narines.  Cest une lager.  Donc, elle se boit facilement et est subtile.  Au goût, le fumé moins intense.  Une chance que cest une lager car plus ronde que ça, je naurais pas terminé.  Question de goût.

Drank on tap at the Schlenkera tavern in Bamberg several times. This is a big huge beer its reddish brown with a lovely head that lasts. Its nose is incredible, its shows smoke obviously with loads of malt backbone and smooth moorish character...Bottles of this beer are ok but nothing beats a pint poured directly from the wood through a tap into your glass.  Its big...its out there, its confronting but its fresh and its real and ready to drink!

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2014 Bière dune belle couleur brune limpide aux reflets rougeâtres. Odeur très forte de fumée. Goût tout aussi fort de fumée, laissant peu de place à autre chose. Ça me rappelle le hareng fumé, le bacon, ce qui nest pas mauvais en soi, sauf que dans une bière...Cest meilleur au fil des gorgées. Les bières de ce genre ne me plaisent pas vraiment, même si je perçois le travail derrière celle-ci.
(109-141111) ( 5/4/5/3/11-2,8) Mise à jour ----  Donnons une autre chance à cette boucaneuse. Elle est toujours aussi belle cetee brune limpide coiffée dune superbe mousse qui reste en place. Lorsquelle se résorbe, elle se colle au verre pour y laisser une belle écume. Cest toujours aussi fumé et ça sent le poisson fumé autours dherbes salines. Quelque chose de fruité réussi péniblement à transpercer ce gros bacon épicé. Cest toujours surprenant une bière qui sent fortement, semble mince en bouche. Jai limpression de boire de leau de la Gaspésie, sans vouloir lancer dinsulte. Ça goûte le poisson. Pas plus impressionné (M.A. 02-2015) (130714)
So... this beer is pretty one dimensional. Smoke, smoke, and more smoke.  Definitely, it remindsme of bacon.  No hop aroma or flavour,no subtlety, all smoke and bacon.
5.1% very dark smoked beer, smoked beach wood aroma and taste, must be an acquired taste.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2015 04/16/15: Marking this up. Great balance. Well executed. A classic. 4.0
	
12/04/11 Bottle. Dark color, with a frothy, light brown rocky head that dissipates by the time the beer if half consumed. The aroma initially a bit sweet, then youre hit with strong smoke, bacon,  bbq flavors. Theres a bit of balsamic vinegar  on the nose too. The taste is suprisingly dry and clean. Moderately sweet. The mouthfeels medium, a bit watery, easy. The carbonations light. This beers OK, interesting. One for when youre feeling a bit curious. 3.4

Almost red colour and frothy.
Hickory, bacon, camp fire. 
tastes hickory amd liquid smoke.
Bottle. Small pour. Light yellowish golden color with a foamy white head. Aroma is super smoky! Lots of wood, beef and campfire notes. Flavor is woody and smoky with a definite beef jerky flavor.

Bière fumée de 5.1 % dalcool. Elle est une bière brune, avec un odorat très fumé. Long, mais beau col au versement, goût très, comme si on mâchait un aliment fumé, style du buf. Peut-être un peu trop ? Elle possède également un arrière-goût métallique.

Half litre bottle. Dark mahogany colour, clear round the edges. Medium tanned head. Strong smoked meat smell. Taste dominated by smoke, some hints of malt. Medium mouthfull. Overall ok but probably not for everybody.

50cl bottle. Dark brown with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma is smoky and toasty malts. Flavour is also smoky but less than its aroma, smoked salmon and ham, burnt wood. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with a medium-sized off-white head.  Aroma is, well, gobs of smoke.  Smells like a campfire and charcoal.  Flavor is smoke, bacon, cheese, phenol.  Lurking under there is some malt, but the smoke tends to obliterate everything else.  Thick mouthfeel.  Ive had this a few times, and every time Im surprised by just how smoky it is.  I like it ... for a few sips, then it just becomes too much.

One of my favorite beers, but perhaps more for nostalgic reasons. It poured from the bottle much darker than I remember it being on draught; a very dark brown. The aroma is a strong warning of whats to come, to let you know before you take a sip, "if you dont like what you smell, find another beer." I have always described the taste as smoked ham or smoked gouda to those trying it for the first time, looking for a description that compares to something theyre familiar with. This is one of those beers that I have seen many different people love and hate. In my opinion, its a great beer that gets the "smoke" flavor just right, but you really wont know if you like it until you try it.

Sörspecialista, Budapest. Gyönyörű áttetsző, sötét vörösesbarna színe van, valamint laza és kissé krémes bézs habja. Illata nem is annyira füstös, mint vártam, gyümölcsös maláta, kávé, és sózott, jellegzetes fával füstölt hús. Ízében is finom gyümölcsös, malátás ízek húzódnak a kellemes füstöltség mellett. Kicsit olajos teste van, lágyan szénsavas és sós érzetűen száraz. Nagyon ízlett, és akárcsak a búzasörük, ez is jóval kevésbé erőteljesen füstölt, mint az Urbock. Könnyen iható és különleges, de szerintem a búzasörük egy jobban megkomponált darab.
Pours a mahogany color with a cream-colored head.  Aroma of bonfire smoke. Heavy smoke flavor with a sweet malt flavor underneath.  Very good beer.

Bottle 500ml. Pours dark brown/black with a thin frothy head. Almost looks like a cola. But fortunately not the aroma as the smoke hits ne nose immediately when you open the bottle and precedes everything else. Besides the some caramel, and burnt malts. Medium palate and leaves a slight sweet taste in the mouth. Not Bad..

I open this beer with trepidation. Ive heard many things and I have to admit to being a little scared. The beer pours a dark brown color with a tiny head and no lacing, Aroma is campfire smoke, bacon, and bandaids, Good God, what a weird style. Its been heavily smoked and tastes like a mixture of wood, charcoal, smoked salmon, and underneath it all theres a brown ale. This is really weird and Im not sure if I like it but it would be fun to have on a camping trip.

Bottle from Beers of Europe
Dark chestnut brown, rocky off-white head, good lacing 
Aroma - Huge smokiness - smoky kippers, grilled bacon, smoky wood, bonfire, phenolic - this dissipates after a while leaving some malts, no hops 
Taste - Smoky - but much less than the aroma,  smoked wood, dark malts, barbecue,  some light bitter hops - surprisingly  uncomplex. 
Palate - soft carb, thin body. Finish quite dry, smoke, some charred wood with lingering smokiness 
I was a bit disappointed with this, seems to be a plain malty beer with lots of smoke. Probably better accompanied with certain foods rather than drinking on its own. I want the smokiness in a more complex beer. Seems over-hyped to me.

re visited this beer after having first tried it many years ago.  Not nearly as smokey as I remember.  Overally relatively easy drinking, medium body and carbonation.  Smoke is predominant on the nose and taste but is not overwhelming.  Good beer

Dark ruby amber, light head, good lace.  Watery caramel malt start, followed by strong finish of smoked sausage.  Good if you like smoke; for me, I drink the beer to clean the smokey sausage off the palate, not to add more.

Bottle - Clear cola color with a foamy tan head. Aroma is...holy balls...cherrywood smoked bacon, charred wood, and dark malt. Oh man...this is lovely, and has none of the sticky sweetness Ive smelled in other smoked beers. The taste is roughly the same, but with the smoke dialed back a bit, the sweet, bready malt coming through, a bit of wood, and a touch of peppery heat on the finish. Theres a fair amount of metal in there too, which is disappointing. Pretty thin bodied, but with creamy carbonation that fluffs it up a bit. Awesome beer, but the metal really detracts.
Bottle. Very dark colour, almost black. Minimal head. Strong and interesting aroma of turfs and sweet smoke cheese. Smoky taste stays quite long in mouth. Nice special beer.

500ml bottle. Pours a deep mahogany brown with a big tan head that leaves a nice lace down the glass. Smoky bacon dominates the nose in a big way with some smoked salmon on the edge. Theres also a detectable maltiness buried in the smoke. Almost identical on the palate but the finish has a weird little oiliness to it.
From bottle at LCBO.  Pours clear and dark with foamy cream coloured head.  Very strong aroma of smoke - reminds me of a campfire.  To the doubters: it is very appealing.

Dark brown and clear with a big creamy stable head. Smells like smoked meat, with malty notes hiding behind that and a floral hint behind that. Sounds unappetizing, but is really quite a nice smell, and doesnt smell like any beer Ive encountered before.  Taste of smoke doesnt hit you at first, but then it develops on your tongue and just keeps going. You smell it inside your mouth as much as taste it. Odd sensation, but nice. 
Aside for the smoke, this feels like a fairly dry stout, and after the initial palate it settles into  being just sort of an oddly flavored stout. I think that with the right food this would be a phenomenal beer, but it definitely needs that to be complete, as on its own it feels like theres a bit missing.

Bottle. Light brown with a slight mahogany hue and a biege head. Smoke, cured and smoked canadian bacon including a bit of maple syrup (or caramel), slightly roasted malts - very well balanced, not overwhelming. Average carbonation, little thin, starts with a hint of sweetness, becomes bitter, smoke is still there and continues through the finish. Smoked beers arent my thing but this is decent. Pairs well with baked beans or anything off the BBQ that is slow cooked - especially pulled pork.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours clear light brown with one and half inch head that dies down quickly.  Some lacing, medium/light body, and light/medium carbonation.  Taste is roasted malt, some smoke, a little oak and a hint of meat.  I like the weizen better.
Wow, first smoked beer Ive had and its definitely an interesting style.  No doubt about the smoked taste - was wondering how it would come together but it ended good.

I havent had this beer since I first started getting into craft beer and I hated it then. Since my tastes have evolved, its time to give it another shot.

Pours a beautiful dark ruby with a healthy 1.5 inch head.

Smells of beef jerky, bacon and campfire. Wonderful aroma

It tastes extremely smoky but not in a bad way. Almost like drinking beef jerky. There is very little in the way of hops and just a small bit of malt on the back end. Smoke is the dominant flavor. A wonderful beer.

I am really glad I decided to try this again. Now I am wanting to try more rauchbiers and wish more were available.
Bottle, pours brown/black with small off white head. Aroma is roasty, smoke, barbeque, hot dogs,  leather. Medium body. Smoke beers maybe isnt my bag but ok
En botella.Cerveza oscura con buena espuma,Aroma a malta ahumada y tostada,En boca es pura barbacoa,muy buena con un sabor agradable y delicado a lúpulo.Muy buena Rauchbier

This one came in a 500ml bottle from the Summerhill LCBO. Pours blackish brown with a bubbly beige head. wonderful smoke aroma. Taste is smoky, barbecue sauce and earthy malts. flavour coats the tongue. medium-heavy body. Excellent brew. Would love to try this at the brewery straight form the cask.

Bottle. Pours with a clear bronze body with a minimal off-white head. Aromas are malty, melanoidins, caramel, earthy, leather, light smoke, wood, beef jerky, bacon and caramelized ham. Flavors are quite smokey, earthy, leather, pepper, melanoidins, caramelization and lightly floral. Meaty. Smokey. I love bbq, bacon, beef jerky...just not in my beer (I dont really like smoke beers, but I try to be fair). A bit thin. Medium to lively bubbles. One of the better Schlenkerla beers in my opinion.

Vilket härligt öl detta var. Vackert med ett stor och långvarigt skum. Våt hästsadel och makrillrökeri i doften. Smaken är stor och finns länge kvar: tjära, läder och grovt bröd. Och naturligtvis rök.

This beer is amazing.  Beautiful smoky bacon-y notes that are always present but never overwhelming.  Very well balanced.  Fantastic malt and clean lager profile that perfectly complements the smoked beechwood.  I cant imagine a more thoroughly pleasant example of a smoked marzen.

Video review at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CvI-00Y2RxA

Appearance: Deep red-copper transparent, 3-finger khaki head sticks around, excellent lacing

Smell: Spicy smoked bacon, charred wood, beef jerky

Taste: Medium body, sweet campfire smokiness, prosciutto, maple syrup sweetness, light toasted oats + caramel, hop bitterness balances finish, salty peanut afterthought, medium carbonation, drinkable

Pairings: Sharp cheddar, prosciutto, barbecue, smoked meat

Dark brown colour, thin cream head. Aroma of smoke, roasted malts, caramel, some wood(like) tones. Very composed. Flavour sweetish, almost salty. Malts, roasted background. Good beer.
I remember drinking this beer years ago and thinking how close the taste came to licking an ash tray. Funny to notice how my taste buds have evolved - or the beer recipe changed, but this being traditional Germans, Im assuming its my taste that has changed.
(Draught from cask @ brewpub in Bamberg)

UPDATED: APR 23, 2012 this was poured into a big stein. Pours a rich and dark orange color with a nice and smaller head.

really good and complex nose of smoke, malts, oranges and some bits of caramel as well.

rich but smooth medium/full feel with deep tones. Shows off more of a malty side, though the smoke is very much there as well.

This was perfect for an afternoon of grilling. The smoke added another level of complexity to the beer along with the good depth and complexity to begin with. This was a really good beer that was very easy to drink.

Clear dark brown, nice fluffy head.  Caramel roast and smokey nose.  Flavor is definitely unique,smokey, roasty but with a caramel backbone.  Smoke lingers beyond the sweet malt.  Palate is full.   This is a unique style and should be appreciated when paired with food.

Fles 50 cl. 
Kleur: Bruin/koper
Schuimkraag is gebroken wit en verdwijnt snel.
Geur: Rokerig en hout.
Smaak: Rook, vooral de nasmaak is intens.
Weinig koolzuur.

Een erg bijzonder bier. Zeker niet mijn favoriet, maar apart is het wel.

full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, roasty, earthy, very string smoke taste and aroma, salty. Overall a very, very good beer from the heart of Franconia in Bavaria in Germany. THE beer area of all beer places.

Bottle.
A buddy brought this back for me on a recent trip to Germany and Im glad he did.  Deep copper pour with a good amount of head that didnt last for long.  Nice smoky aroma with some caramel malt and a bit of wood.  Flavor is a great balance of smoke and sweet malt.
Brown-black color, with a creamy head. Aroma has lots of smoke, heavy! Full taste of smoked malts. Powerful body.

@ heller-brau;just could not stop drinking this and that liquid bbq taste goes perfectly with pork dishes.
surprised how sessionable this bier is as i stayed until closing most nights on my recent trip to bamberg.when previously had this in the bottle,one always seemed enough.

Close your eyes and feast on this ham sandwich...now slowly...slowly...open your eyes.  Ah HA, its bier!  Rauchbier satisfies all your consumption needs at once.  Its a meal in a bottle, a delicious sensory experience.  Its about the same as eating a ham sandwich in an old smokey castle hearth with a smooth beverage en route to your gullet.

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is dark mahogeny color with medium, beige head.  Aroma is dominated by the woodsmoke flavors including smoked meat and woodchips with some roasted malts coming through.  Taste is heavy on the smoked flavors at the outset - heavy on bacon and smoky taste.  As you continue on though, the other flavors in the beer come out including some very nice roasted grains and caramel.  Palate is medium-bodied, thick texture, average carbonation, and a rich, savory finish.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2013 0.5l bottle from a supermarket in Bamberg. Deep mahogany with a thin white head, aromas of woodsmoke and candy sugar plus hints of smoked ham, roast malt and woodsmoke on the palate with a little caramel and a dry bitter edge. A little one dimensional. Re-rate in the brewery tap,  fresher and maltier, with the smoke balanced by a faint sweetness.

Pours copper/brown with a thin white head. Big meaty salty smokey nose. The flavor is full and smokey, lots of salty meat, barbecue, and some light underlying caramel sweetness. Really nice smoke initially followed by a light and refreshing crisp finish. A very enjoyable beer and tops the category from the 5 or so Ive had to date. I wish it was widely available in my neck of the woods.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2012 Bottle @ home. This beer really opened my eyes to what was possible with beer. Prior to having this beer for the first time in Bamberg four years ago, I couldnt stand smoked beers. This beer changed all that. Dark maroon brown appearance with a light tan head. Very nice, sweet charred wood, bacon, bbq, woody smoke, dark caramel malty aroma. Tasty, somewhat rich, caramel malty, slightly nutty, charred, smoky wood flavor with a moderate bbq smoke aftertaste. Very easy drinking. An absolute classic. Update: Tried on tap at the brewery and "fuck yeah."
Amazing taste , appearance  and aroma of smoked wood. The impression it leaves on your palate is extrordanairy and unique. My first taste of smoked malt beer but certainly not my last

Malty aroma has a fruity and floral overtone and a hint of hickory smoke. It pours a dark, barely translucent brown with a thick, velvety, yellowish tan head that looks a lot like the head on a property poured crater of Guinness. Flavor has malty, fruity, and hickory smoke tones - whoa, is that BACON I taste? There is also just a hint of caramel. Body is a bit lacking, but texture is still fairly fizzy and leaves a tasty finish.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into dimpled mug.

Appearance: Very dark mahogany-brown with frothy grayish-tan head.

Aroma: Smoke, ash and grilled meat. Interesting.

Taste: Very, very smoky with char-grilled meat, burnt toast, molasses and some semi-sweet fruitiness.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, lighter body than expected (but fits the beer), very smooth.

Overall: Strangely alluring. Wasnt completely sure about this beer for the first half, but then I just wanted more and more.

Draught at Bishops Mollbergs, Helsingborg. June 2011.

Pours clear brown, with a creamy white foam. Heavy and thick aromas of smoke, malt, charcuterie.. a lot like smoked sausages and ham. Not as delicate as other smoked beer but its still good. The taste isnt as smoky, instead  its very malty with notes of toasted bread. Light sweetness. No trouble drinking a pint of this!

50 cl bottle @ Ämmälänkylä, BBE 24.11.2011. Rated on 27.08.2011
Aroma is very smoky with tar, sweetish malt and some smoked fish. Fresh flavour has loads of smoke too with tar. Good and fresh, Schlenkerla at its best.
Bottle thanks to djd07. Light brown with no head.  Super smoky nose-bacon and charcoal. Taste is camp fire and has a very light body. Quafable.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Bottle thanks to Dblock at August tasting. Pours a clear amber with small off white head that quickly diinishes. The aroma is liquid smoke and pepper jerky. Thin mouthfeel with a pepper and liquid smoke flavor. Very good, really enjoyed this one.

Mycket vatten har runnit under många broar sedan jag betygsatta denna öl. Dags igen. Orginalet, urrauchölet som alla mäter sig mot. Förr tyckte jag att den var för mycket, men efter många ölupplevelser tycker jag nu att den är ganska snäll. Den lätt bisarra medvurstkaraktären som märks så fort kapsylen kommit av. Men det finns också en riktigt fin rund och mjuk maltbas, ja jag slås av hur rund smakbilden är. Riktigt fin och värd att fortsätta sträva mot. Fortfarande ingen favoritöltyp för mig.

Pint bottle.  Pours amber with medium white head, laces.  Aroma is dominated by smoke, but I also get a little bready malt.  The taste is slightly sweet with the smoke contribution blending in nicely and the marzen bitter finish is still there.  You kind of want a little "heavier" palate to go with the strong smoky taste, but that is only draw back I find.  Good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2012 Deep dark toffee hue. Big, pillowy, tan colored head. The head collapses a bit at first but stays strong at about a finger deep. Lacing left behind galore. Smoky and ham aromas abound. Malt, roasted malt, and a tea scent. Sweet and smoky. Roasted notes along with the bacon in my mouth. Sweet aftertaste, a slight tinge of metallic-ness. A very, very nice beer.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2011 Bottle at Brauhaus, Edinburgh. Dark brown, small white head. A very strong smokey oak aroma. Could be overpowering for some drinkers.  A strong smokey palate, with a hint of leather (!!!). A sweet beer.
This drink would go well with cheese. Probably, avoiding smoked cheeses, as this would be over-powering.
A really nice beer if you are a Stout and Porter fan.

Bière limpide de couleur dambre profond, presque de noyer et coiffée dun  fin col chamoix.  Des arômes intensément fumés et légèrement caramélisés.  Moyennement amère avec une trace minérale.  Plutôt légère, effervescence moyenne, elle laisse une longue trace arômatique.

It poured a brown color with a white head. The aroma was of bacon, smoke and paprika. The flavor was of jerky, pork and apples. Very smooth and easy on the palate. Definitely an acquired taste thats great once you get used to it

Smoke, like in bacon, dominates aroma and taste. Hop bitterness takes over in finish. IMO, smoke works better in a stronger tasting beer like a porter or  stout. with flavors that can stand competition.

On tap at the brewery. Almost black color with medium beige head. Aroma of wood, bacon, caramel.Taste is not so strong in smoke as I thought, smoked bacon is in background, malt and caramel are in foreground. Nice smoky bitter finish. Excellent.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Moeder Lambic: dark amber with an off-white head, strong leather smell mixed with smoke, hints of the crust of smoked bacon, taste is slightly bitter with lots of smoked  almost burned malt, campfire remnants, pure smoke & hints of ash in the aftertaste, decent amount of burned wood, some leather, a bit too close in taste to the Fastenbeer but with way less bacon taste, prefer Fastenbeer but this is great as well /// Been drinking this one again on draft @ CML. This is a true classic. Increased the score from 4.5 to 4.7. // I just cannot stop drinking this. 4.7 to 4.8 for now.
Pours very dark brown with a beautiful pale head. Aroma is smoke and bacon. Very light body, bacon-like aftertaste.

smoky and malty perhaps somewhat overpowering. strong ashiness to my bottle. meaty pork shoulder, leather, pepper and earwax it hops out from time to time. some floral discinfectant in caramel that is not evident.... you gotta be in the mood for this one, but you wont be bored.  not for hot summer days. nice deep wine hues.
Malty smokey aroma, not too much smoke though. Dark red colour. Not much foam. Taste is quite bitter and oaky. Long finish!
Dark brown color with small beige head. Smokey aroma - like a soft camp fire. Taste is sweet malty and very soft and smoky, leading to a smoky, dry medium bitter finish. One of a kind.
UPDATED: JUL 29, 2011 Tap@ Schlenkerla. Dark brown. Nice head and body. Good carbonation.  Strong smoked malty oak. Some bitterness. Long pleasant dry finish. Top rauch brew.
This is one of the absolute benchmarks of smoked beer, second only to its own Urbock version and Prykmestar SavuKataja.

0.5l bottle @ Amundsen Bryggeri & Spiseri, Oslo. Finally get to try this beer. Pours a deep deep ruby red body with a massive light fluffy beige head. Aroma is really ashy and smoky with notes of beef-stock, pepper corns and more campfire-smoke. Nice! Average to soft carbonation, medium-bodied and has a light oily to watery mouthfeeling. Tastes just as smoky and beefy as the aroma. Lots of earthy campfire-burned flavors in the finish and aftertaste. One helluva smoked beer, and I quite enjoyed it!

Bronze body with a long lasting tan foamy head. Campfire steam. Am I smelling a beer or bacon?  Taste full of smoke, sweet bitterness at end. Very earthy and roasty sensation. Remembers me of, now discontinued, Calumet Grand Chef. Very good if you like this kind of beer. The reference for Rauch.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2012 Magnifique couleur rouge feu avec beaucoup deffervescence. En arôme, derrière lagressivité de la fumée, on sent le malt. Au goût cest assez complexe pour le style. On a bien sûr la façade emboucanée mais le caramel sucré et le caractère fortement malté mimpressionne. La légère amertume au fini accompagne bien le boisé.
Bottle in Brussels. Dark amber brown with big head. Nose of smoke and cheese. Taste is malty, roasted and cheese-like. Nice and thick texture. Goes down well.

Bottle at home. Dark copper pour with striking red highlights. Big cream head. Brilliant smoky nose - bacon, charcoal, oak. Taste is slightly sweet, with a nice roast finish. Very well balanced, a bit of a classic.

Bottle. Brown pour with a nice head. Aroma full of bacon, mesquite and briny cured ham- very aggressive smoke characteristics. Flavor is much more balanced and drinkable, still with that great smoke presence. Better and more refined than the Urbock.

Appearance: medium amber with a short, fizzy off-white head and spotty lacing.   Aroma: surprisingly restrained smoke, with gentle notes of roasting meat and toasted light brown bread.   Taste: smoky and a little sweet, with hits of salt pork, blue diamond smokehouse almonds, a little brown sugar, and toasted grains.   Finish: short, clean and a little crisp.   Notes: A more restrained smokebeer than their Urbock, which was a little overpowering.  This is extremely quaffable, and is the perfect complement to a nice rack of BBQ ribs from Rocklands.
An oaky and rich beer with mid-brown hue and plenty of smoke in the taste. Long finish and very moreish. Medium bodied with good carbonation and a good-sized head.

Colour of dark red to dark brown, thick creamy foam. Intense aroma smokey aroma that reminded me of smoked cheese. Tastes a bit sweet and bitter, leaves a woody feeling. Medium to low carbonation and a medium body. Tastefull and enjoyable beer that should work well with fat cheeses and smoked ham.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2012 Re-rate : Tap @ Schlenkerla, Bamberg. Pours hazy dark brown with a white head. Aroma of hard roasted malts, campfire smoke, smoked bacon, nuts. Flavor of roasted malts smoke, bacon, nutty, burnt caramel, notes of dark fruits. Medium body, soft carbonation, super easy drinkabilty. Smoother and fresher from tap. 8-3-8-4-16. 090812

Bottle @ Home. Pours deep amber with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt ,smoke, nuts, smoked beacon. Taste is roasted malt, smoke, nuts,wood, barbecue soyce. Medium body, light soft carbonation7-3-7-3-14. 040711
Poured a dark brrown with thick beige head had aromas of nuts, malt and smoke. Tasted like a liquid sasuge.  Im not a fan of this smoked added extra this brewery has, but still better than a macro.

This beer is quite nice.  Nutty scent, good solid flavor across the tongue.  You get the smoke, but it doesnt beat you up.  You can get other flavors, and theyre all quite nice.  Good nut, a little sweet, a little tiny bitter.  People call these "bacon beers," which is sort of a funny idea, but this beer is... dare I say it... savory.  Theres almost a small, lovely "au jus" to this beer.  Color is a deep brown and red.  Finish is grainy, and only slight hint of alcohol and bitter.  Smooth, sort of silky.  Good stuff.

Bottle at home. Pours a nice, clear dark amber colour with a thick light tan head that dies away fairly quickly. The aroma is dominated by rauchmalt, smoky pea and ham soup sensation. Also tastes like smoked meat broth with a nice amount of bitterness and some bitter chocolate in there. Good level of carbonation. A meal in a glass, I like it although I prefer the Weizen and you have to be in the mood for these beers.

Pours a dark caramel with a tan head.  Aroma of smoked wild game.  Tastes like smoked wild boar with just the right amount of bitterness in the after taste.  This has the right amount of carbonation just enough to tickle the tongue but not overwhelm it.

Im not a huge fan of rauchbier, but there are a few I enjoy. This, however is not one of them. Aroma is just smoke. Nothing more. Smells like a charcoal barbeque towards the end, when everythings been grilled and the coal is about to go out. Taste is smoke and... not much else. I found it boring, to be honest.

Pours dark red with a thin off-white head and no lacing. Aroma is smoked meat.  medium body. Taste is smoke and wood, creating the overall sensation of bacon. Finish is surprisingly fruity with a little bit of spice.
Wonderful taste...it is like I just bit into a piece of tasty charcoal, but in a good way.  I cannot wait to taste the other smoked beers.

On tap at the Nook. Pours a dark brown with amber hues and a thick frothy white head. Great lacing. The aroma is typical rauchbier, with overwhelming notes of wood smoke. Reminds me of smoked meats and campfires. I dont know what wood the malts are smoked over, but it smells and tastes like oak and hickory. The flavor is mellow sweetness and a smoky bitterness. Most of the bitter flavor comes from the blackened malts, and not hops. The palate is medium to heavy, smooth and creamy, and has very little carbonation. Overall, a unique beer. Smoother and mellower than a normal rauchbier, but just as strange.

Had on cask at the Royal in St Louis.  Pours dark amber with a huge off white head. Aroma is smokey with bready malts. Flavor is smokey, malty with hints of biscuit. Medium body with hardly any carbonation.

Aroma is smoky, sausage, bready malts, a touch of sweetness.  Pours a dark amber/brown with about 3/4" off white head, a minute or two of retention before falling to a ring of foam, a bit of lacing.  Flavor is malty, toasty and biscuit, a good hit of smoke in the mid-taste through the finish, some spicy hops and hop bitterness, bit of pepper.  Medium body, average carbonation.

Rauchiger, ziemlich intensiver Antrunk, was gemessen an der Rauchigkeit der stärkste Part ist. Desweiteren mild herb, verhalten bitter. Die Rauchigkeit ist allgegenwärtig, sie ist zwar im Antrunk am stärksten, im Mittelteil aber am vollmundigsten, da die normalen Malznoten hier mit einfließen und eine dezente Hefigkeit vorhanden ist. Zum Ende Bitterer, Die Rauchigkeit schwindet erst, bleibt aber noch länger auf ansprechendem Level vorhanden. Etwas schokoladig. Lecker! 12/12/12/12/13/12

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2011 Very beautiful beer. A dark ruby color with a not so white head. Wonderful smoky aroma with some malts. The flavour is strong with smoke and some "charcuterie". It may be an aquired taste, but I love this and can drink a lot of it in one sitting.
My favourite beer. Tried once @ Frankenconnection in Berlin and suddenly felt in love. Hard smoke aroma ike gerauchtete schweinfleisch (bacon)
Smells like beef jerky and tastes like brisquet wood.  Its a dark brown in color with a thin tan head when poured.  If you like tasting wood youll like this beer.

deep brown, ruby/amberish red colour. pours a minimal white slightly silky head with an easy presence. aroma; smoke, salmon, tobacco, malt, wood, hay, grass, leather, meat, dry fruit. it is easy to be blinded by the smoke and salmon, but the aroma holds so much more behind it. just takes a bit more looking into since the initial aromas are so strong. taste is well balanced with mild sweetness and bitterness. the gentle saltiness finishes the package. surprisingly light body, but still has a mediumish presence. the oily and thick texture make the body feel more full. this is one of the kings of smoke beers. it is very interesting how schlenkerla manages to bring this smokiness into every beer ive tasted from them. very distinguishable but stylish. the smoke salmon side is so well done that its almost like a joke how well this goes with smoke salmon. an extremely well balanced beer that has a strong identity.
Une odeur de bacon qui frappe dès le début, au goût on retrouve quelque peu ce fumée qui annule toute amertume dans la bière

500mL Bottle - Pours dark reddish-brown with a thick rocky light tan head.  Aromas of smoke that are reminiscent of beef jerky and tobacco, wood, raisin, and malt.  The smoke is very smooth on the palate and is in no way overpowering as it is slightly on the nose.  Some mild chocolate come through leading to a balanced finish.

Bottle. Pours a cherry brown with small off white head. Aroma is less meaty than others from the series. Theres definite bacon but less intense with more oakwood and malt. Flavor is a bit distant with oak, cherry malt, and caramel with a slight hop bitterness. Slightly watery, thin body with a nice oak smokiness. I appreciate the less meaty quality in this version.

500mL bottle.  Pours clear dark amber with a small off-white head that settles to a ring.  Smoke dominates the aroma, a bit like smoked meats or smoky sauce.  Not a whole lot else going on but interesting and quite enjoyable on its own.  The flavour is initially malty and slightly sweet, very slightly fruity, followed by some burnt malt and then the meaty smoke takes over.  Light-medium bodied, soft carbonation with a lingering burnt finish.

9/15/2009
Pours a clear dark brown with ruby highlights and a creamy beige head that recedes to a cap but sticks around forever. Smells like a brisket thats been smoking away for 14 hours. Well actually it smells more like the smoke than the brisket. I strain and maybe think I find some caramel or toffee underneath, but the smoke is powerful and hides anything else that is in there. I now understand why some people say smoked smells like bacon. The taste is rich malty and creamy with a heavy hand of smoke. There are some sweet malts in there; caramel, toffee, and maybe some brown sugar in the taste. Lightly carbonated, medium body. I would have to say this must be an acquired taste. I can appreciate it for what it is, but I cant imagine myself enjoying many of these. I think its very well done, but not for me.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2013 [ASPETTO] 			
Schiuma beige, buona presenza, abbastanza compatta non molto persistente. Colore marrone scuro con riflessi ambrati e rossastri			
[OLFATTO]			
intensa, dominata completamente dallaffumicato, con evidenti sentori di brace e legna bruciata che ricordano il classico profumo dello speck. Difficile identificare qualcosa di diverso, anche se impegnadosi un po si puo ritrovare qualche nota  luppolata. Forse un po monotona in tal senso, ma questo è il bello.			
[GUSTO]			
in bocca entra con un affumicato meno intenso di quanto il profumo facesse "temere"; rimane comunque il sapore dominante che accompagna fino alla fine lasciando piccoli spiragli per qualche nota dolciastra, che fa capolino sul finire prima di sfumare in un finale abbastanza secco. 			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo basso, sensazione watery, ben carbonata			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
birra icona del suo genere, ma non per tutti i gusti e limitata nella sua fruibilità: personalmente la vedo perfetta come accompagnamento per cibi affumicati (scamorza, speck o la Cecina spagnola) o carni cotte alla brace, forse anche con i braschè; limportante che ci sia nellaria un odore di camino in una bella atmosfera campestre. Sola, daltra parte, rende la bevuta un po fine a se stessa, penalizzando (ingiustamente) il prodotto.

Nach dem Einschenken macht sich ein Geruch von Räucherschinken und schwelendem Buchenholz bemerkbar. 
Die gleichmäßige Rauchigkeit verleiht dem Geschmack eine bemerkenswerte Stabilität. Fehlplazierte Aromen kommen in diesem Bier nicht vor. Vielmehr zeigt der Verlauf sanfte Eigenschaften ohne grelle Töne, wobei die Herbe des Ausklangs im allgemeinen Raucharoma ein wenig untergeht. Nichtsdesto trotz ein gutes Bier und würdiger Vertreter seiner Sparte.

Bottiglia - Il Santo Bevitore - LT
appena stappata arriva al naso un buon profumo di speck alpino!!!
nera, con un bel riflesso fulvo che si percepisce solo guardandola controluce, in bocca non delude, tutti gli aromi di fumo e di legna bruciata si ripresentano al palato. comunque asciutta in bocca.
ottima da accompagnamento per un pasto.

Yum Bacon Beer! A bottle picked up for a rating since I had this once ages ago and decided to get it on my list. Clear but deep brown color like a root beer with small bubbled. Off white head came up big with my rough pour. The smell just leaps off this beer which kept reminding me of fires on the beaches of Cape Cod at night. Defiantly also some fatty bacon smell in their to (in the best scenes of it of course.) The taste was a little woody with some ham and a touch sweet roasted malt in there. Smokey finish. Cool soft wet palate. Be interested to try this done with a fuller body.

Out of the bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Pours a clear, dark amber color with a thick, creamy off-white head and minimal lacing. Aroma is smokey, like dry wood just starting to crackle and burn on a campfire. Flavor is like smoked meat, burnt oak, pepper, and roasted malts. Although the overlying flavor is the smokey meat. Mouthfeel is light and thin with a nice smokey aftertaste in the finish. Like I just took a bite of smoked ham. Really nice and easy to drink! Not a bad beer at all.
Smells of smoked ham tastes like ham. Only the aftertaste is vaguely reminiscent of beer. Still, one can get used to this specialty. Something different - try anyway.

Bottle thanks to footbalm 
Appearance: Pours clear dark brown with a nice big off-white head and lots of lacing 
Aroma: Burnt wood, campfire smokey 
Taste: At first it seems to have a thin mouthfeel, then the smoke hits the tongue, salty, pepper and oak. Wow! 
Very nice, need to take a few of these camping.
Bottle. Dark amber colour with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of smoke, roasted malt, caramel and spice.

Bottle from liqourama.net.  Pours deep reddish amber/almost black with a thin off white head.  The aromas are Bacon, mesquite smoke, pepper.  The mouthfeel is bitter, smokey and watery with a medium body.  This was a great beer!  Cheers!

Very smoky - like drinking beer on Guy Faukes night. The colour of a typical Bavarian dunkel with an enduring sudsy head. Likeable malty flavour although very little evidence of roast malts in the profile.
From December 2010 tasting notes. Bottle. Brown with small beige head. Smoked ham aroma.  Smokey vegetable flavor. Thin bodied, watery.

Dark brown color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of rich smoked meat, & burnt oak; Flavor of smoky sweet malt, caramel, and some spice; Nicely balanced; Overall, the aroma is awesome - I did enjoy this one.

At Schlenkerla in Bamberg. Poured very dark brown with some red in color and tan head. Aroma very smoky. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Mildly carbonated. Smoked bacon, burnt wood ash and some more smoked bacon in flavour. Smooth overall and a nice rauch-aftertaste. Pleasant burnt wood and smoky aftertaste as well.

500ml bottle from Shaftesbury Wines, Shaftesbury, Dorset.  Strong taste of smoked ham with a background taste of a good sweetish dunkelbier.  Very good but would only drink in small quantities as the smoke taste can be too much.

Pour dark brown beige head solid lacing. Aroma salt, smoke, bacon, maple, malt sweetness. Taste salt, liquid smoke, malt sweetness, caramel, bacon. MF medium body good carb. Overall very good a little sweet but quite balanced and tasty.

50cl bottle. Pours a chestnut colour with a red hue. There is good head at least for a few minutes. The nose is like the rind of smoked cheese. There is more of the same on the taste with a barley finish. The palate has a big structure, a full creamy texture and a reasonably clean finish. Overall, it was still enjoyable throughout and is better balanced than its stable mates which can sometimes be a bit overpowering.

A: The pour is very dark brown in color with an off-white head that dissipates fairly quickly.

S: This is one damn smokey beer.  Intense char, smoke, and burnt wood.  Theres a definite salty and meaty character to the nose.  Sort of sweet underneath with a little bit of toffee.

T: More of the same smoke on the palate.  Intensely smokey with lots of char, salt, and meat flavors.  A bit like campfire.  Luckily there is a bit of sweetness of bread and toffee hiding in the background.

M: Medium in body with a somewhat low level of carbonation.

O: This wasnt as bad as I had remembered it being, but I still wouldnt drink more than a few ounces of it.

500 ml bottle purchased at Royal in Kansas City, Missouri. Pour is a deep brown copper with some ruby and an off white head that falls pretty quick. Aroma is dying campfire, next morning campfire and smoking meat. Very roasty and charred nose. The taste is the big smoke initially, clearing to a roasty malt, grain cracker sweet malt and finishing with the smoked meatiness of the nose. Palate is medium bodied, quite active carbonation and a lingering smooth smoky finish. The smoke is big, but so natural and well integrated that it just works.

Aroma was of light coffee and bacon. Slight nutty nose to it as well. Taste is much more nutty, oak-flavored, nice. Smoke is layered in but not too overbearing. I really liked this, cant wait to try some more of this style.

(50 cl bottle from Die Kleine Bierstube, Århus) Pours a dark reddish black with rich white head. Aroma of bacon and smoke. Taste is mildly sweet and watery. Average carbonation, thin texture, long smoky finish.

dark brown and clear. smells like smoke and sausages; smoke is clean and crisp and softer than the sausage; sausage is like cooked hot dog water. thin body and very fizzy. primarily a sausage flavour, like cold italian (chorizo?) suasage w/ some kind of fresh cut grass in the background. big flavour up front w/ short finish. fizzier than the Urbock.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden. This rating is based on written notes. I love all things smoked, be it meat, sausages, salmon or whatnot, so I really looked forward to this beer. It pours a crystal clear dark red-amber-brown beautiful beer. Nose is immediately smoky, with bacon notes. The first sip affirms that. Moderate malty aroma with some dark bread, grain, burnt malt and above all smoke, wood and bacon! Wow! The flavor also has some fruity maltiness. Tastewise I find it very well balanced, with light sweetness and light to moderate bitterness, and perhaps a slight saltyness, but that might because I think of bacon when drinking this! Medium to full body with soft carbonation and a somewhat oily mouthfeel. Goes very well with some smoked sausage. As this is my first rauchbier, its quite unusual, but I really like it. Theres also a flavor here I can only describe as "old farmhouse", which is something like old smoked wood - I love it! I dont know if Id been able to drink a lot of this though, I need some more rauchbier experience first.

Bottle 500ml @ Amundsen Bryggeri & Spiseri, Oslo
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of smoke, bacon, ham and malt. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

50 cl bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with red highlights when held to a light. Moderate linen-white head that faded to a thick, creamy film and left partial lacing on the glass. The aroma is very nice with a strong but mellow fragrance of smoke along with a bit of earthiness. The flavor was equally pleasant with the smoke taking center stage, but not overpowering and not excessively sharp. There is also some malt flavor that comes through. Surprisingly smooth. Well done.
From a bottle poured an amber color with a fair amount of head.  Light smokey malty flavor with a lingering aftertaste.

It pours a medium brown but when you look at it at an angle or in the light there is definete red tinge. The head is white doesnt rise much or have much retention. The lacing is light to non-existant.

The aroma, like most rauches is very strong with lots of smoke a little sweetness.

The taste is light for a rauch. Its smokey and porky but there are some definite malts there with a little sweetness. The sweetness to some might make it more drinkable but to me its distracting from what I really want, which is hardcore smokiness.
Smells wonderful, like a barbecue. Is best tasted by taking first a sip, swooshing it in your mouth, and then taking a full drink. Very full-bodied with a great flavor.
Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is very smoky - very much like smoked ham. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry finish with a soft carbonation. Very dominated by smoke. 290310
Bottle at Aufsturz Berlin. Reddish brown with s thin head. Smoked bacon, slight metallic notes. Flavour is light smoked with a watery texture. Lovely long lingering palate.
Beatiful nose, smoked meats, ash, wood. Palate is sweet, smoky, ash, ham. Simply amazing beer.

Bottle. A classic up for rating here; Ive had this on many occasions but never gotten around to rate it before. Oh well, my non-beer-rating days are counted, so here we go: Body is deep and coppery, with a small beige head. The aroma is absolutely gorgeous; smoked meat, ash, roasted malts and more smoke. Absolutely "lecker", as they would say in Germany. Taste is a close runner-up, with more caramel and roasty tones than smoked, but still with a lot of smoked meat and peaty notes. Body is easily drinkable and light, perhaps a bit too light compared to the heavy aroma profile in particular. Still: very nice. This is a classic rauch,  and one of my "to-go" beers any day.

Bottle from Brewforia, Meridian, ID.  Clear deep chestnut color with a full and lasting dense yellow-tan head. Salty smokey aroma and of some caramelized fruit, pears and apples maybe.  Rich smokey slightly sweet flavor with a bit of a metallic trailer at the end.  Rich and smooth pallate softly carbonated. Dang close to Bacon in a glass.

Stunning beer. Dark black marzen lager. Smell is of smoked ham. And taste too. But somehow its not weird. Really nicely balanced and not overpowering. Nice mixture of malt and smokey ham on the tongue, wood chips and oily texture in the mouth. This is a beer to get excited about. Presumably great with barbequed meats.
Dark brown, brown head. Aroma is of smoked meat, in addition to coffee. Smooth, easy-drinking, flavour is smoked ham, overall very good and interesting.

I frowned when i hurried and grabbed a beer I hadnt had and the got home with a smoke beer. Ive had a couple and couldnt even finish them...too much smoke BUT...this is fantastic. Just the right amount of smoke. Smells like sweet pulled pork. Has a fantastic mouth feel. Sweet and, like I said, perfect amount of smoke. Finishes with a dry finish but leaves you salivating for some smoked meats.pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Easy to drink. A lot like the Scotty karate scotch ale from Dark Horse. Im gonna have to buy another to drink while eating something complementing.
It was the first smoked beer I ever tasted, and still the best. Overwhelming smoke-aroma and taste, a perfect companion to all smoked pork delicacy.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 How: Draught from a wooden cask.
Where: At the brewpub.
Appearance: Brown colour with a brown head.
Aroma: Smoke, smoked malt, sausages, ham, wood.
Body: Full body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Smoke, burned wood, smoked malt, sausage.
Comment: Had this from bottle, draught and from the wooden cask at the brewery. The wood cask if far superior, smoother, more balanced. The bottle is a bit too unbalanced, rough. Rating is a blend between the bottle and cask. The bottle is slightly lower in score, the cask slightly higher.

Original rating: 3-2-3-2-5
Aroma: smoke. Taste: medium bitterness, light sweetness, strong smokey taste. Overall a beer that didnt suit my taste.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a moderately dark copper color with an off white head. The nose brings smoke, smoke, and smoke. Smoked wood chips and a bit of char; almost meaty. The taste confirms this latter scent, as this really starts to taste like bacon thats been a tad bit overdone. Mouthfeel is nice and smoky with a pleasant finish. Considering what it is, this drinks really well.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-19-2010

Bottle...Deep ruby pour , thin beige head , decent lacing . Aroma is bacon cooking on a campfire. Flavor is deliciously smokey, with a suttle saltiness . Finish is drying but still smokey with a hint of hop bitterness . Its probably an aquired taste , but I think its terrific .

500ml  bottle from west lakeview... Pours a lighter cola caramel brown, semi-transparent, with a light beige head... Aroma is smoked ham with a deep saltiness which seems mire smoky than the others for some reason? Sweeter grain on the backend... Flavors are much of the same with a more pronounced dalti smokiness. Smooth light to medium mouthfeel with a nice drinkability.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2011 tap at schlenkerla.  served from oakwood cask.   Doughy, chalky,  dry bready smoked salmon.   Salty crackers, lox,  salmon dip.    Moderate to heavy  smoke, melded into a doughy salty cracker malt backing. very good.  fresh.  clean.   awesome from the source.

Circa 3/4 of an 0.5 litre bottle poured into a glass. Clear red beer forms a thin white foam on the surface. Aroma: Toasted ham, smoke, peat and wood. Taste: Light sweetness, lightly bitter, minimal sourness, even a bit of salt there as well. Palate: Medium body with an intensive oily texture, combined near average carbonation.Semi-long finish that leaves a great peaty smoke aroma in mouth. Overall: Great smoked beer

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2012 Bottle. Poured a clear medium brown with an average sized (1-2 finger) off-white creamy head that was mostly lasting and had fair lacing. 

The aroma was of a heavy smoked malt, a very light bitter hop and a moldy leathery yeast with a heavy note of smoke and meat (like a smoked ham). 

It tasted a little acidic and mildly malty and a little bitter with an intense smoky flavor from start to finish. The flavor lasted an extremely long time and all I could taste was the liquid smoke that was left behind on the taste buds. 

Mouthfeel was about half way to medium in body with a watery yet creamy texture and a soft carbonation. 

Overall a very different brew than what I am used to, it was kind of like drinking liquid smoke straight out of the bottle. I have had other Smoked Beers but none this intense. Needless to say, not all beers are for everyone and this one is definitely not for me!!
UPDATED: DEC 2, 2012 Such a classic beer. Amazing on tap at the taphouse. Bottled import version isnt as good. Though picking up bottles in Munich at a random store was nice and fresh.

Flaske 50 cl. Brun hælde med et orange skær, stort boblende nødebrunt hoved af middel til lang varighed. Aroma af røg, tobak,tjæret tovværk og røget bacon. Smagen er mest i retning af røg, men sød malt og noter af karamel fornemmes også. Lang afbalanceret røget eftersmag. Dejlig smags oplevelse.

Pours dark brown with greyish tan head. nice lacing. aroma of smoked bacon and toasted malts, leather and grains. medium body, clean and good carbonation. Tastes of smoked almonds, ham and malt. Slight bitterness on the finish. Interesting beer.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2012 Drunk a few times already, but now I finally get the chance to rate it!. Even while serving, the extreme and delicious smoke and ham flavor goes up to the nose!.It tastes just incredible smokey and thos ham/smoked salmon flavors are outstanding!. The aftertaste is exactly like the aroma of a "Schwarzwälder Schinken" (german ham speciality). Definitely the best smoked beer all over the world!!!

The beer gave me flashbacks to when I was a child. Playing in my grandpas den. That smokey smelling room burning with incense. The aroma is of an old cigar shop. Not my cup of tea, but for what the beer is trying to accomplish inside its category being Smoked it hits the mark. Not sure what this would pair well with in the direction of food. It has opened my eyes to a new kind of beer. I will try some others.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2012 Among the strongest smoke flavors as far as rauchbiers Ive had.  Some caramel and malts poke through to add some complexity.  Although this was very good, definitely have to be in the mood to have this.

500 ml bottle.  Served in a mug, the beer pours a clear ruby red/brown color with a couple inch frothy off-white head.  Head retention and lacing are both pretty good.  Aroma is mostly smoked meat/bacon, and some bready malt.  Taste is pretty much the same as the aroma, its mostly smoked meat and some roasted malt.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a little bit coating with decent carbonation.  Drinkability is pretty good, its very smooth and easy to drink.  This is one of the better rauchbiers Ive tried, and would definitely buy this again.  I thought it was a pretty good brew, I loved the smokiness in both the taste and aroma.

Holy muthafuckin shit!!! Whether there was something wrong with my bottle or my sense of taste is not right working, this beer is not drinkable. Smells like somebody had put in an exzessive intoxication massive of smoked ham in the beer. Almost I had to talk on the big white telephone. At first I drunk it cold. Ugly! But I had a spark of hope it gets better when I give it some time and let it warming. Nothing changed. I want my money back!
0.5l bottle at home. resin, roasty, earthy, black, minimal head, very bitter, salty, lively, sticky, medium body. Fairly distinct and okay.

50cl. bottle, pours black with red reflections, big off-white head, good lacing. aroma is dominated by smoke and dried meat. taste has a little metallic sourness, speck ham and fat  cream. dry bitter final. light bodied, smooth and milky texture.
this is my first Rauchbier, but Ive noticed too much smoke in comparison with other smoked biers

Brewed in the classic rauchbier tradition, this marzen has an incredible smoky nose and taste to match. The big hickory smoke bite reminds me of smoked bacon, sausage, etc., and theres a hint of malt and light hops as well.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2014 pours clear dark brown with a decent off-white head offering some retention and lacing. smoke, smoked pork, smoked malt, dense caramel and browned smoked malts - very good malt body, fruitiness- red skin ones, pepper, minerals. average carbonation, medium body - oily, woodsy-grassy-peppery finiah. tasty and good.

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours clear dark brown with a frothy tan to white head, aroma is malty and campfire smoke. The flavor is smoky bacon (I was actually told that this beer actually tastes like bacon, and it kind of does) and malt much like a porter, this is basically a smoky porter. Thankfully I love smoked beers and I love porters, this is excellent, not as good as the Norwegian wood, but still an interesting and complex beer. America has a few great smoked beers (Alaskan and Stone smoked porter) but those foreigners such as Norway and Germany know how to smoke a beer.

Bottle. Pours a brown color with a bubbly white head. Smells of bacon, smoke and paprika. Tastes of jerky, pork and apples. Very smooth and easy on the palate. Definitely an acquired taste thats great once you get used to it
Hodne zajimave tmave pivecko se zauzenou vuni i prichuti. Koupeno v pivonce.

500 mL bottle from Noble Green Wines poured into a pint glass.  Dark brown beer with a healthy head.  Not surprisingly its got a smokey aroma, its strong but not overpowering.  It certainly has character and has a nice first taste.  This works pretty well and is very palatable, you can also think of it as a stout.  To be half though, there arent many other flavours tucked away here, it wears its heart on its sleeve.  Good beer, certainly worth a go.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2011 When I was a kid I went camping with my friends and our dads every summer. This beer immediately brought back these memories. The nose reminds me of the musty old cabin we would sleep in. Old rotted wood, BBQ chips, and bonfire. The taste is meaty but not overly smokey. I think is about right for this style. Hickory, bacon, charcoal flavors are present. Smooth creamy body. Love it, especially paired with the right food.

Bottle.  First time on a traditional bottled smoked beer.  If  you are not used to a smoke beer the first sip does catch your palate unprepared for the hit of smoke.  But, the smoothness of the malts and slightly bitter end makes it a very easy beer to enjoy, especially great with food.
On tap at the brewery.  Classic example of smoked beer.  Dark brown with a nice head.   Drinkable smoked beer. Wasnt too much camp fire going on.
on tap at the brewery in bamberg, excellent smoked beer, dark with great head.  very drinkable smoked beer, had multiple in one sitting.

500ml bottle. Beautiful dark amber colour. Good aroma of smoke, like a smoked ham or bacon. Palate begins with smoke and malts, with the smoke following through to a nice bitter finish. Very nice if you like smoked goods!
10th January 2008  Dark mid brown beer. Noteably sweet malt start followed by inevitable smoke! Drinkable.
Bottle. Dark brown/orange with small tan head. Flavour is malt, roasted malts, little bitter and heavy smoked.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2012 Colore marrone scuro con schiuma beige. Aroma decisamente affumicato ( era ovvio), mia moglie dice di pesce affumicato... In bocca è molto equilibrata, con laffumicato che non prevale al palato, diciamo molto unica.

The best smokebeer Ive ever tried. Despite that, this beer become something very easy to find everywhere, making it more popular also between "common people", this is still my favourite.
The aroma is well balanced with respect to the smell and the taste. Very appreciable if drunk with smoked cheese too.
500ml bottle in a shaker.  Pours deep brown with a beige head.  Aroma of a barbecue sauce or camp fire.  Flavor of a malty, German beer with a lot of smokiness.  Really unique.

This is definitely one of the best beers that I have ever had. Coffee, roast, basement aromas. Brown Mahogany in color. Frothy, tan foam. Medium  bitterness,  full body, thick feel, with an abrupt finish.

Bottle. Dark brown/red with a large beige head leaving lacing. Aroma: lots of smoke and smoked meat, medwurst. Taste: smoke, sweet malt, caramel, smoked meat, campfire, some grapefruit and fruit, and a bit of salt. Medium-bodied, perhaps a bit more. Depends on your mood this one, sometimes its just right, sometimes too much. Great with a spicy veggie chili cooked with dark chocolate and lots of garlic.
Really good, well balanced beer. Nice head and rich aroma. Lots of enjoyable smoke in taste, good mouthfeel.

500 ml bottle. Pours a beautiful dark mahogany color with a large light beige colored head. A smooth smoked malt nose, some dry paper and campfire. The flavor is great; initially smoky with woodiness, a rich sweet malts, seems like some caramel pushes through. Very organic tasting. Surprisingly smooth and easy drinking for a beer with this much smoke. I need to visit Franconia!

03/10 0.5 l bottle from Vrutak store in Zagreb. It poured darker orange body with medium sized head. Very nice smoked aroma, I even imagined some ham and smoked cheese. Smoked malt is also felt in the flavor, its very nice, rustical yet elegant, harsh yet pleasant. Also, sweetish caramel and biscuit, with some herbal notes are present. Fuller and cloying in body with especially nice smoked and caramel malt finish. I really like this beer, making me thirst for more smoked ones.

Aroma of boot leather, horse mane, rotting chestnuts and mountains of salt. Has a well defined amber-black body with an excellent pillow of head on top, though modest. Its interesting that while so many North American beers look nearly the same, it tends to be slightly off one way or the other. There is just something that the Germans and Europeans manage that adds just an extra something to the experience. Flavour is very heavy like sucking on a german sausage filtered through pumpernickel. Meat, barley, dark German flavours dominate in a good way. Medium finish. Excellent, but not easy sipping - this is a meal unto itself.

Bouteille 500 ml. 5.1%. Couleur rousse foncé claire. Arômes de...fumée !. Assez intense comme nez, jambon fumé, bois, charbon. en bouche, malt fumé mais assez douce, ce qui est surprenant. Arrière goût de fumée très présent. Excellente Rauchbier.

Shared with the parents. Dark amber pour with a light fizzy head. Nose is cooked caramel candy and strongly dominated by smoke and reminds you of smoked bologna. Taste is similar. Strong smoked meats come through strong then fades to a solid malt character. Moderate carbonation and a medium body. Solid smoke beer though I prefer the urbock

Aroma is sweet smokey, oak, bacon, chocolate. Appearance is dark brown with medium white head. Taste is sweet caramel, smoke, oak, gamey pork, peat, chocolate, tangy. Palate is medium. Smoke and darker malts linger nicely. Overall the best Rauchbier I have had. Smoke is very present but not overpowering. Large flavor in a low alcohol beer...... very nice.

From 500 ml bottle, picked up from Heritage Liquors, Maplewood, MN, pours a semi-clear dark brown colored brew with an average sized off-white head that slowly dissipates to a white ring. Aroma of smoked caramel malt, a hint of Polish ham, floral hops and a hint of peat moss. Taste is medium bodied, plenty of smoked caramel malt and Polish ham (with gelatin) and a hint of roasted nuts. Finish is a touch on the sweet side with more smoked malt and pork aftertaste. Bottled is not bad, would love to try this brewery fresh in Bamberg.

Bottle-Pours a clear deep mahogany color, with a small off-white head. Has a nice wood smoke aroma with a hint of roasted malt. Has a wood smoke flavor with a nice touch of malty sweetness and a fairly dry finish.
Medium body, smooth and very well balanced. The smoke does does not overpower but seems to enhance the character of the beer. Great beer for the style. Easy drinker although I might tire of the smoke after a few. Well worth a try.
500ml bottle.  Pours dark brown with a large, tight head.  Aroma is ham and smoked wood, but not over powering.  Some ham to start.  Ham and smoke on the finish.

It has taken me a little while to get around to this one.  Very dark amber brown pour, small light tan head.  Ham, salted bacon, light smoke, and earthy malt.  Quite a nice smoked, if youre into that sort of thing.
Brown with quickly fading foam.  Rich smokey malt, sweet and a little sticky on the aftertaste.

Same that I said of Urbock: Dark brown beer with light brown head. Smoked ham and bacon aroma. Smoky and roasted malt flavour. Somewhat dry and sour. Drinking this is like consuming liquid smoked ham. 

How it differs from the Urbock: A little less smoky but has more salt and sea aroma. Also, maybe something vegetably in the aroma. The colour is lighter. Flavour has a bit of hay.

500ml bottle from SAQ. pours very dark brown with a beige head that leaves lots of lacing. aroma is very smoked, as is the taste. not much else going on here. body is thin for my liking. ive enjoyed other Smoked beers far more than i did this one.
Awful. Smells like smoked peat moss and tastes like licking a campfire or kissing a smoker.

My kind of beer, big flavour, light body, low alcohol. Dark brooding brown with a small to medium head. Smoke dominates the aroma. The taste is both flavourful and complex. Obviously smokey with a malty, sweet, nutty caramel underscore. Strong smoke on the long finish. The firm body is very pleasant. Id drink this all day, actually I think I just might.
One of my favorites.  Great earthy and long smokey taste which dwells in ones mouth for good time.
rökig men inte så spännande. Ganska lätt att dricka  en öl som inte ligger på minnet särskilt länge.

On-Tap at Zenos Pub.  Pours a dark, but transparent color with a light brown head, some lacing, but disappeared quickly.  Smells smokey with some wood, a very smokey stout.  Bacon? Caramel malts up front, but that subsides into a wonderful smoked bacon taste. I was quite surprised.  Dark and decent heavy on the mouth, carbonation was masked for me. Very smooth drink with lots of smokey meat and malty tones.  My palate was pretty confused after drinking this, I probably couldnt have more than a pint at a time.  Overall a very, very good beer. This was the first of this style I have ever tried, and wow did it impress.

The most intensely smoky beer Ive experienced.  Pours mid-dark brown with good size head that lingers for a bit.  Aroma dominated by intense wood-smoke - campfire, I like to describe it.  Tasting reveals a more complex profile - smoke is most definitely there, but its supported by sweet caramelly malts.  Great.

500 ml bottle from The Royale.  Pours a beautiful clear deep maple brown color with a small khaki head.  Aroma of hickory smoked pork, roasted malts, toast- almost smells like Lil Smokies.  Flavor of smoked meat, copper, and burnt toast.  Medium-bodied, with average carbonation and a smoky, somewhat metallic mouthfeel.  If it werent for the little bit of coppery metal I was getting from this, I would have liked it a lot more, as it has just the right amount of smoke.  Still a very cool beer.
Bottle. Aroma is straight smoke and peat. Ridiculously smoky in a good way. Easily the smokiest rauchbier Ive encountered.

50cl bottle.
Very good white foam.  Amber brown colour.  Smokey flavour.  Tastes like liquid smokey bacon crisps

Very amazed with this beer. Was told that tastes like kind of campfire flavour and they were not lying. It has that smokey taste, kind of like a smoked pork meat. Really unique taste. Very plesant and smooth to drink. Doesnt bite like a lot of german beers, but yet has a great smokey flavour to it. It has a brownish colour with taned head. It has a light carbonation , yet it doesnt hurt the taste. Aftertaste is pleasant, and it lingers in your mouth for a bit.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2010 editted because of typo15/10/2010 - 50cl bottle @ Klaas place Thanks to Klaas for the bottle! 
Pours a clear dark brown beer with a little beige head, dissipating quickly. Aroma has smoked bacon and ham. Probably because its my first Rauchbier, but thats all I can get out of it... :( MF has ok carbonisation, thin body and somewhat watery texture. Taste holds roasted malts and caramel. Aftertaste has coffee bitter, mocha and smoke.

Dark brown ruby colour. Light brown "dirty" head. Aroma is...well...smoke of course. Bacon. But also fermented fruit, leather and wood. Mouthfeel has a nice carbonated tingle. Taste is again smoke, a bit of herbs, malt, but also something a bit like stale dirty water. My first encounter with this style. Its ok and would be interesting with some foods.

(draught 0,5l)
